loans.name: Thoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Thoeun E., 58, and his wife, Mrs. Dy Keo, 46, have been married since 1987 and have two sons and four daughters. Three of their children are in school, and two work in a garment factory. They live in a suburb about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Thoeun has been working in district offices since 2002, while his wife has been working in a garment factory. Thoeun is requesting a loan, his first, of 500 USD to purchase a motorbike for his children to ride to school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for his children to get to school.

loans.name: Kry

texts.en:
Mr. Kry Y., age 58, and his wife, Mrs. Long Hor, age 52, are farmers. They grow cucumbers. Besides farming, Kry is also a fisherman. He is applying for his first loan of $1,000 to buy cows for his farming business.

Mr. Kry Y. and his wife live along National Road No. 1 about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1979 and have nine children: four sons and five daughters. Three children are married and live outside the family home, one is a garment factory worker, and the other three are in school.

loans.use: To buy cows for his farming business

loans.name: Maria Alejandra

texts.es: Maria Alejandra tiene 48 años de edad, su actividad económica es brindar el brindar el servicio de costura, hace mas de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que aprendió este oficio como un medio de trabajo, a pesar de los años ella logro alcanzar la fama necesaria y obtener muy buenos clientes que llegaban a encargarle algunas hechuras de vestidos y trajes para niños, además la calidad de sus prendas están garantizadas. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de hilos, telas, tijeras, agujas, encajes y cintas. Ella sueña con establecer un taller más grande que genere empleos a otras personas que les guste este oficio.
texts.en:
Maria Alejandra is 48 years old. For more than 20 years she has worked as a seamstress, a skill she learned in order to work on her own. She has been successful at promoting her business and has good customers, who hire her to make dresses and children's clothing. The quality of her work is guaranteed. She asks for financing for working capital to purchase thread, fabric, scissors, needles, lace, and ribbons. She would like to set up a larger workshop, to generate employment for others who like this type of work.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Vugar

texts.en: Vugar is 23 years old. He is married and has two children. His family live in the Fuzuli region. This young man has been in this business for two years. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy clothes to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Rebecca's Group

texts.en:
Rebecca G. is from the village of Luna in Roxas, Isabela. She is 52 years old. Rebecca is the leader of a 10-member loan group sponsored by ASKI. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Rebecca is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rebecca owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Rebecca has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Rebecca joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rebecca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be Rebecca's 5th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Chantal

texts.fr: Chantal T. est une femme de 55 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de MBORO depuis 10 ans et a 2o fois de suite bénéficié de prêt. Avec son crédit elle développe un petit commerce de viande de porcs et d'une boutique installée à domicile. Son objectif est de subvenir aux besoins familiaux et d'aider son mari à la prise en charge de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Chantal T. is a 55-year-old woman, married and mother of six children. She has been a member ot the MBORO “Banc Villageois” loan group for the past ten years and was granted two successive loans. Her loan allowed her to develop a small business selling pork meat and a home-based store. Her objective is to meet family expenses and assist her husband in providing for their children.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her small business

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en:
Noralyn G. is from the village of  Malinao, Gingoog City. She is 38 years old, married, and has 3 school-aged children. Noralyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Noralyn has been involved in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Noralyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Noralyn is requesting her first loan, for 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Misioneras Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal "Las Misioneras de La Cascada" son parte del centro focal de la Cascada, desean iniciar su primer ciclo como asociación comunal.
Son once mujeres las integrantes de la asociación comunal Las Misioneras, en la foto falta la señora Martha O. quien tuvo que ir a recoger a su pequeña hija del colegio.
Los negocios que han declarado las socias son: venta de ropa, venta de verduras, venta de gelatina, venta de calzados, venta de comida, venta de pollo frito, tienda de barrio y encuadernación.
La señora María Antonieta A. es la presidenta de la asociación, con 53 años de edad ella está  llena de energía y buen ánimo;  casada, durante su matrimonio tuvo 7 hijos, de los cuales ahora 5 ya están casados y 2 aún solteros, están bajo su cuidado.  El negocio que desarrolla es el de vender ropa a pedido, es decir que ella compra la ropa que le piden sus clientes, al contado y lo dá a sus clientes en vaR. pagos con un pequeño interés. Este negocio le fue enseñado por un familiar.  Su solicitud para este ciclo es de Bs.2000.- y le servirá para responder con rapidez a los pedidos que reciba de sus clientes.  Ella refiere que tiene clientes en la zona donde vive y también, en otras zonas en la ciudad de El Alto y La Paz.
Cuando ya tiene los pedidos, viaja al Departamento de Oruro para hacer una compra por mayor o si los pedidos son pocos se dirige a La Ciudad de La Paz.
texts.en:
The communal association "Las Misioneras de La Cascada" is part of the focal center of la Cascada. They wish to start their first cycle as a communal association. There are eleven women who are members of the "Misioneras" communal association. Missing in the photo is Martha O. who had to go to collect her young daughter from school. The businesses that the members have stated are: sale of clothing, vegetables, jelly, shoes, food, fried chicken, a neighborhood shop and bookbinding. María Antonieta A. is the president of the association. She is 53 years old and is full of energy and good cheer. She is married with 7 children from this marriage, 5 who are already married and 2 that are still single and under her care. The business that she is developing is selling clothes to order, which means she buys clothes that her clients ask her for, with cash and she charges her clients in several payments with a little interest. She was taught this business by a relative. Her request for this cycle is for Bs.2000.- and to service it she will respond quickly to the orders that she receives from her clients. She says that she has clients in the area where she lives and also in other areas of the city of El Alto and La Paz. When she has enough orders, she travels to the Oruro department to purchase wholesale or if the orders are small she goes to La Paz city.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothes to order

loans.name: Tzucubal 2 Group

texts.es: El Grupo de Tzucubal NO.2 Acuden a la Asociaciòn ASDIR para pedir el apoyo para incrementar sus capitales ya que ellas se dedican a la compra y venta de ropa tipica nueva y usada para venderlos a otros lugares de la republica de Guatemala y con ello ganan para el sustento de cada dìa, y mantienen a sus familias  y por eso piden la ayuda  para capitalizar y comprar màs mercaderia y tener surtido las ventas y asi poder ganar màs.-
texts.en:
The Group Tzucubal No. 2 is turning to ASDIR to request support in increasing their working capital. They buy and sell typical regional clothing, either new or used. Their sales are in other parts of Guatemala. This is the way they support themselves and their families, for this reason they ask for financial support, to be able to purchase more merchandise and thus increase their income.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria es una señora de 44 años de edad, Maria es soltera y tiene su vivienda propia. Maria se dedica a la venta de comidas, refrescos y otros frente de la plaza principal de la cuidad donde vive. Maria tiene bastantes años de experiencia en este rubro y su competencia es baja  ya que por la zona no hay muchos lugares de venta de comidas y otros alimentos que ella ofrece, además que ya cuenta con clientela fija que la busca por su calidad y buen servicio. Maria destinó el crédito para comprar una heladera, precisamente para guardar verduras  y carnes, productos que los requiere en buen estado para elaborar los alimentos de una manera más fresca y sana. Maria ha pagado puntualmente en Agrocapital, y además tiene una deuda que está vigente en otra entidad financiera mismas que también las paga de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Maria is a 44 year old woman; she is single and lives in her own home. Maria sells food, refreshments and other goods in the central city square where she lives. Maria has many years of experience in her work and has little competition since there aren’t many places that sell food and other items that she sells in her area. She also has a steady customer base that seeks her services for the quality and service that she offers. Maria will use the loan to buy a refrigerator to store vegetables and meats so that they can be fresh and safe for consumption. Maria has been punctual with her payments to Agrocapital (Kiva’s field partner) and she also has debt with another financial organization that she also pays promptly.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: God's Blessing Group

texts.en:
Gertrude S. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God’s Blessing. She is 38 years-old and married with two children who are each 10 years-old.  Due to poverty, Mrs. S. was only able to attend school through 12th grade.

For six years, Mrs. S. has been running a mini cinema business in Paynesville on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.  She says customers are attracted by her business because of the new and good movies she offers which make customers return.  She plans to use her 8,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 38,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy additional new movies.  Her goal is to grow her business and to continue to support her children so that they can have a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Gertrude is the one holding the sign. Stanley B. is inset in the lower right.

loans.use: To buy new movies.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower from Lebanon is 22 years old. He is engaged and currently lives alone; his parents have passed away. He has been working as an electrician for the past four years. He generally takes projects in private homes. He works independently as a freelance electrician. The loan officer notes that he has a good reputation for his work in his community. 

He is requesting a $1000 loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. He plans to use the loan to invest in new tools for his business. This will be his first loan from Ameen.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.). Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loan from Kiva to offer lower interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling US $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit: http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To invest in new tools for his business

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis C., reside en El Municipio del El Transito Departamento de San Miguel, tiene 48 años  vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 26 y 23 años respectivamente, se dedica a la agricultura (Siembra de Maíz).
Don Luis se dedica a la agricultura hace 35 años, y de la edad de 11 años su padre le enseño el trabajo, actualmente el se ha dedicado a sembrar maíz  con ayuda de uno sus hijos, el se encuentra con la dificultad de no tener el dinero para la compra de semilla y abono, por los que se ha visto  con la necesidad de solicitar este préstamo, compraría ( semilla de maíz, Abono) y así  sembrar para obtener una cosecha venderla, lograr ganancias para cancelar su deuda, ayudar a su familia para solventar las necesidades de alimentación y otras.
Luis es una persona luchadora, acostumbrada a trabajar y sacrificarse por su familia, sus aspiraciones son ampliar más el cultivo y obtener una buena cosecha comercializarla y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Luis C. lives in the municipality of El Transito in the department of San Miguel. He is 48 years old and lives with his wife and two children, aged 26 and 23. Luis works in agriculture. He has been in this work for 35 years. His father taught him at the age of 11. Today, Luis grows corn with the help of one of his sons. At this time, he cannot afford to buy seeds and fertilizer, so he has applied for this loan. After harvesting and selling his crop, he will be able to pay off the loan, as well as provide necessities for his family. Luis is a fighter, accustomed to working and sacrificing for his family. His goals are to increase his production and obtain a good harvest. This will improve the quality of life for his family.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy seed and fertilizer for corn crop

loans.name: Claudia Maria

texts.es: Claudia Maria tiene 33 años, ella se dedica a la venta de pollo, embutidos entre otros productos. Hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio, lo inicio con su Mama con una pequeña pulpería con el tiempo logro hacerse cargo personalmente del negocio pues con mucho esmero y esfuerzo que ha depositado en este negocio ha logrado sacar adelante esta actividad. Este crédito será para comprar pollo, salchichas, entre otras cosas. En un futuro desea establecer su negocio en donde circulen muchos clientes.
texts.en: Claudia Maria is 33 years old. For more than 4 years she has been selling different products, notably chicken and sausages. She started this business with her mother, running a small corner shop, and in time she succeeded in taking personal charge of the shop, and with the great care and effort she has put into her business she has succeeded in getting her shop off the ground. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy chicken and sausages among other products. In the future she wishes to set up her shop in an area with many customers. [[[Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy core products

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy D. R. aims to graduate her four children from college and to improve the standard of living for her family. When she joined ASHI in 2007, the vision of her hopes becomes clearer and reachable instead of an uncertain feeling towards achieving her dreams. Because of the loan she has receive through ASHI, she and her husband are able to have their own small upholstery shop in their own house. While Lucy is in charge of managing the cash flow of the business as well as the budget of the family, her husband is the one in charge to operating the business. With their small cash flow in the business, Lucy cannot afford yet to employ other people to work with her husband. Sometimes she feels unhappy seeing her husband work so hard from early in the morning to the end of the day however, with her husband’s determination to help her improve their life and to provide the needs of her children, she regains strength. 

With the loan Lucy is requesting from KIVA, an ASHI partner, she hopes to grow her business until such time as she can afford to employ other workers and rent a space for her shop in the market to be able to acquire more costumers. She must also support the education and other needs of her children.

loans.use: To purchase materials and equipments for upholstery.

loans.name: Sourn

texts.en:
Sourn C., 55, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known for being the most populated part of the country. C. is a food seller, earning an income of $7 US per day. Her husband is in the military, earning an income of $6 per day. 

C. is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase supplements to expand the food selling business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy more supplements to expand a food selling business

loans.name: Strong Brothers #1. Group

texts.en:
Rufus T., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Strong Brothers #1. Rufus is 34 years old, single and has two children who are between the ages of 3 and 13 years old.  He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of financial support. 

For 4 years, he has been selling bread and juice on Water Street in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 8,500 Liberian Dollars portion of this 41,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more cartons of juice and bread. He describes himself as easy-going. His goal is to grow his business and educate his children.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of juice and bread.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “MANOS JUNTAS”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac, perteneciente a la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Norma;  Ella tiene 38 años de edad,  y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia se dedica al comercio, ella tiene su stand en el molino y vende ropa y cosméticos,  Ella cada cierto tiempo viaja a Lima o Bolivia a comprar productos de belleza, tipo lápices de cejas, delineadores, rímel, ganchitos y ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para  invertir en mercadería y pasajes.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Norma belongs to the communal bank "Manos Juntas." This bank is located in the Huanchac district, which is part of the province and department of Cusco. Norma is 38 years old, married, and has 3 children. She has a retail business where she sells clothing and cosmetics from a stand in the El Molino market. At times she travels to Lima or Bolivia to buy beauty products including eyebrow pencils, eyeliners, mascara, hair clips and clothing. She requests a loan to invest in merchandise and use for travel expenses. Norma appreciates and values the loan, and as such she promises to comply strictly with the established payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in merchandise and travel expenses for her clothing and cosmetics business

loans.name: La Esquinita Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario La Esquinita está integrado por Mirna Lorena L. Elías, Arianne Liceth Gudiel Sánchez y Rosario del Socorro R.. Mirna, quien es coordinadora, posee en su casa de habitación una pulpería que inició hace 8 años vendiendo pan y algunas verduras. Su sueño es verse a sí misma y a sus hijos en prosperidad.

Arianne, vende por catálogo ropa íntima y productos ZERMAT; en cambio Rosario, se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano y productos de AVON, a la vez tiene una mini venta de verduras en su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
The La Esquinita solidarity group is made up of Mirna Lorena L. Elías, Arianne Liceth Gudiel Sánchez and Rosario del Socorro R.. Mirna, who is the coordinator, has a general store in her home, which she started 8 years ago selling bread and some vegetables. Her dream is to see herself and her children in prosperity. Arianne sells lingerie and ZERMAT products through a catalogue. Rosario sells second-hand clothing and AVON products. She also has a small vegetable sales business in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of products

loans.name: Dinanga Plus Group

texts.en:
“Dinanga Plus” is a group of 24 owners of small businesses chaired by Rodrigues. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Rodrigues has been selling second hand clothing since 2004. She started her business selling tea and coffee. Over the years, her business prospered through determination and hard work, and she has been able to build a loyal customer base that has stabilized her business. With good management and savings, Rodrigues has been able to increase her working capital today. She sells at the market located in the eastern area of Kinshasa and her business makes $50 per week. She is confident with her business and she is determined to someday be a second hand clothing importer and provider in DRC in general and Kinshasa in particular. Rodrigues is 35 years old, married, and has three children between the ages 2 and 8. Two of them go to school.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of second hand clothing to resell at a profit

loans.name: Hady

texts.fr: Monsieur Hady T. est âgé de 33 ans ,il est gérant de mercerie à Thiadiaye situé à quelques trente kilomètres de Mbour.Monsieur T. possède une cantine au niveau du marché de Thiadiaye depuis quelques années où il exerce son activité. Ainsi, pour faire face au besoin des couturiers surtout dans les périodes de fêtes il vient solliciter ce crédit pour augmenter son fonds de commerce et répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle
texts.en: Mr. Hady T., aged 33, is the manager of a sewing supplies shop in Thiadiaye, located about 30 km from Mbour.  For a few years now, Mr. T. has had a sT. at the Thiadiaye market, where he operates his business.  So, to meet the needs of tailors and seamstresses, especially during holiday periods, he is here to request this loan for increasing his business capital and for responding to customer needs.

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en:
This is Eleuteria P., 51, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Gabriel P., an electrician, and is the mother of three children, two of whom are already working and settled down with their own families while the youngest will graduate from high school at the end of the school year. By the grace of God, Eleuteria has managed to support her older children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to send her youngest to college. A dream for most Filipino parents like Eleuteria as she herself was once a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can leave to their children.

Eleuteria operates a canteen and a small variety store and oversees the operations of a gown-for-rent business. In the Philippines, the whole working community and majority of families only eat home-cooked meals during the evening when all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal way of living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one or two people when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy greater quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Eleuteria dreams to be able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have her house renovated by the end of the year. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction supplies

loans.name: Nhagn

texts.en:
Nhagn P. is a 47-year-old village chief. He lives with his wife in the Takeo province of Cambodia. He and his wife have four children, one of whom is employed in the construction industry.

He explains that, on average, he earns $2 per day. His wife is a farmer (she grows rice and vegetables), and she typically earns $3 per day. Nhagn is now seeking a loan in the amount of $1,125 to raise pigs.

loans.use: To start a pig-raising business

loans.name: Leng's Group

texts.en:
Five people form this group loan.  They all live in Preaek Samraong village, Kandal province.  The group selected Leng S., 58, as its president.  Members will use their portion of the loan to support different purposes. 

Leng earns her living by selling groceries and vegetables in the local village.  She decided to ask for a loan to buy a store and more vegetables to sell.  Her husband, Thun, stays at home and also helps his wife.  They have five children; one is employed in a casino club, another is a laborer and the others are students who also help their mother.

loans.use: To buy a store for selling grocery and vegetable.

loans.name: Muong

texts.en: Muong S., 31 years old, lives with her family in the province of Kampong Chhnang in Cambodia. Her husband is a local farmer and they have five children. For over two years, she has been working in the rice trade business, collecting rice from farmers and re-selling it to earn income. She currently earns an average of $3.50 per day. She believes her investment is doing well because she is gaining more regular customers. This business is her main source of stable income for the family. In order to continue improving the business, she is asking for a loan to buy additional rice to sell in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional rice to sell in the future.

loans.name: Bachir

texts.en:
Bachir is a 27-year-old single man from Tayouneh, owner of a men's & women's clothing shop since 2006, with 12 years of experience in this field. Bachir’s products are of good quality, and most of his customers are his friends, neighbors and relatives. His customers like to visit his shop on a weekly basis, to find out if he has brought new styles. He always works on renewing his product line as well as slightly changing the decoration of his shop. 

Bachir is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy new lines of clothing for the festive seasons because most of his customers ask for something different for such occasions. Bachir hopes to open more branches in nearby areas.

loans.use: To buy new styles for the festive seasons

loans.name: Severina

texts.en:
Severina is an entrepreneur from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is married and has 5 children. Her eldest is 22 years old while the youngest is only 6. Severina owns and manages a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells products like milk, soap, canned goods and many other things. Severina hopes to expand her store. She says she needs to work hard, especially since 4 of her children go to school now.

Severina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Severina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
Elmira C. is from the village of Danao. She is 28 years old. Elmira is married and has one school-aged child. 

To make a living, Elmira owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Elmira has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Elmira joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Elmira has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. 

Elmira is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Elmira from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Robert Wiliam

texts.es: CLIENTE RECURRENTE TIENE 31 AÑOS DE EDAD CUENTA CON DOS HIJIOS EN EDAD ESCOLAR UNO DE 15 Y OTROS DE 5 AÑOS ES SEPARADO CUENTA CON CASA PROPIA SE DEDICA AL SERVICIO DE TRANSPORTE CUENTA CON UN CARRO PROPIO NO TIENE NIVEL DE ENDEUDAMIENTO SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA REALIZARLE MANTENIMIENTO A SU CARRO Y REALIZARLE LA CONVERSION A GAS
texts.en:
Robert is a returning client. He is 31 years old and has two school age children (ages 15 and 5). Robert is separated from his spouse and has his own home. He provides transportation services using his own car.

Robert does not have any debts. He is requesting a loan to maintain his automobile and convert it to run on natural gas.

loans.use: Pay for vehicle maintenance & conversion to natural gas

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es: El Sr. José Manuel G. B. él es trabajador activo de la Empresa “Alcaldía Municipal de San Rafael del Sur” desempeñándose como Guarda de Seguridad tiene seis   años  de trabajar para esta institución  es casado actualmente, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  siete créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno los ha  realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción como Arena, Cemento, Piedra, Piedrín, Bloques etc. Para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le ha beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esta manera el ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Mr. Jose Manuel Garcia B. is an active employee of the municipal city hall of San Rafael del Sur, working as a security guard. He has six years working for this organization. He is married and he has two school-aged children. He has had seven past loans with Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) and each one has bee used to purchase construction materials such as sand, cement, rocks, gravel, construction blocks etc., in order to expand and improve his house. The loans granted to him by Ceprodel have been a great help because he has been able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as sand, cement, and rocks

loans.name: Lovely

texts.en:
Lovely F. is a 20-year-old, married woman from the village of Bangkal, Aguada, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She and her husband have one child, who is an infant. To earn a living, Lovely operates a sari-sari (i.e., variety) store, where she sells goods directly to her local community members. Lovely has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2010, Lovely joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) to gain much-needed access to financial services. As a result, she was better able to engage in business activities and to improve her family's standard of living. Lovely is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP ($125), which would be used as additional capital for her business. This would be the second loan taken out by Lovely from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC: PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To expand her business operations

loans.name: Faisal

texts.en:
Faisal is a 20-year-old man. He was able to open a small restaurant with his father that serves sandwiches and delicious dishes such as like "homos" (chickpea paste) and "fool" (broad beans) and "falafel".

Faisal has been working at the restaurant for almost two years now and has gained a lot of experience during this time. In order to expand and improve the restaurant, he applied for this loan to buy new equipment such as a larger fridge as a first step toward achieving his purpose.

loans.use: To buy new refrigerator for his restaurant.

loans.name: Augusto

texts.es:
Augusto tiene 60 años de edad, es casado y vive en casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de Pacora, distrito poblado por gente trabajadora, emprendedora y pujante. El distrito está ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.
La actividad a la que se dedica el titular es la agricultura, específicamente el cultivo de maíz amarillo duro. El producto final lo comercializa en el mercado mayorista llamado Moshoqueque.  Los ingresos que percibe por la venta es utilizado para mantener a su hogar.
Augusto desea comprar fertilizantes para su cultivo.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Augusto is 60 years old, married, and lives in his own home located in the Pacora district, an area populated by hard-working, enterprising and thriving people.  The district is located about 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque department.

Augusto works in agriculture, specifically the cultivation of hard yellow corn.  He sells the final product in the wholesale market of Moshoqueque.  The income he earns from the sale is used to maintain his home.

Augusto wants to purchase fertilizers for his crop, so he decided to obtain a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas C. is a humble woman who is shown in the photograph in front of her wooden house. She is blessed with a child who is enrolling in school. 

Meas C. is a Khmer noodle maker, earning approximately $2.50 per day. Her husband works with her to make the noodles. They sell their noodles to other retailers in her area. Aside from this, she also built a small pigpen where she raises pigs for additional income. Meas C. is requesting a loan to purchase rice to stock up for producing Khmer noodles to sell

loans.use: to purchase rice for Khmer noodle production

loans.name: Konul

texts.en:
Konul  is 32 years old and is a very good entrepreneur. She is single and lives with her parents. She has five years of experience in selling women's clothing.  

After her university degree, Konul decided to start her own business and not depend on anyone.  She started with very little merchandise, but little by little her business grew and she started to sell clothes with excellent results.  

Konul is very clear about the key to success in her business. She knows it is the variety of products that she offers, because if a client is looking for something that she does not have, he or she may never return. For this reason, she tries to be fully stocked.  

Konul is requesting a loan of 1300 AZN to purchase merchandise and new clothes for the season.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes to sell

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is 29 years old. She has three children who are between the ages of one and nine years old; her husband is a driver. Asia sells different kinds of children's clothes in the market. She lays her clothes down for clients to easily see them. Asia has been doing this business for five years, and it has enabled her pay school fees for her children. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more items and expand her business to make more profits. With the profits she hopes to make she plans to put aside some savings.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.es: Guillerma es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun, se dedica a la venta de carne, el préstamo que solicita lo va a invertir en la compra de carne para su negocio. Gracias a las reuniones de su Banco Comunal en FINCA Perú ha aprendido como tratar a los miembros de su familia y como manejar adecuadamente su negocio. El sueño de Guillerma es construir su casa con los ahorros que FINCA Perú le ha ayudado a crear. Ella ha estado con FINCA Perú desde 1999. A través de las sesiones de capacitación que ofrece FINCA Perú ha aprendido a ahorrar, ser puntuales, devolver los préstamos y cómo ser responsables.
texts.en:
Guillerma is a member of the Wiñarisun community bank.  Her business is selling meat.  She will invest the loan that she is requesting in buying meat for her business.  Thanks to her community bank meetings with FINCA Peru, Guillerma has learned how to treat members of her family and how to manage her business properly.

Guillerma's dream is to build her own home with the savings that FINCA Peru have helped her to build up.  She has been working with FINCA Peru since 1999.  Through the training sessions that they offer, she has learned how to save, how to be punctual, how to pay back her loans and how to be responsible.

loans.use: to buy meat

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a married mother of 9 children, three of whom are currently attending school. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 10 years in her hometown in western Kenya. Her farm is currently producing milk and eggs which are all sold locally. She mainly depends on the income from her farm to cater for the basic needs of her family.

Betty has made her fourth loan request of 81,600 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She hopes that with the dairy cow she will acquire, her family will be guaranteed enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. She faces the challenges of the high cost of artificial insemination and the high cost of animal feeds, which affects her production. She plans to acquire 3 dairy cows, a posho mill (used to grind maize into meal) and a motorcycle in the next 5 years to enable her to expand her farm.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ziporah

texts.en:
Ziporah is 38 years old and married with three children.  She does tailoring, has employed three people, and has been in the business for seven years.  She runs her business in a competitive environment and is able to retain her customers because of her good customer-care skills and good services.  Thanks to Faulu Kenya for training in customer-care skills.

Ziporah hopes to grow her business within five years.  She needs 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy fabric.

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Santos Ester

texts.es: La señora Santos una mujer de 63 años de edad, de la comunidad de Rio Grande - Pueblo Nuevo, casada y con cinco hijos, trabaja la tierra desde muy temprana edad. Ella tiene tres manzanas de tierras las cuales las utiliza para la siembra de granos básicos (Frijol). Solicitó su crédito para la compra de insumos y asi darle mantenimiento a dos manzanas de frijoles de las tres que posee, pero también para poder comprar un vaca parida. En un futuro desea incrementar la siembra de frijoles y que sus hijos se preparen pero que también sigan trabajando la tierra que con tanto esfuerzo ha sacado adelante
texts.en: Mrs. Santos, 63, is from the community of Rio Grande - Pueblo Nuevo.  She is married, has five children, and has worked as a crop farmer from the time she was very young.  She has three patches of land where she grows beans.  The loan she is requesting is to buy supplies and provide maintenance for two of the three bean patches she has.  She also wants to buy a dairy cow.  In the future she wants to increase her bean crop and have her children get an education, even though they will continue farming the land she has worked hard to make successful.

loans.use: To buy supplies and a dairy cow.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is an optimistic 35-year-old business lady. She is married and blessed with two children who are going to school. She has been offering hotel services for the last two years to meet the needs of her family. She makes an extra shilling by selling groceries. Previously, she used to run a retail shop. She wants in the next five years to be able to meet her clients' needs comfortably.

She is requesting a loan of 9,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a solar lamp. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her financial status.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: El Cedral Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama El Cedral está conformado por la señora Irma va a comprar con su préstamo pan, la señora Lucia va a comprar una máquina para rasurar, gama de tintes, secadora y cepillos, la señora Adriana Berenice va a comprar de paquetes de cosméticos  de Jafra y Mary Kay, la señora Mónica va a comprar aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, focos, huevo, jabón, café, refrescos para surtir su tienda, la señora Bertha va a comprar puercos lechones y alimento para engordarlos y venderlos. La señora Lucia tiene 29 años de edad, ella estudio hasta el 3er. año de secundaria, ella es casada, su esposo trabaja en el campo y cuando no hay trabajo en el campo, trabaja como ayudante de albañil, ellos no tienen hijos, ella tiene una estética, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar una máquina para cortar el cabello, una secadora,  una plancha y algunos líquidos y tintes para el cabello, ella inicio su negocio hace un año, aprendió en un curso que tomo en una localidad vecina de parte del ayuntamiento, inicio con pocas cosas con sus ahorros de las ventas de tlacoyos (mexican snack), ella del diario sale a vender sus tlacoyos de aba, requesón y frijol en el centro de la comunidad donde ella vive, su negocio es importante porque le gusta lo que hace y le genera ingresos, ella se siente orgullosa cuando pinta el cabello, hace chinos o peinados y a la gente le gusta como le queda, sus clientes son familiares, amigos y vecinos de la comunidad, ella está planeando ampliar su negocio comprar todos los insumos, mobiliario y materiales necesario para trabajar para proporcionar a sus clientes mayores comodidades y los servicios que soliciten, ella lo piensa lograr esforzándose, ahorrando y con el préstamo va a surtirse de todos los materiales. Las ganancias las utiliza en gastos para la casa y para volver a invertir, ella está feliz con este préstamo que va a recibir porque  va a adquirir algunos productos de los que necesita su estética. Los integrantes del grupo quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “estamos muy agradecidas con ustedes y felices de que nos puedan ayudar, ojala sigan ayudando a más personas  con sus préstamos podemos crecer los negocios y las familias”.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called El Cedral. Of its members, Señora Irma is going to buy bread with her loan; Señora Lucia is going to buy an electric razor, a set of dyes, a dryer, and brushes; Señora Adriana Berenice is going to buy packages of Jafra and Mary Kay cosmetics; Señora Monica is going to buy oil, sugar, toilet paper, light bulbs, eggs, soap, coffee, and soft drinks to stock her store; Señora Bertha is going to buy suckling pigs, fatten them and sell them.

Señora Lucia is 29 years old. She attended school up to the third year of secondary school. She is married. Her husband works in the fields, and when there is no work in the fields, he works as an assistant to a bricklayer. They do not have children. She has a beauty salon. She is applying for the loan to buy electric clippers for haircutting, a dryer, an iron, and various liquids and dyes for hair. She began her business a year ago. She learned in a course from the municipality that she took nearby. She began with a few things with her savings from selling tlacoyos (a Mexican snack). Every day she went out to sell her tlacoyos of fava beans, cheese curds, and kidney beans in the center of the community where she lives. Her business is important because she likes what she does and it generates income for her. She feels proud when she dyes hair, curls it, or does hairdos and the customer likes the result. Her clients are relatives, friends, and neighbors from the community. She is planning to expand her business and to buy all the supplies, furniture and materials necessary for her work, to give her customers better comfort and the services that they request. She thinks she will succeed by making an effort and saving, and with the loan she is going to stock up on all the materials. She will use the earnings for household expenses and to reinvest in her business. She is happy to be receiving the loan because she is going to acquire some products that she needs in her salon.

The members of the group want to say to Kiva and to Fundación Realidad, "We are very grateful to you and happy that you can help us. May you continue helping more people. With your loans we can grow our businesses and our families."

loans.use: to buy electric clippers for cutting hair, a dryer, an iron, and liquids and dyes for hair.

loans.name: Bilqees' Group

texts.en:
Bilqees is 51 years old, married and has seven children. All of them are young and do different kinds of work to financially contribute to the family. Bilqees supports her family by stitching clothes for her nearby clients.  She is very skillful and receives regular orders every month. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the betterment of her son’s busienss. Her son runs a barber shop in the market. His clients come from long distances because he is very popular among them for his good services. With the loan, he will buy scissors for cutting hair and shaving material to provide even better services to his customers. He will also increase the seating arrangements for his customers by purchasing some chairs. 
He has been operating his business for the past 10 years and Bilqees is hopeful that after the loan investment his business will expand.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Bilqees.

loans.use: To buy scissors, shaving material & some chairs

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia tiene 40 años, es una mujer muy amable, alegre y trabajadora, convive con su pareja con quien es madre de dos hijos de 18 y 14 años, quienes dependen de ella para terminen de estudiar. Juntos viven en casa de su madre junto a ella a quien acompañan y brindan los cuidado necesarios. Alicia, tiene un trabajo muy pesado, se dedica a la venta de carne de cerdo en una mercado local (mercado Bellavista). Ella se levanta muy temprano para ir al matadero de cerdo, en donde ya un día antes deja haciendo el pedido correspondiente, de ahí lleva la carne de cerdo a su puesto ubicado en la cuadra 6 del mercado, antes se dedicaba a la venta de pescado pero como le gusta iniciar con nuevos retos, emprendió con el trabajo que hasta ahora sigue realizando, trabaja sola y lleva ya ocho años en este trabajo. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene siempre a su lado compañeros de ventas buenos y amables y que siempre están a la expectativa de lo que sucede, el negocio le va bien, y espera mas adelante poner una bodega en su casa para que así sus hijos le ayuden en los ingresos del hogar. Este será el crédito número doce con MFP, el grupo que conforma le agrada mucho ya que son muy responsables y siempre están cumpliendo. Agradece la oportunidad que le dieron para poder aumentar su inversión y espera poder seguir trabajando para así progresar. Con el monto solicitado, comprará carne para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Alicia is 40 years old and is a very happy, friendly and hard-working woman.  She lives with her partner with whom she has two children, ages 18 and 14.  Her children as still dependent on her so they can finish their studies.  They live together in her mother's house as they provide her with the companionship and the care she needs.  

Alicia has a very difficult job.  She sells pork at the local market (Bellavista market).  She gets up very early to go to the slaughterhouse, where she had placed her order the day before, and from there she takes the meat to her stand located in the 6th block of the market.  She used to sell fish but since she likes to take on new challenges she started this job.  She works alone and has been doing this job for 8 years.  What she likes about her job is that she always has good and friendly sales partners around her and that they are always keeping an eye on things.  Things are going well with her business and she hopes that in the future she will be able to set up a shop in her house so that her children can help with the household income.  

This will be her twelfth loan with MFP.  She is grateful to the group that she belongs to as they are responsible and always fulfill their obligations.  She is also grateful for the opportunity to be able to increase her investment and hopes to be able to continue working so she can get ahead.  With the amount requested, she will buy meat to stock her business.

loans.use: purchase meat.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a married man with three children, two of whom attend school, while one is still too young for school. He lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, he has operated a tuk-tuk (three-wheeled motor vehicle) business, operating between home and the market. The major challenge he faces is competition from other tuk-tuk operators in the area. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans for resale

loans.name: Veronica Alexandra

texts.es:
Verónica de 31 años, es una mujer trabajadora que hace 10 años empezó su negocio con un préstamo familiar. Con este pequeño capital pudo abrir un pequeño bazar que poco a poco ah ido creciendo.

El negocio inicia a las 6 am y termina a las 8 pm. Su esposo la ayuda en el negocio.

Su dificultad es la delincuencia. Hace dos semanas asaltaron a un carro repartidor de productos que le entregaban a su negocio.

Solicita este préstamo para invertir en su negocio e incrementar los productos que se vende en su negocio como: cuaderno, lápiz, borradores, etc.

Su sueño es terminar de construir su vivienda y que sus hijos puedan terminar sus carreras escolares.
texts.en: Verónica, 31, is a hardworking woman who started her business ten years ago with a family loan.  With this small capital she was able to open a small store that has been gradually growing.  She starts work at 6am and finishes at 8pm.  Her husband helps her in the store.  Her difficulty is crime.  Two weeks ago a delivery truck bringing merchandise to her store was held up.  She’s asking for this loan to invest in the business and increase the products she sells there like notebooks, pencils, erasers, etc.  Her dream is to finish building her house and that her children are able to finish their schooling.

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Laura Vicenta

texts.es:
Laura de 40 años, vive en una zona suburbana llamada “Durán”.
La actividad de ella es la venta de helados, tiene un local en la parte delantera de su vivienda.
Ella escogió esta actividad porque lo heredo de su padre, ya que también tenía una heladería.
La dificultad de ella es que le sale muy alta las planillas de luz y a veces no tiene como cancelar esa cuota.
Está casada, el esposo trabaja en el municipio, tienen tres hijos uno de 7, 8y 10 años. Los tres estudian en escuelas públicas.
Ella solicita el préstamo para el incremento de su negocio, y para la compra de productos como: conos, servilletas, chocolate, etc.
Su sueño es incrementar su negocio y que sus hijos puedan terminar su carrera escolares.
texts.en: Laura is 40 years old. She lives in a suburban area called “Durán”. Her activity is selling ice cream. She has a locale in the front of her house. She chose this activity because she inherited it from her father, since he also has an ice cream store. Her problem is that her electricity bills are very high and sometimes she can't pay that bill. She is married and her husband works at city call. They have three children, aged 7, 8 and 10. The three of them go to public schools. She is asking for the loan to grow her business and to buy products such as: cones, napkins, chocolate, etc. Her dream is to grow her business and for her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy products such as cones, napkins, chocolate, etc.

loans.name: Ngao

texts.en:
Ngoa is a married man with 6 children, 2 of whom are enrolled in school, 2 have completed their primary school level, and the other 2 are still too young for school. His wife is a businesswoman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. He owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children.

Ngoa has operated a food stall for the past 6 years. His potential clients are his neighbors and friends. He faces a major challenge of the lack of sales sometimes. He dreams of expanding his business to a wholesale shop.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase wheat flour, beans, sugar, tea leaves and cooking fat for his business. He decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access financial facilities to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, beans, sugar, tea leaves and cooking fat for his business.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr:
Cliente de 54 ans, veuve avec 5 enfants a sa charge dont l’âge varie entre 17 et 36 ans. Elle se lance dans la vente  de la friperie en 1998  avec une somme de 30.000frs.
Elle est déjà passe par  trois cycles de prêts de Hope, elle est leader, très exemplaire, elle a fait ses remboursements sans défauts de paiements, et elle a des épargnes considérables.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle va acheter des ballots de friperie de sous vêtements non utilises, tel que des soutiens et slips des femmes.
Sa stratégie est de choisir les meilleurs produits et d’offrir une bonne qualité de service à ses clients.
Elle a pour ambition d’ouvrir une boutique de sous vêtements, prendre soin de ses enfants et assuré leur avenir.
texts.en:
This client is 54 years old, widowed, and has five children between the ages of 17 and 36 in her care. She began selling second-hand clothing in 1998 with 30,000 Frs. capital.
She has already gone through three loan cycles with Hope; she is an exemplary leader, has repaid her loans without defaulting, and has built up considerable savings.
With this new loan, she is going to buy bales of second-hand clothing, specifically unused undergarments such as bras and women's slips.
Her strategy is to choose the best products and to offer quality service to her customers.
Her ambitions are to open an undergarments store and to take care of her children and ensure a good future for them.

loans.use: To buy bales of second-hand clothing, specifically unused women's undergarments.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 43-year-old mother who has five sons and one daughter. Her husband works as a taxi driver.

Her third son is Mohammad, a freshman student who registered to study accounting. His mother Hanan has applied for this loan to be able to pay his semester tuition fees so he can continue his studies and work is the accounting field as soon as he finishes. This is what he is planning. 

Because Hanan is a conservative person, her son Mohammad, who is the student this loan was taken for, has agreed to appear in the photo instead.

loans.use: To pay her son's semester tuition for college

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a 22-year-old woman living in the town of Asaga.  She is married and has one small child. To make a living, Rosa owns and operates a business in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruit and vegetables for sale. Rosa  has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 760 WST a month from these activities.

In 2011, Rosa  joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  This is the first time Rosa has requested a loan from SPBD.  She has asked for 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Rosa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her child.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Mrs. Seng is a diligent mother who earns a living by growing rice and vegetable crops in Takhmao town. She is an experienced farmer because she has been engaged in farming for 26 years.  She typically earns in the neighborhood of $4.00 per day through her effort. Currently her two daughters are working in a garment factory as sewing staff to help support the living. 

This loan of $700 will enable Mrs. Seng to buy a piece of land for constructing a shelter for the whole family to live as before she has lived on her neighbor’s land. But soon this piece of land will be sold to another owner. She is very happy and appreciative to all lenders who kindly help her family.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land for constructing a shelter.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila expresses her commitment and full devotion to her business and to her family as well. Laila has operated a small sari-sari (variety) store for four years and six months. The profits earned from her businesses allow her to pay her family's monthly electric bill and to provide their daily needs. 
 
Laila wants to strengthen her business but has insufficient funds, so she is asking for a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, vinegar, and other basic kitchen needs. She wants to stock more items in her store to meet all her customers' requests. In the future, Laila aims to have a large store to earn higher revenue.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, vinegar, and other basic kitchen needs.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 28-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She has had a salon in Yei, South Sudan for five years. Grace is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase weaves, gel and hair lotions. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase weaves, gel and hair lotions to sell

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
 
Luzviminda has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Luzviminda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Luzviminda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Amulasi

texts.en:
Amulasi is 40 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. She is married and has five children, who are all currently in school. For the past four years, Amulasi has been working hard to manage her bar, which sells beer and other beverages. 

To help expand her business, Amulasi has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more beer to sell and will help her to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Amulasi hopes that in the future she will be able to own a larger bar and retail shop. 

Amulasi is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Amulasi who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more beer to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi  Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  BENKADI III  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FALAN, un des villages de BOUGOULA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz, l’arachide et le gombo avec  KOROTOUMOU, 3ème personne debout  de la  droite  vers la  gauche sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  110.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aider  aussi son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Frais de labour, achat d’intrants et  de semence

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa prepara su negocio para las fiestas de fin de año, el crédito anterior lo utilizó para trabajar en su negocio el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque pudo vender toda su producción. Su actividad de fuegos artificiales inicia la temporada más fuerte de la época, en estas fechas sus ventas mejoran porque su producción es  muy demandado por todo tipo de asociaciones e instituciones para celebrar el cierre de año, la culminación de metas y agasajar a empleados y familiares, generalmente se realizan reuniones en plazas, canchas deportivas y espacios abiertos para comer, escuchar música en vivo y disfrutar de los espectáculos pirotécnicos que animan el agasajo, “estoy preparando pirotecnia, ya tengo contratos para navidad y año nuevo…” comenta. Su negocio es exitoso porque las fiestas y la pirotecnia son costumbres muy allegadas. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con temporadas altas, la desventaja es la falta de material de trabajo como pólvora y otros para fabricar pirotecnia y abastecer su mercado. Su sueño es vender por mayor, ella desea comprar material de trabajo para la fabricación de juegos artificiales para las fiestas de fin de año. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 20 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Teresa solicita un préstamo para comprar material de trabajo para fabricar fuegos artificiales y animar las fiestas anuales.

loans.use: para comprar material de trabajo para fabricar fuegos artificiales y animar las fiestas anuales.

loans.name: Lissette

texts.en:
Lissette M. (45 years old), she is married, has 3 children, and works in jewelery sales and her jewelery items are made from Brasilian gold. The loan will allow her to stock jewelery in order to sell them in the businesses she visits daily, thereby improving the livelihood of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer.

Lissette M. (45 años), Maestra de profesión, casada, 3 hijos, se dedica a la venta de prendas confeccionadas con oro brasileño. El crédito le permitirá abastecerse de prendas para colocarlas en las empresas que diariamente visita, mejorando así la economía de su familia.

loans.use: To buy Brasilian gold.

loans.name: Saadat

texts.en:
Saadat is 32 years old, an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region, settled in the Fizuli region, Ehmedbeyli village. She is single.
You can see in the picture a woman, who is Saadat's sister. She helps Saadat to improve cattle breeding.
Saadat has run this business for 5 years.
In the beginning of her business, she borrowed $400 and bought 2 calves.
Now she needs a loan of $800 to buy 4 calves.
Saadat plans to raise her income level.
She intends to do this by increasing the number of cattle.

loans.use: To buy 4 calves

loans.name: Naoupu

texts.en: Naoupu is a hardworking, thirty nine year old woman.  She is a married mother of six school-age children.  Naoupu also has seven siblings, and the income she brings in from her ice-pop business not only goes to support her children but in typical Samoan fashion, is shared among her siblings and extended family also.  She has used loans from SPBD to build up her ice-pop business.  She says that she is the top seller of ice-pops in her village, and she attributes this to a unique ingredient that she won’t disclose.  Having fully repaid previous loans, Naoupu is eligible for an additional loan, which she will use both to support her business by purchasing bulk supplies but also to make a payment on her children’s fees.

loans.use: Purchase bulk supplies of sugar, cordials, purified water and pay children’s school fees

loans.name: Edorh

texts.en: Edorh H. is a fish seller at the Angré open market (eastside of Abidjan). Born in Nigeria in 1966 and married, she is the mother of three children who are completing their education in Abidjan. She started her fish selling business in September, 1999.  The benefits from her activities have permitted her to help her husband (a taxi driver) to pay for their children's education expenses. She requests a loan from AE&I to purchase fish in bulk in order to satisfy retailers' orders and improves her margin.

loans.use: Edorh Hokinde

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is married with one son and has been in the pharmacy business for 5 years. Her business is located in Kayunga Town. She has acquired a plot of land and wants to grow her pharmacy into a wholesale business. She wants to target the market as there is no wholesale drug shop in Kayunga.

In the future she hopes to open up a maternity wing because mothers - especially young ones- suffer a lot with complications during childbirth in Uganda. Expanding her business will enable her not only to help others but also to increase her income and help her support her family.

loans.use: To buy malaria drugs, pain killers, antibiotics and mosquito nets for wholesale trading.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Nghem

texts.en: Mrs. Nghem K., 47, is married and lives with her husband and nine children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband work on a piece of land where they grow and grind rice crops, earning collectively around $4.50/day. Four of her children are employed at a garment factory located in Phnom Penh city, and the other five are enrolled in school. To expand her crops and make job further faster and easier Mrs. Nghem K. is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase more seeds and a grinding mill so that she won’t have t o grind her crops manually. This will increase her production, and thus her income.

loans.use: To purchase more rice crops and a grinding mill to faciltate her job.

loans.name: Chek

texts.en:
Mrs. P. Chek (47) and her husband, Tuy Sun have been married since 1988. They have three children, two sons and one daughter. All of their children are studying in a local school. Chek and her family live along national road number one, south of Phnom Penh. She has been in business selling bananas and flowers since 2000. She buys them from farms in her village for reselling at the market in Phnom Penh. Her husband does farming and grows flower on his farm far from home. 

Chek is requesting her third loan from MAXIMA for $1000. She will use this loan to expand her business and to make repairs to her house.

loans.use: To buy bananas for reselling and to make house repairs

loans.name: Funmilayo

texts.en: Funmilayo S. is 55-years-old, married and has three children. Her family lives in Mushin  Lagos State, Nigeria. She has been in business since 1987 selling elubo (dried yam, cassava and plantain). Mrs. S. is requesting a loan amount of $450 to purchase additional product for resale.

loans.use: To purchase elubo (dried yam, cassava and plantain) for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase clothing in bulk for inventory.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is twenty-five years old. She sells body creams, deodorant, hair creams, combs, hair conditioners, shampoos, etc in her community.

She wants to use her loan to buy more products to expand her operations.

Monica is a member of the group called “Awurade Ye” (meaning God is good). Members of the group agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more hair cream, artificial hair, body creams, etc.

loans.name: Erkin

texts.en: Erkin B. lives in the high-mountain region of  Tajikistan where agriculture and livestock is a primary business. Erkin is married and has 3 children. He is a respectable man on the collective farm because he is very hard-working  and a good family man. His wife works as a dressmaker and he works on the collective farm but since it is seasonal work he is engaged in the livestock business as well. Mr. B.  applies to KIVA with a loan request of 2100 TJS for 6 months. The loan will be used to purchase pedigree bulls and increase his flock.

loans.use: To purchase a pedigree bull and increase the flock.

loans.name: Wotsa

texts.fr:
Born into a modest family originally from the village of Keve in Ave Prefecture, Miss Wotsa F. was born on April 12, 1978. She is single. In 2004 she opened a sewing workroom called “Couture aux Elegantes” (Sewing for Elegant Women) in Lomé’s Adidogomé neighborhood. She currently has three apprentice seamstresses. The first loan she obtained enabled her to buy pagnes (colorful African cloth) to re-sell. The loan she is requesting now will enable her to buy an overlock machine and 12 pieces of mid-quality pagne.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Issue d’une famille modeste et originaire du village de KEVE dans la préfecture de l’AVE, Mademoiselle F. Wotsa est née le 12 avril 1978. Elle est célibataire. En 2004 elle a crée son atelier de couture dénommé « COUTURE AUX ELEGANTES » dans le quartier d’Adidogomé à Lomé. Actuellement elle a trois apprenties couturières. Le premier crédit qu’elle avait obtenu lui a permis d’acheter des pagnes et de les revendre. Le crédit actuel qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acquérir une machine à surfilage et 12 pièces de pagne de qualité intermédiaire.

loans.use: To buy an overlock sewing machine and pagnes (African cloth)

loans.name: Suraiya's Group

texts.en:
Suraiya baji is the wife of N. A. and they have been living in the city of Kasur, Pakistan for the last 45 years. She owns a two-room brick house, and she is the mother of three children, one son and two daughters. Both daughters are in 10th standard. Her son is an electrician by profession. Suraiya is not only a housewife, she is also a businesswoman specializing in garment sales. She successfully completed a loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan for her garment business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Saira baji wants a loan to repair an auto-rickshaw. Sadiqan baji wants a loan for her grocery shop. Maryam baji wants a loan to buy a land on contract. Shamim baji wants a loan to repair an auto-rickshaw. (Baji is an Urdu term of respect meaning 'elder sister'.)

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Asiah

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Asiah is a 40-year-old married woman with two children (ages nine and 16). She and her husband are also responsible for two more children under the age of 18 who are orphans related to the family. Asiah has two businesses: a photocopy shop and a beauty salon. She established the salon seven months ago and is already earning $US400 from the profits at the salon. Hair, hair and more hair! This is the place where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or braided, and made to look like your own.

Asiah is requesting a loan of $US275 to purchase necessary items such as hair products, wigs, and cosmetics for her salon. She hopes to pay back this loan in six months.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence the poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client. The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional beauty salon inventory

loans.name: Aida Camara

texts.fr: AIDA CAMARA S. EST NEE A BAMBEY LE 28 /01/1963 .ELLE HABITE AU QUARTIER DVF DE BAMBEY OU ELLE MARIEE ET MERE DE TROIS ENFANTS.APRES LES TRAVAUX MENAGERS ELLE FAIT DU COMMERCE POUR AMELIORE SES REVENUS AFIN DE MIEUX GERER SA FAMILLE.SON ACTIVITE CONSISTE A ACHETER DES TISSUS EN BAZIN ENSUITE ELLE LES FAIT TEINDRE AVANT  DE LES REVENDRE A SES CLIENTES .
texts.en:
Aida Camara S. was born in Bambey on January 28, 1963. She lives in the DVF district of Bambey. She is married and the mother of 3 children. When her housework is done, she runs a little business to bring in more income so that she can better support her family. Her business consists in buying "bazin" cloth which she hand-dyes before re-selling it to her customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sale of cloth for women

loans.name: Yun

texts.en: Yun V., 50, is a widow who lives with four of her children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She has been selling fish to earn a living since 2000 and is able to make about US$2 each day. Three of her children are employed in garment factories. She requests a loan of US$500 to increase the number of fish to sell. Any remaining money will be used to purchase land for resale.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Yoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Yoeun N. is a villager in Chi Chrab Village in Takeo Province. She works in a garment factory. Her husband Mr. Sorn Sarom is a famer.

Since Mrs. Yoeun N.'s work place is far from home, she spends a lot of money on transportation. She wants to start saving money and reducing her expenses. Therefore, she has decided to ask for a loan so she can buy a motorbike. In the long run, this will allow her to save money.

Mrs. Yoeun N. is 22 years old. She is the mother of one child. Her child is only five months old.

Mr. Sorn Sarom is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Mabelle
