texts.en: Mabelle M. is a 27-year-old single woman who lives in the village of Wome, a small town located in a lush and beautiful area of Togo near the Ghanaian border. To provide for her parents and family, Mabelle sells beverages and liquor along the side of the road. She is pictured here in her shop. With this loan from Kiva, Mabelle hopes to travel to Lomé, 130 kilometers away, to restock her inventory with drinks to resell in Wome. With the money she will earn from these sales, she hopes to be able to continue to take care of her maternal family, as well as marry and create a family of her own.

loans.use: To restock her inventory with drinks to resell

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: La señora Patricia labora para un centro comercial reconocido en la ciudad, en el área de la cocina, su esposo  el señor Mario trabaja como mecánico independiente, ellos son personas muy trabajadoras que luchan por salir adelante, brindándoles a su familia y hogar un mejor futuro, están solicitando este crédito para la colocación de las protecciones en puertas y ventanas para mayor seguridad de la familia.
texts.en:
Patricia works in a well-known department store in the city, in the kitchen department. Her husband Mario works as an independent mechanic. They are very hard-working and fight to get ahead, providing their family and home a better future. They are seeking a loan to install security bars on the doors and windows for greater security for their family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install security bars on the doors and windows of their home

loans.name: Perlinda

texts.en:
32 year-old Mrs. Perlinda C. is a resident of GK Village-Bongbong, Ozamiz City.  She is married to Mr. Fedelito C. and is blessed with two children; a girl of 6 years old in kindergarten 2 and a boy of 3 years old in kindergarten 1. 

	Early in 1990, she decided to go to Manila to find a job.  In 1994, she decided to resign from her job and started to establish a sari-sari store out of her savings.  She got married in 1997 to Mr. Fedelito C., a construction worker.  Early 2008, the couple decided to go to Ozamiz city due to the economic situation in Manila. Upon her arrival in Ozamiz City, her elder brother gave her a small amount of initial capital for her business to support her family.  The sister of her husband also gave the opportunity to her husband to drive their motor cab to generate income for the household.  She started up a sari-sari store in her residence with the money given to her by her brother.  She buys grocery items and also engages in E-Load business.

	When she heard that Paglaum MPC was expanding its membership in their barangay, she decided to join in order to have additional capital for her sari-sari store and also to be able to have savings deposit and insurances for her family.  She produced her 1st cycle in Paglaum MPC last July 2008 in the amount of P 7,000.00 as additional capital for her business and also engage in food vending to be sold in her neighbors.  A portion of the proceeds was used in the repacking chlorine and tawas to be delivered to the public market and to different grocery stores in the city.  Unfortunately, an emergency befell her family; that’s why she defaulted in her weekly payment.  However, despite of what happened she will find other sources and able to recover all her losses.  “That was a lesson to learn, if I have enough savings maybe my capital shall not be diverted to use for emergencies.” she said.  Now she availed her 2nd loan in the amount of P 4,000.00 for additional capital of her existing business. 

	  She’s hoping that that someday she will able to expand her business, especially for repacking chlorine and tawas for the whole province in Misamis Occidental, but also in the nearby provinces.  She dreams that in time her daughter will become a nurse and her son will become a policeman.

loans.use: additional capital for sari-sari and food vending

loans.name: Petrona Angelina

texts.es: Doña Petrona Angelina G. T. es originaria de la Comunidad del Canton Chuixchimal del Departamento de Totonicapán esta a tres kilometros de la ciudad, doña Petrona con su actividad economica que realiza en la plaza municipal de Totonicapan, en la venta de productos de consumo diario, a fortalecido el crecimiento de su familia, en educacion, vivienda hoy visita las oficina de ASDIR para solicitar un credito para incrementar sus productos. Por el momento solo esta vendiendo cuatro dias de la  semana pero con el credito estara vendiendo toda la semana por motivo que la influencia de las persona que requieren de sus productos estan incrementando, y aprovechar estas epocas de Carnaval Semana Santa y posteriormente la feria del Municipio.
texts.en:
Doña Petrona Angelina G. T. is from the Canton Chuixchimal community in the department of Totonicapán, three kilometers from the city. Doña Petrona, with her business in the municipal plaza of Totonicapán selling everyday products, supports the growth of her family in education and housing. She has visited the office of ASDIR to ask for a loan to increase her inventory. For the moment she only is selling four days of the week, but with the loan she will sell all week because of the increase in people who need her products and to make the most of this season’s Holy Week carnival and, later, the municipal fair.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Jose Armengol

texts.es: El señor José Armengol Pavón habita en el barrio San Caralampio de la concepción junto a su esposa y hijos, la esposa tiene una pulpería ubicada en la casa de habitación, don José es agricultor y comerciante; él vende en el mercado de Rivas ya que tiene hermanas que habitan en ese sector, ellos tiene a su cargo un hijo ya que el mayor de ellos trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar. Don Armengol tiene siete ciclo trabajando en Afodenic y esta contento con el apoyo que se le ha brindado lo cual ha mejorado tanto en el  cultivo, como sus condiciones de vida. Esta vez necesita financiamiento para la compra de fertilizantes y aplicarle al cultivo de piña para obtener una buena cosecha y vender a mejor precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Mr. José Armengol Pavón lives in the neighborhood of San Caralampio de la Concepción with his wife and children. His wife has a small grocery store located in the house in which they live. José is a farmer and merchant; he sells in the market in Rivas given that he has sisters that live in that area. Jose and his wife have under their charge one child as the older one works and helps with household expenses. Mr. Armengol is on his seventh loan cycle with Afodenic and is happy with the support that they have given him which has improve his crops as well as his standard of living. This time he is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers to apply to his pineapple crop to obtain a good harvest which he will be able to sell at a better price in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides to improve his crop.

loans.name: R.c Teko (Lower) Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of  RC Teko, (Lower), Roman Catholic Primary School in Sierra Leone.  RC Teko was established in 1977 with the aim of educating the children of military personnel at the Makeni Military barracks in Teko ward, and to spread the Roman Catholic faith. RC Teko is divided into a Lower and Upper primary schools respectively. The Lower is made up of classes I – III and the Upper is made of classes IV – V. RC Teko (Lower) has a total of sixteen staff and 435 pupils.

This will be the first loan RC Teko (Lower) is requesting from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, these teachers will be able to invest in something great and gradually, with their monthly salaries, they will repay the loan. Some of the teachers will invest in businesses in order to supplement their monthly salaries. Some of them will use their loan to buy furniture, like a bed or chairs, while others will use it to pay school fees either for themselves or for their children. 

Alfred B. C. (fifth from right) has been a teacher for over thirty-one years and is now the headmaster of RC Teko (Lower). Alfred was born in Yoni, a small town in the Tonkolili district of northern Sierra Leone. He is fifty-seven years old, married and has eight children. Three of his children are already grown-ups and three are still attending school. Mr. C. will use his loan to buy house building materials such as corrugated iron roofing, nails, sand and cement.

loans.use: Buy house building materials like corrugated iron zincs, nails sand and cements

loans.name: Aminjon

texts.ru: Аминджон Мирюсупов – молодой мужчина 33 лет. Женат и отец 3-х детей. Жена домохозяйка, нянчит своих маленьких детишек. Аминджон как глава семьи работает и зарабатывает деньги. Он водит маршрутное такси по маршруту Худжанд – Гафуров. Он работает по графику: 2 дня работает, 1 день отдыхает. В рабочие дни он старается максимально заработать деньги, и работает с раннего утра до поздней ночи. В выходной день он ремонтирует свою машину. Займ он хотел бы использовать на ремонт своего такси.
texts.en:
Aminjon M. is a young man, 33 years of age. He is married and the father of 3 children. His wife stays at home to care for their young children. Aminjon, as the head of the household, works and makes a living as a minibus driver between Khudzhand and Gafurov. The work schedule is two days of work, one day off. On work days he tries to earn as much as possible; he works from early in the morning to late at night. On days off he repairs and remodels his vehicle. He would like to use a loan for repairing the minibus.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Minibus repairs

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El contacto para formar el presente comité fue la  señora Gladys R., ex integrante del comité Esperanza del Este del barrio San Jose.  Ella es hermana de la señora Sara R., quien vive en la zona del Mercado de Abasto C.D.E. Ella contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en el barrio.  Todas las integrantes tienen activiadades por lo tanto tienen un ingreso dentro de la casa. El grupo esta en el decimo primer ciclo del programa de Fundacion Paraguaya.  Todas las 16 integrantes son muy activas y unidas, y todos tienen actividades productivas.

Las integrantes son: 

Sara R. 	- Venta De  Tabaco - 
Alva A. -  	Venta de ropa - 
Sara L.	 - Venta de Tabaco  -      
Julia G. 	- Venta de Ropa -
Pelagia R. -	Venta de Ajo -
Aurelia E. -	Venta de Remedio refrescante -
Venancia D. -	Ropa Interior -
Lidia F. - 	Venta de Ropa - 
Rocío C.  -	
Naida I. 	- Venta de Tabaco  -
CatalinaO. -	Despensa  - 
Carmen G. 	- Venta de Golosinas - 
Oilda B.  - 	Venta de Cosmeticoas - 
Margarita G.  - 	Despensa - 
Ramona Insfaran - 	Venta de  Tabaco -  
Nancy G. 	- Despensa -
texts.en:
The contact to form the present group is Mrs. Gladys Russo, ex member of the San Jose neighborhood group, Esperanza del Este. Her sister is Mrs. Sara R. who lives in the Mercado de Abasto C.D.E. zone. She contacted her neighbors and friends to form the neighborhood group. All of the members have their businesses in their homes. The group is in their eleventh loan cycle in the Fundacion Paraguaya program. All 16 members are active, united, and are engaged in productive activities. The members are: Sara R. – Tobacco Sales Alva A. – Clothing Sales Sara L. - Tobacco Sales Julia G. - Clothing Sales Pelagia R. – Sells Garlic Aurelia E. – Sells Refreshments Venancia D. – Underwear Sales Lidia F. - Clothing Sales Rocío C. - Naida I. - Tobacco Sales CatalinaO. - Store Carmen G. – Sells Sweets Oilda B. – Sells Cosmetics Margarita G. - Store Ramona Insfaran - Tobacco Sales Nancy G. - Store

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products like tobacco, clothes, basic needs items, food, garlic, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La señora Hilda  es socia del Banco Comunal “Aswancaris II” en la  provincia de Azangaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 25 años de edad, es casada con 01 hijo a su cargo, vive en el Jr. José Domingo Choquehuanca,  Barrio Vilca Apaza.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 01 año, la actividad a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de celulares, su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1500.00 nuevos soles,  comprará accesorios para teléfonos, tarjetas pre-pago y recargas, y de esta manera seguir creciendo en su negocio; trabaja en las ferias de la zona en forma ambulatoria, su deseo es poner un locutorio en un local propio.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones y encuentros deportivos.  Manifiesta que Manuela Ramos las incentivan al ahorro.
texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the Aswancarias II Community Bank, in the Azangaro province, Puno district. She is 25 years old and is married with one child in her care. She lives in Jr. José Domingo Choquehuanca, in the neighborhood of Vilca Apaza. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for one year. The activity to which she's dedicated is the purchase and sale of cellular phones. Her first loan was for 300 soles. With this loan of 1500 soles, she will buy telephone accessories, pre-paid cards and rechargers, and, in this manner, continue to grow her business. She works in the markets in the area on foot. Her wish is to establish a shop in her own storefront. What she likes the most about her community bank are the meetings and sporting events. She says that Manuela Ramos incents them to save.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cell phones, accessories and cards.

loans.name: Kurbonbibi

texts.ru: Курбонбиби Эргашева более 15 лет занимается животноводством. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Дети тоже работают и помогают своим родителям. Курбонбиби проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 56 лет. Клиентка просит у нас кредит, чтобы приобрести корову.
texts.en:
Kurbonbibi E. has been raising livestock for over 15 years. She is married and has five children. The children also work and help their parents. Kurbonbibi lives in the Tursunzoda district. She is 56 years old. This client is requesting a loan for purchase of a cow.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a cow

loans.name: Abdulai

texts.en:
Abdulai K. is a seamstress who has been sewing with an outmoded sewing machine in Hohoe. She has received senior-high education. She is single and has two children and is responsible for feeding and taking care of the financial needs of her dependents.

Abdulai’s loan will be used to buy sewing machines to speed-up her work. With the new profit from the business, Abdulai plans to reinvest.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines to speed-up her work

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: aminata C. est un societaire qui emprunte regulierement a la caisse de bayelaye a guediawaye.elle en est a son neuvieme credit .son activite principale est la vente de produits cosmetiques mais elle s'affaire aussi dans la petite restauration(vente depetit dejeuner et de sandwichs).elle capitalise une experience de plus de cinq ans.elle sollicite un credit de quatre cent cinquante mille(450 000)frs en vue d'elargir sesdeux activites et de satisfaire la demande croissante de ses clients
texts.en:
Aminata C. is a member who borrows regularly from the Bayelaye bank in Guediawaye. She is on her 9th loan. Her main business involves selling cosmetics, but she also does business in food catering (selling breakfast meals and sandwiches). She capitalizes on over five years of experience. She is requesting a loan of 450,000 francs with the aim of expanding her two businesses and satisfying the growing demand of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys B. is a single parent and has three children. She has received schooling through junior high school. Gladys sells cake and ice 'kenkey' at Atabadze near Elmina, which she has done since 2002. Gladys uses her income to pay for school fees. Gladys will use the loan to purchase 'kenkey' (sour-dough dumpling) and other ingredients to prepare the cake and 'kenkey' for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Gladys plans to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase kenkey and other ingredients

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline B. lives in the village of Poblacion, Mambajao Camiguin. She is 29 years old, single and has one child, an infant. To make a living, Jacqueline owns and operates a retail store where she sells bags. Jacqueline has been engaged in this business for more than four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from her work.

Earlier this year, Jacqueline joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. Jacqueline is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP to buy new items to sell to her customers. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy new items to sell and expand her product offering

loans.name: Papa Alassane

texts.fr: Papa Alassane D. est un commerçant de pièces détachées auto derrière la gare routière de Mbour ville située à 80km de Dakar la capitale sénégalaise. Il est âgé de 36 ans et marié, il sollicite ce prêt pour faire face aux exigences de sa clientèle  qui de plus en plus demande  les pièces de nouvelles marques de véhicules. Les crédits obtenus successivement de l UIMCEC lui ont permis de démarrer une petite activité de vente de pièces détachées. Les revenus tirés du commerce lui permettent de développer son commerce mais aussi ainsi subvenir à ses dépenses quotidiennes

loans.use: achat de marcahndises

loans.name: Ayda Luz

texts.es: Ayda Luz Ramírez P. tiene 44 años, es una mujer muy luchadora y disfruta mucho su trabajo su actividad económica es la elaboración y venta de comida. Hace más de 12 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Ella comenzó este medio de vida, porque no tenía una educación universitaria y termino sus estudios hasta 6 grado de primaria, a pesar de no tener la oportunidad de finalizar sus estudios ella no se dejo de luchar para salir adelante, por lo que tenía 2 hijos que mantener. Por lo que anteriormente ella inicio ofreciendo platillos como gallo pinto, tajadas, empanadas, tacos y enchiladas con el paso del tiempo sus clientes fueron aumentando y la variedad de sus platillos. Por lo que solicita un financiamiento para la compra de granos básicos, frutas entre otras cosas. Su deseo es establecer un restaurante.
texts.en:
Ayda Luz Ramírez P. is 44 years old. She is a woman who is very much a fighter and enjoys her work. She has both cooked and sold food for twelve years. Ayda started this business because she does not have a university level education and has only completed studies up to 6th grade.

In spite of not having the opportunity to complete her schooling she refused to stop fighting to advance in life. She is the mother of two. As a result, she began selling plates of food like gallo pinto (combined rice and beans), tajadas (fried plantain slices), empanadas (pastries filled with meat, chicken, etc), tacos and enchiladas. Over time her customer base increased and so did her variety of menu items.

For this reason she is requesting financing in order to buy grains, fruits and other supplies. Her wish is to start her own restaurant.


Translated from Spanish by Shereef Zaki, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Nigmet

texts.en: Nigmet is 45 years old and lives with his wife and two youngest children in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest son lives and works in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, while the younger children attend a local university in Bayan-Ulgii. Nigmet operates a coal delivery business in his town. Coal is an important energy source here in Mongolia because not everyone has access to, or can afford electricity. He began this business in 2006 after managing another transport business for 7 years. Nigmet delivers coal to contracted businesses and individuals all over town. During his three years in operation, he has gained a lot of business experience and a strong customer base. He says, “All I want is to be able to afford my children’s education and to buy a larger delivery truck in the future”.  Nigmet is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug (~1050 USD) loan in order to be able to buy a larger, more reliable delivery truck for his business.

loans.use: to buy a larger, more reliable delivery truck

loans.name: Mrs. Ngoeurn Suong Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people who live in Trapeang Sdok village in Takeo province make up the village bank loan group, and they will use the loan which they obtain for different purposes. 

Mrs. Ngoeurn S. has been selected by the members as village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Lang Neang, owns a small repair shop where he fixes bicycles and motorbikes for an income. Although they work hard, they still earn too little income to support their family. In order to improve the living conditions, Mrs. Ngoeurn S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a taxi to transport goods and passengers for an income. Mrs. Ngoeurn S. has a child who is a construction worker.

loans.use: To buy a taxi to transport goods and passengers for an income.

loans.name: So Aba Pa Group

texts.en:
Married with five children, four in school and one a trader, Charity is 41 years old. She supports her husband in providing for the household through the sale of used clothing. Used clothing has a very big market in Ghana, as brand new clothes are very expensive for the economically active poor. She has been in this business for the past five years, making her sales through ‘hawking’, which is door-to-door sales. Charity wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing to increase her inventory to meet customer demand, as in the Christmas season parents buy used clothing for their children. She believes this loan will help her to save for her children’s future and also to rent a store to trade.

The leader of a trust bank group called ‘So Aba Pa,’ which means ‘Bear good fruits,’ Charity is the one seated in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and farmers. The group members provide social collateral for one another to access the loan, and utilize peer pressure to ensure repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan L., 19, is married and lives with her husband in the Takeo province. Since 2007, she has been selling grocery items to earn a living and is able to make about US$4 of profit every day. Her husband is a farmer making approximately US$3 each day. Chan L. is asking for a loan of US$500 to purchase a more groceries to meet her clients' demands.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for her store

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine M. is from the town of Alimanao Peñablanca,Cagayan. She is 36 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Geraldine makes and sells food, primarily barbecues to the local community.  Geraldine has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

Geraldine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Geraldine is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell.  This loan will be her third from ASKI.  She plans to use the additional revenue to support the immediate members of her family. 
------------------------------
About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Luz Diomira

texts.es:
Luz tiene 42 años de edad, es separada y tiene tres hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres con el menor de sus hijos, en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace seis años se dedica a la venta de alimentos en el exterior del mercado de la ciudad de Cayaltí, todos los días ofrece una variedad de platos típicos, tanto de la sierra como de la costa del país. Usualmente ofrece sopa verde (elaborado con plantas comestibles de la sierra); sopa de mote (elaborado a base de maíz blanco); huevos sancochados de codorniz; champús (bebida elaborada a base de maíz) y cachangas (producto comestible hecho a base de harina de trigo).

Su negocio siempre es muy frecuentado debido a la buena sazón con la que prepara sus alimentos. Luz se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de ingredientes e insumos para elaborar más productos por la temporada navideña.

Luz desea ver a su hijo convertido en un excelente profesional por lo que diariamente se esfuerza al máximo en su trabajao. Ella es una madre de familia luchadora que ha sabido salir adelante a pesar de las dificultades que se le presentan.
texts.en:
Luz is 42 years old, separated with three children. She lives in her parents house with the youngest of her children in the district of Cayaltí, situated one hour from Chiclayo.

For 6 years she has sold food in the exterior of the Cayaltí market. Everyday she offers a variety of typical plates, from the mountains to the coast of the country. Usually she offers sopa verde (prepared from edible plants in the mountains), sopa de mote (prepared from white corn), eggs sancochados de codorniz, champús (a drink made from corn) and cachangas (edible product made from all purpose flour)

Her business is well frequented at this time with what she prepares her food. Luz is requesting her first loan of 1000 nuevos soles with Edpyme Alternative that she thinks she will use to buy ingredients and consumables to make more products for the Christmas season.

Luz wishes to see her son become an excellent professional so that daily he pushes to the max in his job. She is a hard working mother that has moved forward in the weight of difficulties that have presented themselves.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ro buy consumables to make food in this Christmas season

loans.name: Santos Leonarda

texts.es:
Leonarda es una madre de familia de 35 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de edad escolar en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde muy joven a la venta de emolientes (bebidas calientes hechas a base de hierbas naturales que tienen propiedades medicinales), aprendió esta labor de sus tíos y de su hermano. Se levanta todos los días desde muy temprano a vender su producto en el centro del distrito. Su esposo trabaja como mototaxista y entre ambos solventan los gastos familiares.

Leonarda se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de hierbas para ampliar su negocio ya que no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción.

Su más grande anhelo es porder brindarle a sus hijos una educación de calidad, ella ya ha trabajado con nuestra institución anteriormente y ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Leonarda is 35 years old and lives with her husband and three school-age children in the district of Paiján, province of Ascope, in the La Libertad region located three hours from the city of Chiclayo. Since she was very young she has worked selling emollients (hot drinks made from natural herbs that have medicinal properties). She learned this trade from her uncles and her brother. She wakes up early every day to sell her product in the center of the district. Her husband works as a taxi driver and between the two of them they are able to cover their family's expenses. Leonarda is applying for a loan of 1000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa which she will use to purchase the herbs for her business because now she does not have enough money to do so. Her greatest wish is to be able to offer her children a quality education. She has previously worked with our institution and has proven to be reliable and punctual with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of medicinal herbs to produce emollients

loans.name: Ilhom

texts.ru: Давронов Илхом проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 29 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Давронов Илхом занимается растениеводством более 6 лет. Он вносит минеральные удобрения в почву. Обрабатывает и проводит севооборот. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Ilhom D. lives in the Shahrituz district. He is 29 years old, married and has 2 children. Ilhom has been involved in agriculture for over 6 years. He puts mineral fertilizers into the soil, treats it and conducts crop rotation. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizers

loans.name: La Solucion 8 Group

texts.en:
Ayde, 42, is a borrower who lives in Samana, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, La Solucion (The Solution), and her story is representative of those in her group and other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Esperanza International.

Ayde and her husband live with their two children in Samana, a small town in the northeastern region of the Dominican Republic. Life in the Dominican Republic can be rough, with no potable running water, frequent power outages (if one has power to begin with), and inadequate healthcare. Despite these difficulties, Ayde runs a successful mobile clothing business. With this loan, she plans to purchase new shirts and undergarments to sell to her friends and the women in her community.

This is Ayde’s second loan with Esperanza International, and she hopes to continue taking out loans to grow her business and improve her home life for her family. She hopes to purchase a radio and new dishes for her home, as well as new school supplies for her children. Ayde’s profits also have allowed her to have fun activities with her family, such as ordering pizzas or going out for ice cream. In the past, these types of activities would not have been possible. Her long-term dream is to have enough money to buy a small store where she can run her business, rather than having a mobile business as she does now.

Esperanza International seeks to free children and their families through initiatives that generate income, education and health, restoring self-worth and dignity to those who have lost hope. We have over 8,500 active associates in eleven offices in the Dominican Republic and Haiti. Thank you for lending to Ayde and La Solucion group!

loans.use: To buy shirts and undergarments for resale

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena L. is from the village of Malinao, Gingoog City. She is 31 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Elena owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2003, Elena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Elena is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 9th from HSPFI. She chose to remain at the 7,000 pesos level for her 9th loan. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Luz Angelica

texts.es:
Luz es una madre D. familia D. 52 años D. edad, es viuda y vive con una hija en el distrito D. Pátapo, un distrito agrícola ubicado a media hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

La necesidad D. salir adelante y obtener ingresos que le permitan solventar los gastos familiares a raiz D. su viudez, hizo que tuviera la iniciativa D. instalar una pequeña bodega en el domicilio en donD. vive. Allí ella ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo D. productos D. primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, aceite), abarrotes y verduras.

El negocio goza D. buena acogida debido a la calidad D. productos que ofrece y al buen trato que brinda a los clientes, Luz desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. más productos que le permitan satisfacer la demanda D. sus clientes, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Luz es una mujer bastante trabajadora y que ha sabido salir adelante a pesar D. las difucultades que le ha puesto la vida. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser una cliente puntual y responsable al momento D. asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Luz is a 52 year old mother. She is a widow who lives with a daughter in the District of Pátapo, an agricultural district that is located 30 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Luz needed to get ahead and obtain income to meet her family expenses as a result of becoming a widow. She took the initiative to open a small grocery store in home where she offers her customers all types of basic necessity products (rice, sugar, and oil), groceries, and vegetables.

Her business has been well received because of the quality of her products and the good service that she provides to her customers. Luz wants to expand her business buy purchasing more products to meet the demand of her customers. Therefore, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN to help meet her objective.

Luz is an extremely hardworking woman who has managed to get ahead despite the difficulties she has faced in life. She has worked previously with our Institution and has demonstrated that she is a punctual and responsible client when making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic necessity products to expand her inventory

loans.name: Grupo Chuiquisis Group

texts.es: El grupo Chuiquisis an enprendido un negocio, formadas por mujeres  trabajadoras  han tenido a bien  realizar  en la compra y venta D. textiles y ropa tipica donD. comercializan  en otros lugares  D. la republica D. Guatemala y por la falta D. Capital D. trabajo  acuden a la ASOCIACIÒN ASDIR para este apoyo, consideran ellas que con este incremento les ayudaran en conjunto  a obtener màs ganancia y asi superar màs en el negocio y poder ayudar a su familia y especialmente a sus hijos para sacarlo avante en la edad escolar y tener otro nivel D. vida, por ello piden esta ayuda.
texts.en:
The group Chuiquisis, formed by hardworking women, has launched a business buying and selling textiles and traditional clothing. They market their products in other places in the Republic of Guatemala. As they lack working capital they have come to the ASOCIACIÒN ASDIR looking for support. They think that this loan will help them to increase their joint earnings and help their business to succeed so that they can help their families. They particularly want to help their children to advance in their studies so that they can have a higher living standard, and to do this they are asking for this assistance.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital for clothing and textile business

loans.name: Bilma

texts.es:
la sra. Bilma B. C. tiene 64 años de edad, vive en la colonia Cofradia en la ciudad de Danli Departamento del Paraiso. Bilma tiene una carniceria, ahora ella tiene una persona que viaja una vez a la semana desde Danli hacia Tegucigalpa a comprarle carne al por mayor,  cada compra oscila entre 400 libras  a 500 libras semanales, aparte de lo que ella vende al detalle y de igual manera en su comedor día a día. su local es higiénico y de un ambiente agradable; se pudo ver la demanda de su producto que tiene buena aceptacion.  
Doña Bilma tiene 8 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad.
vive en unión libre y su compañero de hogar se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado. 
con su pareja no tienen dependientes.- Dentro de su negocio hay un empleado permanente el cual le ayuda en la venta de carnes.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar carne al por mayor.
texts.en:
La Senora Bilma B. C. is 64 years old. She lives in the colony of Cofradia in the city of Danli, departamento del Paraiso. Bilma has butchers shop, now she has someone that travels once a week from Danli towards Tegucigalpa to buy wholesale meat. Every purchase ranges between 400 pounds and 500 hundred pounds weekly, apart from what she sells in small amounts and is used in her dining room from day to day. Her business is hygenic and is an agreeable environment. One can see from the demand for her product that she has been well received. Doña Bilma has eight years of experience with this activity. She lives in a free union with her household companion who works in the purchase and sale of cattle. She and her partner have no dependents. Within her business she has a permanent employee that helps with the sale of meat. This loan is for the purchase of meat in large quantity.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy red meat and pork

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: Maria Antonia tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000, pues siempre se ha preocupado por mejorar sus ingresos, pues ha sido muy importante para ella. Sus inicios se dieron hace mas de 30 años por lo que se dedica a la venta de tortillas, ya que tiene que buscar un medio de ingreso para su familia ella busca la forma de obtener un medio de vida ya que el arduo trabajo que realiza es admirable. Sueña con realizar mejoras para su vivienda, ya que siempre se ha preocupado por proporcionar mejores condiciones de vida de su familia. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será invertido en la compra de maíz pues así le resulta mas favorable.
texts.en:
Maria Antonia is a long-time client who has been working with Fundación León 2000 because she is always concerned about improving her income. Therefore, this relationship is very important to her. She started selling tortillas more than 30 years ago as a means of generating an income for her family.

Her desire to find ways to make a living and work hard is admirable. Maria Antonia dreams of making improvements to her home because she wants to provide her family with better living conditions. The loan she requested will be used as operating capital to buy corn since prices right now are favorable.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn

loans.name: Mabothraneh Group

texts.en:
These are small-scale business people in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a Kiva partner, to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 each to enable them to expand their businesses. With a loan of SLL 500,000, they will be able to add more stock, make more sales, and make more profit. Consequently, they will be able to improve their standard of living by sending their children to school and feeding and clothing them.

Isatu C. (3rd from left) is the leader of this group. She was born in Port Loko about forty-five years ago. Isatu has one child who is already a grownup and living on his own.

Isatu sells medicines and has been doing this business for ten years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy more drugs to add to her business.

In the photo is also shown loan officer Zainab B., handing over the loan to the group.

loans.use: To buy more medicines to add to her business

loans.name: Nabila Rabia Group

texts.en: Rabia is the daughter of F. B.. She is 41 years old and the leader of Nabila Rabia group in district 7th of Kabul Afghanistan. She lives with her husband and five of her children who are students. Her husband has a metal shop. He is a hard working man and tries to have a comfortable life and educated children. Rabia wants to take out a loan for her husband to expand his business and to buy tools which can make his work easier. He hopes to grow his business soon.

loans.use: to buy tools needed in his work

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”; La socia vive en el distrito de Angostura en la provincia de Saylla departamento del Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Lucrecia, ella tiene 35 años de edad y La socia es soltera y tiene 3 hijos menores la socia se dedica al comercio minorista en el distrito de Saylla, La socia tiene terrenos de cultivo, ella cultiva papa, maíz, hortalizas para la venta, La socia tiene sus compradores y ellos vienen a llevar toda la producción de la socia; La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y semillas para una nueva siembra. 

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Ms. Lucrecia is a member of the “Virgen Purificada Angostura” communal bank. She lives in the district of Angostura in the province of Saylla, in the department of Cusco. She is a 35 year old single woman with three young children. She works in the retail business in the district of Saylla. She owns farmland and grows potatoes, corn, and vegetables for sale. When her customers come to her farm, they buy her entire supply of produce. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for the new sowing season. She is immensely grateful for the loan as it will allow her to expand her business and improve her quality of life. She promises to make her payments according to the agreed upon term.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for the new sowing season.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena S., a 35-year-old member of ASHI, hopes to pursue the education of her four children (aged from 2 to 13 years old) until they earn a college degree which she believes to be the key to unlocking a better kind of life.

Rowena, herself, has not reached a higher level of education due to poverty and, because of that, offices would not consider employing her over the other college degree holders. She didn’t even have a chance to obtain any loans before ASHI came and so didn’t have the opportunity to venture in a business. With that, she felt how hard life can be at times, especially when she had her own family and children to sustain.

Rowena and her husband, who is a farmer, have been working so hard to earn money to support the needs of their children. They were both very happy when they found out about ASHI. Rowena became a member in 2009 and, from that year, she has able to gain the confidence and determination to grow and sustain their rice and vegetable farming business. From this is anchored the enrichment of her hopes for her children.

Since Rowena and her husband’s farmland is acquired through arriendo, which is a Spanish term commonly used in the province referring to land rental (farmland is rented and the owner is paid with part of the harvest), they both hope to have a larger amount of business capital to be able to gain more.

Also, as much as possible through loans they can borrow through ASHI, they would like to stop using the alili system (a common system farmers use to acquire capital). The alili system is a system whereby farmers obtain money from wealthy people in exchange for part of their harvest. With this system, farmers gain only a very small profit.

loans.use: To purchase necessary farm inputs such as rice seedlings, fertilizer and to pay for equipment rental

loans.name: Morm

texts.en: Morm C., 54, is married and lives with her husband and six children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia – an area known for quality palm products. C. is a housewife while her husband is a taxi driver earning $8 US per day. C. is requesting a loan of $500 US to purchase car tires to replace the old ones to improve her husband’s business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy car tires

loans.name: Takku Ligueye Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité TAKKU LIGUEYE est né le 20 décembre 2010. Il est composé de 14 femmes issues du même quartier. Les membres ont monté leur groupe par affinité et par voisinage. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageoise de KOUNOUNE AIR FRANCE

Madame Aïda MABYE à l’extrême droite de la photo, vêtue de thioup mauve/blanc est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 39 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant en charge. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de bijoux et de tissus depuis son adhésion dans le Banc Villageois.

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va renforcer son niveau d’approvisionnement pour élargir son petit commerce.

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la dépense quotidienne et participer au payement de la scolarité de son enfant.
texts.en:
The solidarity group TAKKU LIGUEYE came into being December 20, 2010. It is composed of 14 women who all come from the same district. The members set up their group based on affinity and sharing a neighborhood. The group is a part of the "Banc Villageois" of KOUNOUNE AIR FRANCE. Mrs. Aïda M., on the far right in the photo, dressed in a mauve and white "thioup" (local, hand-dyed cloth,) is the leader of the group. She is 39, married, and raising an only child. She has had a small business selling costume jewelry and lengths of cloth since she joined the "Banc Villageois". With her new loan she is going to replenish her stock so as to expand her little business. Her goal is to help her husband with supporting the family and with the school fees for her child.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of costume jewelry and lengths of cloth for resale

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: S. koffi est un  homme âgé de 37 ans, il est marié et mère de 4 enfants. l'activité génératrice de revenu qu'il exerce est le commerce des articles de quincaillerie. il fait ce commerce depuis 2006. actuellement la demande sa clientèle est plus élevée que le stock disponible raison pour laquelle il sollicite de WAGES un 3 ème crédit pour l'achat de 6 tuyaux, 10 pioches, 4 chassien boîte, 6 col en boîte, 20 ampoule et divers autres articles de quincaillerie.il a déjà obtenu 2 crédits qu'il a déjà remboursé sans difficulté.
texts.en:
Koffi S. is a 37 years old man, married and father of four children. His source of revenue is his hardware business. He has been in this business since 2006. At the moment his customers' demand is higher than the available stock. For this reason he requests a third loan by WAGES, in order to purchase six tuyau (air water pipes), ten picks, four hunting cans, six collar boxes, twenty bulbs and other goods. He received two previous loans, that he fully paid pack.

Translated from French by Monica Urban, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hardware

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
La Sra. Angélica tiene 56 años y su actividad es alquileres de piezas y también de casas, ella es viuda y tiene tres hijas dos ellas ya son casadas y una es la que se quedo a su cargo y está estudiando.
Como tiene todo el tiempo libre una ves una de sus inquilinas le recomendó que haga comidas para la venta los fines de semana especialmente, empezó un sábado y domingo luego los clientes le pedían que haga para todos los días el cual tuvo mucho éxito y el crédito solicitado fue destinado a la compra de un congelador para poder tener en mayor cantidad las cosas.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo y la realización de dicho emprendimiento.
texts.en:
Angelica is 56 years old and she engages in renting rooms and houses; she is a widow and has three daughters: two are married and one is a student and is still economically dependent on her. She has a lot of free time, and one of her tenants recommended to her to prepare and sell food especially during the week-ends: she did so one Saturday and one Sunday, and her customers asked her to prepare and sell food every day, and the activity was a great success. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a freezer in order to be able to store a wider variety of items. She is thankful to Fundación Paraguaya for their support in the realization of this activity.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a freezer.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es:
Juanita es casada, tiene 8 hijos de los cuales 7 estudian, Juanita se dedica a la agricultura de verduras, productos que vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, además viaja a la feria los días sanados en donde vende verduras y de allá compra cereales que luego comercializa en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Juanita pertenece al Banco Comunal Chacco y solicita un crédito de 900 soles para la compra de cereales.
Los sueños de Juanita son hacer una casa en la ciudad de ayacucho y tener una restaurante.
texts.en:
Juanita is married and has eight children. Seven of them go to school. Juanita grows vegetables, and she sells them at the wholesale foodstuffs market in the city of Ayacucho. Also, on her free days she travels to the fair where vegetables are sold, and she buys grains to later sell at the market in Ayacucho. Juanita belongs to the Chacco Communal Bank. She is requesting a loan for 900 soles to buy grains. Juanita’s dreams are to build a house in the city of Ayacucho and to have a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grains

loans.name: Grace Nana Mensiwa

texts.en: Grace Nana Mensiwa D. sells different kinds of soap and tomatoes at Elmina. Grace has received junior high education. She is married to a farmer. She helps her husband in taking care of the household.  Her loan will be used to buy more soap to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards the acquisition of a plot of land.

loans.use: buy more soap to sell

loans.name: Vann

texts.en: Vann S. is 31 years old and lives with her husband and two young children in the Takeo province. She makes and sells porridge and cakes from her home and is able to make about US$5 of profit a day. Her husband works in construction, earning US$3 per day. Since Vann S. sells porridge and cakes in the morning, she is asking for a loan of US$1200 to open a grocery store from which to sell after she has sold the porridge. She believes this business will bring more profit to help raise her family.

loans.use: To open a grocery store

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.en:
Nicolasa T. is from the village of Unidos. She is 53 years old. Nicolasa is single. To make a living, Nicolasa makes and sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Nicolasa has been engaged in her business for more than ten years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2002, Nicolasa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Nicolasa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Nicolasa is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be the tenth loan taken by Nicolasa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve her general living conditions. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Wilme

texts.en:
Wilme S. is a married woman who lives in Purok 1A, Brgy. 9, Daan Banwa, Victorias City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: cosmetics sales, fish vending and buying and selling livestock. Her husband Daniel S. Jr. is 53 years old and works as a fish vendor to earn his living.  He also helps with his wife's business activities.  They have four children between the ages of 8 and 19.  

Wilme joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Wilme has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 22,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 14,000, raising the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 18th loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000, which she intends to use to purchase cosmetic products and fish to sell so that she could continue to save up for her children's future education. 

Wilme S. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking on the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Baktygul's Group

texts.en:
Baktygul D. is the leader of this group. She is 54 and married. Baktygul is a resident of Kochkor, a small town in the Isykul region. She has a daughter and two sons.  All her children are married and live with their families.  Baktygul herself works as a social worker. She and her husband also breed livestock animals to make additional money.  By reselling some animals after fattening, they make 3,000 soms per month. Baktygul hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to purchase one farm animal in order to increase the number of livestock. In the future, she wants to improve their living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.en:
Mr. Marcelino P. Jr. is from the Barangay of Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. He is 51 years old, married and has been blessed with five children, four of whom are now adults, while the other one is still school-aged. To make a living, he is presently operating a boarding house. He has been engaged in this kind of business for three years already. He is earning an average monthly income of about 10,000 PHP from the rentals of this business. 

Just this year, Marcelino joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marcelino, as a newly recognized member of Paglaum MPC under the Regular Loan Program is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP as his first loan availment, which will be used for boarding house repairs and renovations. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family, especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, loan repayments, his child’s education and possible business expansions.


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For boarding house repairs and renovations

location.town: Ozamis-P3 Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occid

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more spare parts and petroleum products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables for the shop

loans.name: Felecita

texts.en:
Felecita M. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 61 years old and married with five adult children. To make a living, Felecita owns and operates a business harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish. She has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2006, Felecita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC and is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the eigth loan taken out by Felecita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Cristina Lisseth

texts.es:
La sra. Cristina de 38 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos, su esposo Jose Salvador González la ayuda en las actividades Ganadera y en la produccion de su unidad de trabajo. Habita en la comarca el Arrayan finca el Esfuerzo, son personas humildes, trabajadoras y sobre todo muy responsable, esta señora ha lucahdo para obtener sus propios bienes, busca la manera de producir y sacarles provecho a su finca para cubrir los gastos del hogar, cuenta con el apoyo de su marido para lograr mayores ingresos.  

Solicita credito mediante Kiva a quien desde ya agradece mucho, pretende comprar terneros para desarrollo y asi comercializarlos y de esta manera obtener mejores condiciones de vida.  

Sueña con darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Cristina is 38 years old and the mother of two children.  Her husband, Jose Salvador González, helps her with her livestock farming activity and work center production.  She lives in Arrayan county on the Esfuerzo farm.  They are modest, working people who are very responsible.  Cristina has struggled hard to obtain her own income, seeking ways to produce and take more advantage of the farm to cover household expenses.  She has her husband's support in striving to increase income.

She is grateful to Kiva for the loan she plans to use to buy calf livestock to raise and sell in an effort to improve her family's living conditions.

She dreams of giving her children the best she can.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HACIA EL TRIUNFO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Elsa, La socia tiene 41 años de edad, la socia  es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, la socia se dedica a trabajar en una academia de preparación para la universidad, ella trabaja por horas haciendo la limpieza del lugar y ella también tiene un local pequeño aquí en la academia y prepara comidas rápidas para los mismos alumnos, ella desea el préstamo para comprar los insumos e implementar su pequeño negocio, la socia desea poder crecer con su negocio y ahorrar todo el capital que ingrese de este para abrir un local grande y dedicarse solo a la elaboración de alimentos para la venta. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de hamburguesas y otros.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Elsa, 41, belongs to the Hacia El Triunfo ("Toward Victory") community bank.  The bank is in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco.

Sra. Elsa is partnered and has 3 children.  She works as a cleaner at an academy that trains students for university study.  She spends part of her day cleaning the academy building and another part running a small restaurant that she started there to sell prepared foods to the academy's students.  She is applying for a loan so that she can buy supplies for the business.  She wants to grow the business and save the profits so that she can open a larger space where she can run her own restaurant full time.  Sra. Elsa will use the loan to buy supplies for making hamburgers and other prepared foods.

Sra. Elsa is grateful for your help and is committed to repaying this loan in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: Buy supplies for restaurant business.

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
Charlyn C. is from the village of Villa M. Tejero, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 31 years old. Charlyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Charlyn owns & operates a business providing construction services to local community members. Charlyn has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 50,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Charlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Charlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Charlyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Charlyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Liloy-Villa M Tejero, Liloy Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is a married, 44-year-old man living in Nabatieh. He and his wife have five children. To earn a living, he works as a taxi driver, and he has 17 years of experience in this field. In the past, his main business challenge was competition from other drivers, but he now has regular clients, making his job more stable.

He is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua in order to do some necessary car maintenance and to pay for his daughter's wedding. This would be his fourth loan, and he reports that the previous loans he obtained were very helpful. In particular, he notes that the prior loans allowed him to fix his car and to thereby improve his family's standard of living. In the future, he hopes to buy a new car and to open his own transportation company.

loans.use: To pay for car maintenance

loans.name: Eusebio Alfonso

texts.es:
Eusebio trabaja en servicios de seguridad, durante varios años, como objetivo ha sido las mejoras a su vivienda, siendo de condición muy humilde, su esposa labora como domestica y ambos equilibran los gastos.
Con el crédito anterior desvió el destino a la mejora de infraestructura, ya que tuvo que hacer un sumidero y compra de inodoro para las aguas negras, debido al invierno. Lo que con este nuevo préstamo hará de concreto la parte de enfrente que espera poder terminar, y lograr un techo digno para su familia.
texts.en:
Eusebio has worked in security services for several years.  His goal has been to make improvements to his very humble home.  His wife works as a domestic employee, and they both share the expenses.

He used the previous loan to improve the infrastructure.  He had to install a drain and buy a toilet because of the winter’s effect on the sewers.

With this new loan he will make the front part of the house concrete.  He hopes to be able to finish and provide his family with a decent home.

loans.use: buy construction materials in order to make the front part of his house concrete

loans.name: Ndolo

texts.en:
Ndolo S. is forty years old and married.  His wife is a businesswoman and they have five children, from one to fourteen.  They hope to give their children a good education and send them to a university.

Ndolo's business is located at the busy open air Gikomba market in Nairobi.  He sells clothes to the local people, and he has been in this business for twenty years.  He works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep his business doing well.  He recently hired an employee and he says the business is profitable.  

His major challenge is financial constraints, so he is using his loan of Kes 80,000 to buy more clothes.  This will help him grow the business and meet the demands of his customers. In the future, he hopes to open stalls for selling clothes and build some rental units.  He describes himself as determined, aggressive and committed to his work.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell in his store.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling at retail to her neighbors and passersby. Jane also sells farm products which contributes another source of income. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. Jane dreams of establishing a retail shop business. 

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase a bundle of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a bundle of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 43 and married to William, a retired army officer. Together, they have 1 child. Jane runs a dairy farm as well as rearing poultry. She hopes to take a 60,000 KES loan to buy another cow for her farm. She lives in Kikomba and currently sells milk to the local community. 

Jane has been a good client who repays her loan well. This is her 2nd loan with KADET. She plans to use the proceeds from this loan to expand her business and hopes to own a large dairy farm one day.

loans.use: to buy a cow for her farm.

loans.name: Daimer Rafael

texts.es: Daimer de 37 años  Vive en el municipio de Soledad  y está dedicado al comercio desde que llegó de la capital de Colombia Bogotá, buscando oportunidades de trabajo en empresas pero finalmente se dedicó a vender mercancías variadas y luego vio como una oportunidad la venta de alimentos como carnes, panes, galletas, queso que distribuye en una motocicleta sector a sector.  Su meta más adelante es incrementar los repartos en otros sectores, pero su mayor desafío es que su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para abordarlos, por eso recurre a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará carne, queso y galletería en general, los cuales tiene encargados en nuevos sectores donde ya empezó su promoción y encontró nuevos pedidos. Su sueño es tener su propia casa y un local en un punto muy comercial, además de comprar un vehículo que le permita aumentar el volumen de distribución y con ello lograr el aumento de sus ingreso familiares. Sus indicadores financieros son apropiados para obtener una inyección de capital de trabajo y aumentar su rentabilidad, que se encuentra en un 48%,  mediante compras en mayor volumen y de contado.
texts.en: Daimer, 37 years old, lives in the Soledad municipality.  He has been a merchant since he came from Bogota, the capital of Colombia, looking for work opportunities in companies.  He finally started selling various merchandise and later saw an opportunity in the sale of food such as meats, bread, crackers, cheeses, which he distributes from area to area on his motorcycle.  His goal is to increase the distribution to other areas, but his main challenge is not enough capital to be able to pursue this  This is the reason for his turning to his credit institution.  This is his first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo foundation, with which he will buy meat, cheese and various crackers for which he has orders in new areas where he started to promote his business and received orders.  His dream is to have his own  home and a site in a commercial area, in addition to being able to buy a vehicle that will allow him to increase the volume of his distribution.  This way he can increase his family income.  His financial indicators are appropriate to obtain an increase in working capital and up his profitability, which is at 48%, through the purchase of larger volumes and with cash.

loans.use: to purchase meat, cheese and crackers.

loans.name: Uzima Group

texts.fr:
Chantal est une commerçante âgée de 42ans qui habite au quartier Buyenzi en Mairie de Bujumbura. Elle  gère son restaurant depuis 12 un métier qu’elle a commence alors qu’elle faisait des habits, des produits cosmétiques et des souliers. Elle est mariée à Ibrahim, un chauffeur. Ils ont ensemble  8 enfants dont 3 étudient. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 6e année primaires.
 Elle demande le crédit pour augmenter son capital et agrandir le volume des services offerts dans son restaurant pour  réaliser de grands bénéfices. 
Elle espère que son business va se développer pour lui permettre de subvenir a ses besoins essentiels et construire sa propre maison parce qu’elle a une parcelle. 
Elle est membre  du groupe  solidaire« UZIMA».
texts.en:
Chantal is a 42-year-old businesswoman living in the neighborhood of Buyenzi en Marie in Bujumbura. She has run her restaurant for 12 years, a business that she launched when she was a seamstress and sold cosmetics and shoes. She is married to Ibrahim, a driver. Together they have eight children, of whom three attend school. Chantal studied until sixth grade in elementary school.

She applies for a loan to increase her working capital in order to offer more services in her restaurant and make more profit. She hopes that her business will grow and enable her to provide for her basic needs and build her own house, since she has a plot of land.

Chantal is a member of Uzima Solidarity Group.

loans.use: to increase her working capital in order to offer more services in her restaurant.

loans.name: Young

texts.en:
Mrs. Young, 42, owns a small kiosk in the community for selling food at breakfast and lunch time to her husband's motorbike passengers and to local villagers. She has over five years experience in this business and makes around $4 of profit each day to ensure that her family has a comfortable standard of living. 

She has been married for many years to Mr. Houl, 41, a motor taxi driver, and they are blessed with a baby. Because the old motorbike which her husband uses for his taxi service often breaks down, they are used to spending a lot of money on repairing it. 

Therefore, Mrs. Young is applying for Kiva loan to buy a new motorcycle for her husband. She will use the rest of the funds to buy more cooking ingredients for making food to sell. This is why she has decided to look for lenders on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle for her husband and to buy more cooking ingredients for making food to sell.

loans.name: Eunice Esther

texts.es:
Eunice vive en el barrio Carrizal de la ciudad de Barranquilla, lugar caracterizado por la alegría de sus habitantes y la proliferación de actividades productivas e independientes que tienen sus habitantes,  para lograr mediante el trabajo digno el sustento de sus familias.  Eunice en condición de separada, todos los días se levanta con un gran sueño y no es otro  que  ver a sus hija, que vive en la capital de Colombia, Bogotá, exitososa con su familia  y que su hijo logre  terminar sus estudios universitarios y estos son justamente  su mayor motor en su vida diaria.  
Eunice tiene un negocio donde se dedica a la venta de mercancía variada, actividad que aprendió desde que tenía 15 años, cuando su madre la enseñó, pues ella le ayudaba a recaudar la cartera de sus clientes cuando era comerciante. Eunice es una mujer  maravillosa, valiente, emprendedora y disciplinada, por eso ha logrado salir adelante con sus dos hijos. Por eso para lograr que su hijo logre conseguir sus sueños a nivel educativo, está solicitando su primer credikiva con el cual pagará  su primer semestre de una carrera técnica que quiere estudiar. Eunice ha recibido 36 créditos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, su mayor anhelo es fortalecer su negocio para en un futuro estar más solvente, porque a través de esta organización,  que la ha apoyado con apalancamientos financieros, formación empresarial y orientación, ha logrado aumentar su nivel de bienestar y fortalecer su familia, durante estos 17 años de estar vinculada.
texts.en:
Eunice lives in the city of Barranquilla’s Carrizal neighborhood, a place noted for the joy of its residents and for the proliferation of productive and independent activities the residents engage in to support their families through honorable work.

Eunice is separated.  She gets out of bed every day with the same great dream: to see her daughter who lives in Colombia's capital, Bogotá, to be successful with her family and that her son manages to complete his university education.  These are precisely the motivating factors in her daily life.

Eunice has a business selling varied merchandise, a business she learned when she was 15 years old from her mother.  She would help her mother collect payments from her customers when she was a merchant.  

Eunice is a marvelous, brave, enterprising and disciplined woman which is why she’s managed to get ahead with her two children.  In order for her son to reach his level of education dream, she is asking for her first Kiva loan to pay for the first semester of the technical career he wants to go into.

Eunice has gotten 36 loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  Her greatest wish is to strengthen her business in order to be more solvent in future because through her 17-year association with this organization, that has supported her with loans, business training and advice, she’s managed to increase the level of wellbeing and strengthen her family.

loans.use: to pay her first semester's tuition.

loans.name: Segundo Manongo

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 53 años de edad, vive en su casa propia con su esposo e hijos, el cual tiene los servicios de agua y luz, ubicada en la zona urbana del distrito de Olmos que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona la actividad principal es la agricultura, ganadería y turismo (tiene festividades religiosas y lugares muy bonitos).

Segundo desde hace 8 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral (pavos y gallinas), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales; para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento ideal y poderlos ofrecer en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtener muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos familiares.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar más variedad de aves de corral y su respectivo alimento, con la finalidad de obtener un mejor precio con sus clientes y así mejorar  el nivel de vida de su familia. Segundo es una padre trabajador, empeñoso y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su negocio crezca para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo is 53 years old living in his own house with his wife and children.
