The house has electricity and running water and is located in the urban part of Olmos District which belongs to Lambayeque Department.   This area’s main activities are farming, livestock raising and tourism (it has religious festivals and very pretty places).

Segundo has been raising barnyard fowl (turkeys and chickens) for the last 8 years.  His corral is located in his back yard.  He feeds them nutritionally balanced feed and natural grains so that his animals will have ideal growth and he will be able to sell them in the various local markets and earn good profits to meet his household expenses.

He has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to buy more variety of fowl and their respective feed with the aim in mind of getting better prices from his customers and thereby improve his family’s standard of living.  Segundo is a hardworking, dedicated father who is very responsible and all he wants is that his business succeeds in order to move his family ahead.

loans.use: to buy more barnyard fowl and their respective feed.

loans.name: Santos Manuel

texts.es:
Santos, es soltero, vive con sus padres, se dedica al transporte de carga, tiene dos años de dedicarse a transportar arena, grava, tierra, piedra y bloques, este trabajo le provee los ingresos para solventar sus necesidades.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de repuestos para el camión, ya que el eje y roster del camión necesitan ser reparados, el préstamo le ayudara a cubrir la compra de repuestos y pagar el mecánico.
Él quiere a través de su trabajo estabilizarse económicamente, y mantener el camión en buen estado.
texts.en:
Santos is single and lives with his parents.  He works in freight transport.  For two years he has worked transporting sand, gravel, earth, stone and cinder blocks; this work provides income to meet his needs.

He is currently seeking a loan for the purchase of spare parts for his truck, as the truck's transmission and axle need to be repaired.  This loan will help cover the purchase of the spare parts and pay the mechanic.

He wants to achieve financial stability through his work, and to keep the truck in good condition.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his truck's axel and transmission, also to pay the mechanic.

loans.name: Chamshed

texts.ru: Чамшед проживает в районе Хуросон. Ему 26 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Он живет вместе с родителями. Его отец и брат находятся в Российской Федерации. Сам Чамшед имеет высшее образование. По специальности  он биолог. В этой области проработал два года. Сейчас Чамшед предоставляет услугу, такси. Он берет кредит для установки нового оборудования и ремонта автомашины. Чамшед хочет установить оборудование для природного газа.
texts.en: Chamshed lives in the Khuroson district.  He is 26 years old, married and has three children.  He lives together with his parents.  His father and brother are in the Russian Federation.  Chamshed has a higher education and is a biologist.  He spent two years working in that field.  Currently, he provides a taxi service.  He is requesting this loan for the installation of new equipment and repairs of his car.  Chamshed wants to install equipment for natural gas.

loans.use: to install new equipment and repair his car

loans.name: Ruka Rayen Group

texts.es:
Éste Banco comunal se llama “Ruka Rayen” lo conforman 18 emprendedoras que se dedican a diferentes rubros, principalmente artesanía en madera y lana. Todos ellas pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco.
Miriam integrante del banco comunal quien en la foto se encuentra en la primera fila de pie, en el lugar de al medio, viste una chaqueta color beige y su cabello es ondeado y corto. 
Se dedica al rubro de la artesanía desde hace 30 años, específicamente tallado en madera, tejidos y telares en lana. 
Su mercadería usualmente la compra en una feria ubicada en la ciudad de Cauquenes ahí compra lanas, maderas y herramientas. Comenta que tiene un gran número de clientes, por lo que son conocidos, sus ventas durante el año las realiza en su mismo domicilio y durante la temporada de verano se instala con sus productos en una feria artesanal dentro de un gimnasio municipal. 
Con el crédito comprará lanas, para sus telares y tejidos. 	
Sus metas en su negocio son tener un local establecido, en el cual pueda ofrecer y vender sus productos de artesanía durante todo el año, en alguna zona turística. 
Miriam vive junto a su marido y sus tres hijos de 22, 20 y 7 años de edad, sus hijos mayores trabajan de manera dependiente. A ella le hubiese gustado haber estudiado la carrera de administración de empresas, comenta que ahora es más complicado, ya que debe trabajar.
Sus motivaciones de continuar con el negocio se deben a que sus ingresos le permiten ayudar a su familia y que estos le permitirán brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de los servicios brindados por Fondo esperanza, especialmente por el crédito, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Comenta que la relación grupal es buena, ya que son solidarios y comprometidos con los demás emprendedores. Las capacitaciones le han servido para distribuir sus ingresos.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Ruka Rayen”. It is made up of 18 entrepreneurs that work in different professions, mainly wood and fiber crafts.  They all live in the city of Temuco.  

Miriam is a member of the communal bank and is located standing in the middle of the front row.  She is wearing a beige jacket and has short, wavy hair.   

She has been working as an artisan for 30 years, specifically in wood carving and woolen fabrics and knits.  She usually buys her materials at a market in the city of Cauquenes.  There she buys wool, wood and tools.  She says that she has a large number of customers that she knows.  She makes her sales during the year from her house, but during the summer season she sets up and sells her products at a craft fair located in a municipal gymnasium. 

With the loan she will buy wool for her knits and fabrics.  Her goal is to have an established local for her business in a tourist area where she can offer and sell her crafts year-round. 

Miriam lives with her husband and three children, ages 22, 20 and 7.  Her older children work in a dependent manner.  She would have liked to have studied for a career in business administration, but she says that now it is too complicated as she has to work.  She is motivated to continue working at her business as her income helps her family and will allow her to give her children a better quality of life.  

She is very happy and grateful for the services that Fondo Esperanza has given her, especially the loan, since it has helped her to invest in her business.  She says that the group relationship is good since they are very supportive and committed to the other entrepreneurs and the training has helped her to allocate her income.  

Temuco is the capital of the region of Araucanía.  The city is located 670 km to the south of Santiago (the capital of Chile).  There are a series of lakeside resorts located on the outskirts (Pucón, Villarrica) and very striking native flora and fauna concentrated in the nature reserves nearby.  It is also worth noting that 50% of the Mapuche, indigenous people, that exist in our country live in this region.

loans.use: purchase wool for her fabrics and knits.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Imelda has a shop from which she sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Imelda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Imelda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Ma Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora Ma Guadalupe es madre de 2 hijos de los cuales quiere ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida y confort. Para poder ofrecer a sus hijos lo mejor su esposo y ella trabajan en maquiladora desde hace varios años y para tener un dinero extra se quedan mas horas de la normales. 
La casa donde actualmente vive es de interés social, y esta muy pequeña por dentro, por tal motivo quiere construir un cuarto en la parte de enfrente para extender la sala comedor y de esa manera hacer mas grandes las recamaras. Aunque la construcción ya lleva un avance que con ahorros levanto necesita más capital para terminar. Para Maria es muy importante ofrecer a sus hijos un buen patrimonio y mayor espacio donde ellos puedan tener su propio espacio. Para poder terminar su proyecto necesita comprar material como cemento, arena, varillas y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en:
María Guadalupe is the mother of two children that she wants to provide a better quality of life and comfort for.  To provide the best for her children and her husband she has worked at an assembly plant for several years and to earn extra money she stays overtime.

The house she’s living in at present is a public subsidized one.  It’s very small inside so she wants to add a room to the front to extend the living room/dining room and thus enlarge the bedrooms.  Although the construction project has already started with savings she had, she needs more capital to complete the job.  For María it’s very important to offer her children a good patrimony and more room where they can have their own space.  To be able to finish her project she needs to buy materials like cement, sand and iron rods and to pay labor costs.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Olfa Marlene

texts.es:
La Señora. Olfa es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Floreciendo, vive por la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es reconocida por su belleza arquitectónica, su reserva natural, su variedad en la gastronomía típica, la cultura y tradiciones de su gente quienes son de un corazón cálido y amable.

Doña Olfa tiene 52 años, está  separada y a concebido 9 hijos, 5 son mayores de edad, casados e independientes,  tres de sus hijos solteros trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, y su ultima hija está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

La Señora. Olfa se dedica a la venta de comida y de viandas, esta actividad la realiza desde su casa, lleva 2 años con este negocio y trabaja de lunes a viernes.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 5 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una cocina industrial y vajillas.
 
Su sueño es  comprarse un terreno para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Olfa is a member of the 'Mujeres Floreciendo' community bank and lives in the city of Cuenca.  This is a city which is well known for its architectural beauty, its nature reserve, its traditional cuisine, its culture and the traditions of its people who are warm and friendly.

Olfa is 52 years old, separated, and has nine children.  Five of her children are grown up, married, and live independently. Three of her single children work and help her out financially.  Her youngest daughter is studying at a school in the city.  She does not own her own home but rents instead.

Olfa sells food and packed lunches.  She carries out this work from her home.  She has been in this business for two years and works from Monday to Friday.

Olfa has been a member of her community bank for 5 years and she will invest her new loan in buying an industrial oven, and dishes.  Her dream is to buy a plot of land on which to build a house.

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven, and dishes

loans.name: Isedro

texts.en:
Isedro is 62 years old and is a married man with 4 children. He runs a tricycle taxi business and has had this business for more than 5 years. Isedro also buys and sells fruits and vegetables to the people in his town. 

Isedro is asking for a loan to purchase tricycle spare parts. He hopes to be a successful businessman in the future.

loans.use: to purchase tricycle spare parts.

loans.name: Lucia Marilet

texts.es: Lucia , 27 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo de 7 años de edad, esta estudiando 4 grado de la primaria, ella es comerciante vende ropa de hombre ,mujer y niños , vende productos de belleza, también aprendió el oficio de costurera ella cose ropa solo para la temporada en que inicia el años escolar o fechas festivas del año antes se dedica a la costura por completo pero desde hace 5 años se dedica a vender ropa y la costura paso a ser una actividad que realiza en ocasiones especiales durante el año. Ella realizo el préstamo para compra de mercadería tales como ropa para caballero pantalones, camisas, camisetas, ropa para dama, ropa para niños. Esta inversión le ayudara a surtir de ropa nueva su mercadería y aprovechar las ventas navideñas. Entre sus metas esta el tener un local fijo donde pueda vender su mercadería y seguir luchando por darle un hogar digno a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Lucía is 29, married, and has a seven year-old son, who is in fourth grade of primary school. She is a small businessperson and sells men's, women's, and children's clothing; she also sells beauty products.  

She also leaned the seamstress trade. She only sews clothing for the back-to-school season and for holidays. Before, she was fully devoted to sewing, but for the past five years, she has been selling clothing, and sewing became something that that she does on special occasions during the year. 

She took out the loan to buy merchandise such as men's clothing, pants, shirts, T-shirts, ladies' clothing, and children's clothing.  This investment will help her stock her merchandise with new clothing, and take advantage of the Christmas sales season. Among her goals are to have a permanent location where she can sell her merchandise, and to continue striving to provide her small son with a decent home.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as men's clothing, pants, shirts, T-shirts, ladies' clothing and children's clothing.

loans.name: Anazita

texts.en:
Anazita is 50-years-old, married, and has two full-grown children. Anazita is from Aguada, Ozamis City. To make a living, Anazita operates a transportation services business. Anazita has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Anazita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anazita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 26,000 PHP from GDMPC.

Anazita is requesting a new loan of 33,050 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle so that she can offer better service. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Anazita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto, de 53 años de edad divorciado con 4 hijos, ellos viven en la comunidad de Monterrico, del distrito de Sivia. Alberto es un gran hombre de mucho talento para los trabajos en el campo, pues a los 14 años ya contaba con una pequeña extensión de cultivo de café donde le dedicaba su tiempo con la finalidad de obtener los frutos luego comercializarlos y de esta manera obtener un ingreso económico con el que ya podían cubrir su alimentación y algunos gastos en su educación. Al pasar los años Alberto prosiguió con los trabajos dejando de lado los estudios por falta de recursos económicos, fue así que él único camino que le quedaba era trabajar en su parcela, seguir cultivando café que gracias a la enseñanza de sus padres puede en la actualidad producir una buena cantidad de granos de café. Generalmente trabaja solo, pero en épocas de cosecha siempre requiere del apoyo de los peones.
Alberto esta agradecido y contento por quienes en la actualidad es un buen agricultor, que gracias a ello viene logrando buena estabilidad económica que hace que el y sus queridos hijos puedan tener una vida digna. Este será  su primer credito con MFP,  por lo que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas.
Alberto, agradece a los integrantes de su banco comunal por desarrollar una buena labor juntos. Con los 1000 nuevos soles contratará peones para que limpien y saquen la maleza de su campo agrícola de café
texts.en:
Alberto is 53 years old, divorced with 4 children. They live in Monterrico in the district of Sivia. Alberto is a great man, very talented when it comes to farmwork as at the age of 14 he already had a small coffee-growing area where he spent his time with the final objective of obtaining the fruits and subsequently selling them and in this way obtaining an income with which to cover his food costs and some of his education expenses. Over the years Alberto continued with his farmwork setting aside his studies for a lack of economic resources. Thus the only option he had was to work his plot of land, continue growing coffee and, thanks to his parents' instruction, currently produce a large amount of coffee beans. Generally he works alone but at harvest time he always needs the help of manual labourers.

Alberto is grateful and happy for now being a good farmer as thanks to this he is managing to achieve economic stability which means that he and his 4 children can have a dignified life. This will be his first loan with MFP and he agrees to make the repayments on time.

Alberto is grateful to the members of his communal bank for developing a good working relationship together. With the 1000 nuevos soles (PEN) he will hire manual labourers to clear and remove the weeds from his coffee field.

loans.use: to employ manual labourers.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly is 23 years old and married with two sons. She lives with her husband, a deliveryman, and their children in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Ly supports her family by sewing woolen clothing in her home. She would like to use the loan to buy wool and materials so she can increase her production of woolen clothing. 

Ly hopes that by doing this, her business will run smoothly, she will help improve her family's living conditions and she will be able to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: To buy wool and materials to increase her production of woolen clothing.

loans.name: Tes

texts.en:
Mrs. Tes is from Prey Chor district. Agriculture is a main part of what she does. She is now 56 years old and married. She has two children who always assist her on the farm. Tes grows types of crops, such as rice, pepper plants (chili), and vegetables, based on the season.

She would like to apply for a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a pumping machine, water pipes, and fertilizers for her chili plants. This loan will improve her business and reduce some expenses that she usually pays for her laborers. 

She is very happy and grateful for the constant support from lenders for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a pumping machine, water pipes, and fertilizers for her chili plants.

loans.name: Bonface

texts.en:
Bonface is 28 years old.  He makes and sells wood carvings in Malindi.  He has been in the business for the last two years, with a monthly income of KES 25,000. 

He was introduced to KADET Ltd by a credit officer and he is applying for his first loan with KADET Ltd of KES 30,000.  He intends to buy additional stocks of wood for his business. Bonface will save the anticipated profit and help take care of himself as he grows his business.
 
In the future he hopes to continue growing his business and also venture into other investments.

loans.use: to buy wood  for his business.

loans.name: Videkon Group

texts.fr: VIDEKON est un  groupement composé de treize personnes qui vivent toutes dans le même quartier au Bénin. C’est la quatrième fois que ce groupement sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, afin d’élever le niveau de leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. La représentante du groupement du nom de Marie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Marie est âgée de 47 ans et vit dans une ville du Bénin. Marie est une veuve ayant trois enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux ne sont plus à sa charge. Marie vit avec l’enfant qui lui reste à charge et assure seule ses différentes charges. Marie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis une dizaine d’année, Marie vend des ignames et de l’haricot à son domicile. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à ainsi subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de l’enfant à charge. Marie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Ce crédit permettra certainement à Marie et aux autres membres du groupement VIDEKON, de rehausser leur activité et d'accroître leur chiffre d'affaire et leur revenu. Les trois premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
VIDEKON is a group of thirteen people who all live in the same district in Benin. The group is seeking financial assistance from ALIDé for the fourth time to bolster their activity and better meet customer demand. All three previous loans were correctly repaid.

The group’s representative is Mary, seen with her hand raised in the photo. Mary is 47 years old and lives in a city of Benin. She is a widow with three children, all in school, and two of them no longer in her care. She lives with her dependent child and handles the various household responsibilities on her own. She did not attend school. 

For the past ten years or so, Mary has been selling yams and beans from her home. The income earned through this activity allows her to support herself and her child. She buys her stock at a market in Benin. 

This loan will help Mary and the other members of the group VIDEKON to boost their activity, and increase their sales and revenue.

loans.use: to buy yams and beans for resale.

loans.name: Ortuk

texts.en: Ortuk was born in 1959. He is married and has 3 children. His wife is a teacher. He worked in a school as a master repairing desks, chairs etc. Ortuk is going to open his own business. Ortuk wants to open a workshop where he will make furniture. Ortuk’s wife will help him with managing the business. Ortuk is asking for a loan of 10000 Somoni to buy equipment for making furniture. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy equipment for making furniture

loans.name: San Tap's Group

texts.en:
San, 57 years old, is a villager from Pursat province and the mother of seven children. Nowadays she earns income to support her family via rice farming, sewing, pigs and duck-raising.

This is the first time for San with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the leader of a group of two, she will use her loan portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizer. She hopes that she can get a good yield from her farm and earn more income to support her family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Shagufta Islam

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Shagufta is a housewife living with her spouse in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Shagufta husband’s works hard to support her family. He has an auto rickshaw transportation services business in the Multan, Pakistan.

Shagufta is borrowing 30,000 PKR through BRAC Pakistan in order to buy an auto rickshaw for her husband’s transportation services business.

Shagufta has been sustaining her husband’s business activities through her previous loan from BRAC Pakistan.

Shagufta and her family will be thankful to the Kiva lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy an auto rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Leandro

texts.es: Leandro de 40 años es un artista que desde temprana edad, ha dedicado gran parte de las páginas de su vida a su pasión; pintar óleos con total majestuosidad.  Esta actividad le ha permitido durante siete años de carrera profesional, aportar a su hogar el sustento y bienestar, él está comprometido y es padre de dos hijos de 13 y 9 años de edad.  Diariamente se deleita en la elaboración de sus obras y en sus tiempos libres los comercializa, sin embargo encontró otro medio que le ayuda a incrementar sus ingresos y es por medio de la venta de artículos varios que sus amigos y familiares le encargan; prendas de vestir, accesorios, artículos para el hogar y demás. Leandro realizó una solicitud de crédito, un credikiva, oportunidad para vincularse a la vida financiera a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar lienzos, pinturas en óleo, pintuas acrílicas, sellantes, bastidores y diluyentes.  Esta financiación le permitirá continuar con su actividad sin contratiempos y tener su capacidad creativa sin límites de colores y texturas.

loans.use: comprar lienzos, pinturas en óleo, pintuas acrílicas, sellantes, bastidores y diluyentes

loans.name: Dotto

texts.en: Dotto lives in Kigamboni area of  Dar es Salaam.She is married and has three children.Two of them are in primary school ,one in secondary school.With the help of her husband she managed to open a grocery store five years ago.Her business is good with the exception of insufficient working capital, a competitive disadvantage for her. X-mass period has almost depleted all her stock of cold drinks.Most of the drinks sh sells are from Coca-Cola Company.But recently the company plant at Dar es Salaam failed to meet costomers dermand.It only supply big customers.Other customers like Dotto has to order from another  plant located in Moshi (nearby region) at a bit higher price.More than enough capital is needed. Few chairs within the grocery also acts as a drawback to her business.She has to overcome these drawbacks before her competitors grab her market share. She is in need of USD 750 to facilitate her plan.

loans.use: Adding stock of Cold drinks,chairs and tables

loans.name: Soltan

texts.en:
Soltan is a 37 year old Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region. He is  settled in the  Fizuli region, Bala Behmenli village and is married and has 2 children.
He has been in this business for 15 years.
Having borrowed $400 he bought wheels for his taxi
Now he needs a loan of $800 to do capital repairs.

loans.use: To do capital repairs

loans.name: Luaipou

texts.en: Luaipou is 46 years old and lives with her husband and children in the small Samoan village of Seesee.  She is adamant about being self-reliant and so she works long hours on her business everyday except Sunday.  Sunday is the day which she devotes to her church community and family.  She runs a stand where she sells fresh and packaged foods.  In a good week, she can bring in USD 150 from these sales.  Luaipou is a determined woman and is anxious to expand her business and improve her family’s standard of living.  Luaipou has repaid all prior SPBD loans in full. With new loan funds, Luaipou will both purchase more food supplies for her stand to re-sell as well as undertake a home improvement project.

loans.use: Luaipou will purchase packaged snacks, samoan cocoa, ice-pops, potted plants for her store.  The loan will also be used to purchase building supplies for a home improvement project.

loans.name: Hapizova

texts.ru:
G. specializes in the trade of milk products. Five years ago, she took responsibility for her family because her husband was sent to jail. In order to be able to take care of her four young sons and the constant problems with her flat, G. was forced to start selling at the nearby market. G. is originally from Uzbekistan and could have moved her family there but her husband is imprisoned in Tajikistan, so she decided to stay.
Her day starts at 4 in the morning when she starts going through the villages buying milk products. She spends the rest of the day selling them at the central market in Isfara. Her sons have learned how to bake bread, cook food, do laundry and run other household errands in order to help their mother. Since childhood, one of her sons has been shortsighted. In January 2007 G. received a loan through “MicroInvenst” for her son’s surgery. After paying back her first loan, she received a loan to expand her business – the sale of milk products. Currently she is planning to receive another loan to expand her business, which is the only source of income for G. and her family.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Гулчехра специализируется на продаже молочных продуктов. Пять лет назад она вынуждена была взять на свои хрупкие женские плечи все тяготы семейной жизни, так как к несчастью ее мужа посадили в тюрьму. Забота о 4 несовершеннолетних сыновьях и постоянные проблемы с неблагоустроенной квартирой вынудили Гулчехру выйти на базар торговать. Сама она родом из Узбекистана и могла бы со своими детьми переехать туда к своим родным, но ее муж здесь в Таджикистане и она обязана остаться.
Ее рабочий день начинается в 4 утра, когда она начинает ездить по кишлакам и собирать молочные продукты. Затем до 5 вечера она торгует на центральном рынке г. Исфары. Ее сыновья научились сами печь хлеб, готовить еду, стирать, убирать, вести другие дела по домашнему хозяйству – помогают матери. Один из сыновей Гулчехры с детства страдает близорукостью. В январе 2007 года Гулчехра получила займ в Микроинвест для операции своего сына. Погасив первый займ она получила займ на расширение своего бизнеса – торговлю молочными продуктами. Сейчас она собирается получить очередной займ на расширение своего бизнеса, являющегося основным источником дохода для Гулчехры и ее семьи.

loans.use: to expand business

loans.name: Gildo Jorge

texts.pt:
Gilda M. was born and raised in Inhambe. He joined the FDM program in 2006. He is married, and doesn't have any children yet, but he wants to have at least one in the future. Gilda sells tableware and kitchenware to support his family. With this loan he plans on increasing his inventory in order to keep up with demand. In the future, Gilda wants to save in order to improve his home.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga Kiva Volunteer.

Gildo M. e natural da Provincia de Inhambane. Entrou para o Programa de credito do FDM em 2006. E casado mas infelizmente nao tem nenhum filho e ele gostaria de ter pelo menos 1 filho.Ele vende loica. Com o dinheiro do emprestimo quer aumentar as quantidades de loica a adquirir nos armazens para poder diversificar o tipo de louca que vende na sua banca de acordo com as exigencias dos seus clientes. No futuro pensa com os rendimentos melhorar a sua residencia.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Eudocia Georgina

texts.es:
Since childhood, Doña Georgina has worked in the farm. Her discipline and dedication have made her a a strong-will woman with high morals, a good heart and good energy. Doña Georgina is full of energy each day, even though she lives by herself, she gets strength and energy from her grandchildren who come to visit her often. She is very active in her community and would like to develop her leadership skills further. Recently, the town people selected her as their representative in the community, and since then she has been able to achieve many things benefiting the entire community. In order to support herself, she raises small animals, and she also grows potato and corn. Her inmense motivation to succeed and to survive each day, have led her to wanting to purchase a small milking cow to sell the milk for profit. Be part of Doña Georgina's dream!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Georgina desde su niñez se ha dedicado a las labores y quehaceres del campo y esta formación que obtuvo en su hogar con mucha dedicación y disciplina la ha llevado a ser una mujer de alto valor, por su sencillez, corazón y fortaleza.Doña Georgina está cada día más animosa, a pesar de que ahora vive sola, ya que disfruta de la visita de sus nietos y ahora trabaja aún más porque desarrolla sus capacidades de liderazgo en su comunidad.Hace poco la eligieron como gobernadora y es tan eficiente su gestión que ha logrado beneficios para su comunidad. Para su sostén diario se dedica a la crianza de animales, también se dedica al cultivo de papa y maíz y las enormes ganas de sobresalir y procurarse bienestar la llevan a desear adquirir una vaquita para extraer la leche para su comercialización e incremento de su nivel de vida..Solidarízate con Doña Georgina para que pueda alcanzar su anhelo..

loans.use: To purchase a small milking cow

loans.name: Litara

texts.en:
Litara U. is fifty-four years of age from the village of Vaiusu. She is the Secretary of the Center and she is one of the reliable members of the programme. Litara is growing old and not suited to hard jobs. She has working children but she never relies on them for her needs and wants.

Litara noticed that most of the women in her area go to other villages to play bingo. She organizes bingo on Wednesday, Friday, and Saturday nights and she manages to bring around 500 Tala ($200 USD) per night. She is very happy to run her business and she is looking forward to earning more loans from SPBD.

loans.use: To buy iron roofing for house improvement

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam, 27, sells snacks, beverages, etc., at her house, earning USD10.5, while her husband, O., is no longer working. She is requesting a loan of USD125 to fill her shop with more inventory and as a member of MBK she is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To fill her shop with more inventory

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Nadia is a 36-year-old mother of 3. She works and lives with her family in the Beirut suburbs. Nadia has a small bakery in which she makes a kind of bread that is called 'saj'. Nadia needs a loan to buy the needed provisions to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy provisions for her little bakery

loans.name: Saltan Mahmood

texts.en:
Saltan Mahmood lives in district 15 of Kabul in Afghanistan. He is an educated, single man.

Saltan has a retail shop. He has been in this business for the past four years and has dedicated himself to it. Now he wants to expand the business, so he has requested an individual loan to buy more goods for his shop. He hopes to improve the economic situation for his family and make good income to help them better.

loans.use: To buy more goods for his shop

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is 30 years old and is married with 3 children, ages 14, 12 and 4 years old. Fatuma owns a small general store, which she started in 2002. Everyday, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from sales. She now hopes for a loan of $175 to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more inventory.

loans.name: Otabeck

texts.en: Otabeck M.  lives in the high-mountain region of  Tajikistan where  agriculture and livestock is a very prominent business. It is one of the main businesses in the Asht region. Mr. M. is married and has 2 children. He is a very hard-working man and a good family man. He and his wife work on the collective farm but since it is seasonal work, they are also engaged in livestock. Now Mr. Otabeck M.  applies to KIVA with a request for a business development loan of 1900 TJS for 7 months. The loan will be used to purchase a milking cow and to begin  a milk-sour business.

loans.use: To purchase a milking cow and to begin  a milk-sour business.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Click this link to view Herminia's first loan

Herminia is a member of the Village Bank Prosperity. She is married, 53 years old and has two children. She sells toys and cleaning supplies at a stand she rents in the Santa Clara market. She also works during celebration times and special occasions selling various products such as gifts for mother's day, games, and other things depending on the demand.

Herminia needs a loan of 1200 soles ($US425), which she will invest in the purchase of toys, flowerpots and various other gifts. Herminia's dreams are to finish the construction of her house and to own her own stand at the market.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of toys, flowerpots and various other gifts for her market stand.

loans.name: Estelista Apolinaria

texts.en:
Click this link to view Estelista's first loan.

Estelista is a member of the Arco Iris Village Bank. She is 47 years, unmarried with one son. Estelista travels to regional fairs to buy cheese, meat, cereal and other products to sell in the Nery Garcia Market. She also delivers goods to the city of Lima. Additionally, she raises cattle and pigs on her pasture and embroiders tablecloths that she sells in the regional fairs.

Estelista needs a loan of 1000 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($US375) to buy more meat, cheese and cereal to expand her business.

Estelista's hopes are for better business and that her son studies hard and has good health.

loans.use: To buy more meat, cheese and cereal to expand her business.

loans.name: Amirali

texts.ru:
Amirali B. lives in the Khuroson region. He is 37 years old, married, and has 3 children. He has secondary education and was trained as a telecommunications worker. He works at "Tochiktelecom" in Khuroson region, and additionaly, he is in the business of buying and selling animals. He has been in this business for the past 3 years. He would like to obtain a loan so he could purchase several sheep. He plans to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Бобиев Амирали проживает в районе Хуросон.Возраст 37 лет.Женат имеет троих детей,образование среднее.По специальности связист ,работает Точиктелекоме в районе Хуросон,дополнительно занимается бизнесом купли продажи скота .Имеет опыт в бизнесе3 года.Хочет получит кредит для покупки овец.Погасить кредит планирует в течении 10 месяцев

loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma R. M. vive en casa de sus padres (zona de San Pedro, ciudad de La Paz) con su hijo de 18 años.
Irma es peinadora y presta sus servicios en domicilios particulares dela ciudad. 
Su vivienda ya tiene varios años y los techos se han deteriorado tanto que presentan filtraciones (sobre todo en época de lluvias).
El crédito solicitado será destinado a la refacción de los techos de calamina en dos habitaciones.
Esta es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente.
texts.en:
Irma R. M. lives with her parents (zone of San Pedro, city of La Paz) and her 18 year old son. Irma is a hairdresser and offers this service at the client’s home. Irma’s home is old and the roof is in a particular bad condition, and during the rainy season it gets worse as all the water filters through the house. The requested loan will be used to repair the roof and ceiling in two rooms. This it is the first time that Irma is requesting a loan and the socioeconomic analysis carried out determines that Irma qualifies for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair the roof and ceiling in two rooms

loans.name: Mrs. Vin Khum's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan, which is located in Svay Pok Village in Kampong Chhnang Province, consists of nine people. Mrs.Vin K. is the village bank president as selected by the members. She and her husband, Mr. Norn Kron, are farmers who cultivate rice to earn a living. The plantation has recently become infertile producing smaller yields so Mrs Vin K. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to increase crop production. Mrs. Vin K. is 36 years old and the mother of four children who are all attending the local school. 

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Three members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to increase crop yields.

loans.name: Nob

texts.en: Mrs. Nob C. is a farmer in Chi Neang Village in Kampong Cham Province. On her plantation, she can earn a small income from her small piece of land. She now wants to expand her rice revenue so she decided to ask for a loan to buy a piece of land to cultivate more rice. Mrs. Nob C. is a 53-year-old widow with a child who is employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Mary Nakayima’S Group

texts.en:
Mary is a leader of 5 members of a group. She is a 60-year-old single mother. She had three children but all died and Mary takes care of the four orphans of her late children. She resides in and owns a five-roomed house where she is staying with five people and only two people bring in additional income to the family. They have electricity and piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day.

Mary works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She doesn’t use public transport as she buys from delivery vans, and also there is depot nearby. She operates a pub at her home. Mary sells to an average of 20 customers a day and works seven days a week. Mary sells to all categories of people, excluding children under 18 years. Mary has been in this business for over ten years. She owns a bakery in the village, besides the pub business. She has been with MCDT for eight years working all this time with the same group mates and servicing her twentieth loan. Mary wants to use this loan to buy more crates of soda, boxes of mineral water and beers and necklaces. She is aspiring to build rental rooms in the plot she bought from previous loans.

loans.use: To buy more crates of soda and beer

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena A. is sixty-two years old. She lives with her husband in Obuasi. Her four children have all completed school and are gainfully employed. As old as she is, she still works to make some money and also to keep herself active. Abena enjoys trading a lot and has been in the business of trading in maize. She has been trading for ten years. Abena buys her goods directly from maize farmers in her community and those in the nearby towns. She distributes her maize to small ‘chop bar’ (restaurant) operators in her locality. She wants to use the loan to procure more bags of maize so that she can meet the increasing demand of her customers. Abena belongs to the community group called All Nation Trust Bank group. In this group, members guarantee each other as collateral so as to access the loan and support each other in handling repayment. She was attending her group meeting when her photo was taken.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes G. is 51 years old and lives in the village of Antagan 2nd, Tumauini, Isabela. Her husband, Eduardo, serves as a Barangay Councilor and also works as a farmer. They have four children: 32-year-old Romel, a high school graduate; 27-year-old Elmer, an elementary school graduate; 24-year-old Emerson, a high school graduate; and 22-year-old Edimer, a college graduate. Three of their children are already married and the youngest is now working. 

Mercedes has run a sari-sari store (a community based store) for almost a year now. The income from her store supports the basic needs of their family and serves as a rolling capital for her business. She is applying for a loan of PHP 5000 (125 USD) which will be used to purchase basic in-demand commodities, such as soaps, soft drinks and rice. She hopes that her business will improve because it has also helped them in their farming needs. Her dream of improving her business is her motivation to work hard and live a simple life.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina es una mujer trabajadora, que a sus 41 años es madre de 3 hijos Wilfredo de 18, Yda de 14 y Juan de 10 años, a los cuales cuida con mucho amor y en compañía de su esposo Claudio de 50 años, juntos quieren salir adelante y mejorar sus ingresos económicos, para pagar los estudios superiores de sus niños. En su pequeño barrio Villa el Salvador, Paulina tiene su carnicería, con la cual abastece a todo sus vecinos, es muy concurrida y por lo general acaba con toda la carne que vende, tiene 10 años en este negocio, el cual le a alcanzado para alimentar a sus hijos y pagar sus estudios, pero siente que no le será suficiente para correr con los gatos de los estudios superiores, por eso desea poner una carnicería en el centro de la ciudad de Juliaca, donde pueda vender a muchas más persona. A ella le gusta conversar con sus clientes, disfruta mucho haciéndolo, pero le es muy difícil llevar la carne hasta su barrio ya que está muy lejos de la ciudad, pero igual no decae en su afán de salir adelante y está dispuesta a trabajar mucho para lograrlo. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, con el dinero de sus préstamos ha podido mejorar su carnicería, es por eso que piensa pagar todas sus cuotas y no traerle problemas a su banco comunal. Con los seiscientos nuevos soles que solicita planea comprar más carne y mejorar sus instalaciones, para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Paulina is a hard-working woman of 41 who has three children: Wilfredo, 18; Yda, 14; and Juan, 10. She cares for them lovingly and together with her husband Claudio, aged 50, they want to prosper and improve their income in order to pay for higher education for their children. In their small suburb of Villa el Salvador, Paulina has a butcher shop which supplies all her neighbours; it is very busy and she usually sells all the meat she has in stock. She has had this business for 10 years with which she has been able to feed her children and pay for their schooling, but she feels that it will not be sufficient to pay for their higher education and therefore she wants to open a butcher shop in downtown Juliaca, where she could sell to many more people. She enjoys talking with her clients, but it is very difficult to bring the meat all the way to her neighbourhood which is very far from the city, but at the same time her eagerness to prosper does not wane and she is prepared to work very hard to reach her goals. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She has used previous loans to make improvements to her butcher shop and because of this she is certain she will repay her loan and not bring problems to her community bank. She will use this loan of 600 soles to buy more meat and improve her shop in order to give her customer better service.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise and make improvements to her shop

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora K. is 41 years old. She is a married woman with three kids. All her children are in school. She lives with her family at Dorma Ahenkro in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. For the past eight years, Dora has been baking bread in taking care of her household in spite of the challenges she faces. She bakes sugar bread, wheat bread, etc and sells it to her customers. She says she makes sure her food quality meets her customer’s expectations. Her customers book their orders in advance so that before they come it would be ready. She also retails to individuals for their morning breakfast. 

Dora says the price of commodities is increasing, which is making it difficult to buy more raw materials from the market while the daily demand for bread is high. She says she bakes at most 550 loaves of bread in a day. Dora needs the loan to buy more bags of flour, sugar, margarine, milk, and firewood, etc. She said your assistance would be much welcome. Dora belongs to a village bank called ‘Enoch’. She also hope to receive GH¢600 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy baking ingredients and firewood

loans.name: Adria Iris

texts.es:
La señora Adria Iris R. V. tiene 46 años, vive en el caserío de Milán, distrito de Salpo, provincia de Otuzco, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio hasta 2do de primaria debido a que donde vivía solo había hasta ese grado, tiene 08 hijos de los cuales 4 aun dependen de ella económicamente. 
Adria tiene una bodega y se dedica a la venta de menú, empezó vendiendo pan antes de casarse y luego abandono para dedicarse a su hogar, al tiempo empezó a vender bizcochos y gelatinas, con el tiempo fue surtiendo su bodega con abarrotes y con sus ganancias empezó la venta de menú, asimismo en tiempos de cosecha se dedica a la venta de cereales y papa. Su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio. 
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Mujeres Trabajadoras”, lo invirtió en la compra de abarrotes para su bodega. 
Con el crédito de 2500 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en aumentar su capital de su bodega y comprar zapatos para campaña escolar. 
Adria tiene el gran sueño de comprar una casa en Trujillo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adria Iris R. V. is 46 years old and lives in the village of Milán, Salpo district, province of Otuzco, in the region of La Libertad, Peru. She studied until her second year of elementary school owing to the fact that where she lived only offered school to this grade. She has eight children of which four are dependent on her financially.

Adria owns a grocery store and dedicates herself to offering a menu of food. She began by selling bread before she married, and later gave it up to dedicate herself to her home at which time she began to sell sponge cakes and gelatins. With time she supplied her store with groceries and with her earnings she began to offer a menu of food and during harvest times she also sold cereal grains and potatoes. She developed her business in her home.

With her first loan of 300 PEN that she received from her communal bank “Mujeres Trabajadores” (Women Workers) she bought groceries for her store. With this loan of 2500 PEN, which she commits to pay in four months, she will invest in the capital of her grocery store and buy shoes for a school fundraising campaign. She has a big dream of buying a house in Trujillo.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in supplies for her grocery store and the purchase of shoes

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes P. has a sari-sari store beside her house. She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 because she needs additional capital. She plans to use the capital to purchase groceries and improve her business. She has been operating her store for more than four years and she aims for business progress. She dreams of becoming successful someday so that she can continue to send her daughter to school. She is doing her very best to be more productive. All her sacrifices are for her children and family.

Mercedes is 52 years old and married to Juanito and they live peacefully in the village of Rizal Quirino, Isabela. They have six children: Virgie is a 34 year old high school graduate who works as a domestic helper in Lebanon; Auria is 32 years old and a high school undergraduate; Rizaldy is 29 years old and a elementary undergraduate; Rubentor is 26 years old and is also an elementary undergraduate; Rolando is 25 years old and a high school undergraduate; and Roseben is an 18 year old college student. Mercedes is thankful because her children are helping financially to send their youngest daughter to school.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for her store.

loans.name: Taim's Group

texts.en:
There are four people requesting this small loan, all residents of the province of Battambang. The members have selected Mrs. Taim N., 42, to be the group leader. Mrs. N. raises animals in a stall next to her house for sale. She raises livestock like ducks, chickens, and goats. She will sell all her animals to buyers after they are matured. She is married to Yu, 44, who is a local carpenter. The family have eight children; three of them are employed working in different jobs, whilst the others are students. Mrs. N. is applying for a loan as capital to add to her husband's carpentry business. The other three borrowers are:
N. sells grocery items from her home and she requests a loan to buy a boat for her child to begin fishing.
S. raises poultry from her house and seeks a loan to buy tools for her husband's fishing.
F. is a fish seller who is looking for a loan to purchase a fish boat for her husband's business.

loans.use: To add to her husband's carpentry business

loans.name: Maria Salome

texts.es:
La señora Salome pertenece al Banco Comunal “Río Desaguadero”, del distrito de Desaguadero, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno.  Tiene 37 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 2 hijos.  Tiene estudios de secundaria completa.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desde  hace 09 años, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de sogas de nylon, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual invirtió en su negocio.  
Con este préstamo de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles podrá adquirir mayor materia prima (nylon) y elaborar sogas en mayor volumen, los mismos que los comercializará en los diferentes mercados de la región; obteniendo ganancias que los destinará en la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señora Salome is a member of the Banco Comunal “Río Desaguadero", of the district of Desaguadero in the province of Chucuito in the department of Puno. She is 37 years old, married, and has two children. She completed her high school studies. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement since she was 9 years old. She works producing and selling nylon rope. Her first loan was for S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, which she invested in her business. With this new loan for S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles she will be able to purchase more raw materials (nylon) to produce rope in greater volume, similar to the type that is sold in the markets of the region. She will use her earnings to help pay for her children's education.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase strands of nylon

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
P. Halima is a hardworking and responsible woman. Twenty years ago she decided to start her own business to provide for her family. Ever since, she has been selling Tajik national dresses for women. This activity has also permitted her to make time available to be with her children. To increase her sales, Halima requests a loan of $700 to buy merchandise that is on sale, which she will then sell at a special price to her customers. This will allow her to grow her customer base. You can be an important enabler of Halima's accomplishments. She needs your help to grow her business and improve her family's quality of life.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing Tajik national dresses for women in order to increase her range of goods

loans.name: Edwin Romberto

texts.es: El señor Edwin R. Q. M. se dedica a la fabricación de ollas y calderas de aluminio la cual es su actividad principal de el y su familia que esta compuesta por su Mamá y sus tres hermanos, constituyéndose el en cabeza familia,  por esta temporada se dedica ahora a la fabricación de quequeras de cinco piezas (moldes de Tortas) que entrega exclusivamente a un solo cliente.
texts.en:
Edwin R. Q. M. makes aluminum pots and caldrons for a living. This is how he, as head of the house, supports himself, his mother, and his three brothers. He is currently making pans for five tiered cakes (molds for cakes) for one client in particular.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Crédito, dirigido para aumento de capital de trabajo y compra de materia prima.

loans.name: Maneja

texts.en:
Maneja S. is currently in the business of selling televisions, radios, CDs etc at her shop and is requesting a loan to purchase computers and internet facilities to sell.  Maneja is 25 years old and is married. Her husband is a business man. She has 2 children and her children attend school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up an internet cafe.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase computers and internet facilities to sell

loans.name: Imane

texts.en: Imane is a 52-year-old married woman who lives with her husband. In 2005, she decided to help her husband support their family by buying accessories and clothes that she could sell in her home. Now, Imane is applying for a $700 loan to buy more merchandise to sell, which will allow her to increase her income and improve her life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Everly

texts.en:
Everly T. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin. Everly is widowed and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Everly owns and operates a 'sari-sari' (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Everly has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In May 2009, Everly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Everly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. Everly is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Everly from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy, married with six children, lives with her family in a two-room house in Ndamukong, Cameroon. She fries and sells puff puff, Accra beans, and bananas in a Carrefour junction beside her house and is requesting a loan to buy flour, beans, palm oil and groundnut oil for frying. Dorothy plans to expand this business since puff and beans is a fast and inexpensive meal.

This will be Dorothy's sixth loan from GHAPE, of which she has been a member since 2003. She has been quite successful in her business due to her location, reasonable prices, and cooking experience, and her customer base continues to grow. Part of the profits from this loan will be used to take care of her children, buy necessities for the family, including her grandchildren, and the other part will be used to help the needy and orphans in the orphanage within her community.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Buying of koki beans, palm oil, groundnut oil, fruits

loans.name: Meljoy

texts.en: 26-year-old Meljoy C. is a mother of 2 children with her eldest as 7 years old. She has been married for 9 years. She is into Rice Farming. Her rice field is currently growing well but she admits an additional capital would really help in her produce. An abundant harvest is what she aims for. Her income will be helpful especially on her children’s school fees. It is her first time to join CEVI. She applied for a loan of Php6, 000. This loan will be used for farm financing.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Kujen

texts.en: Kujen B. is currently in the business of selling groundnut and simsim and is requesting a loan to purchase pulses and beans to sell.  Kujen is 33 years old and is Married with a husband that is a driver. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase pulses and beans to sell

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie C. is 45 years old. She manages a manicure and pedicure business in her village. She is also a beautician in the village and sometimes she goes to other villages to earn a bigger income for her family needs. Though her business is quite difficult, still she is doing her part as a breadwinner for the family. In her daily routine, she is able to earn PHP 350.

The income she generates from her business is not enough due to a large household size. In this regard, she would like to apply for a loan amounting to PHP 8000. She hopes that she will be granted the loan amount she is requesting.

Tessie has been blessed with three children: Daisy Belshane-20 years old; Yorelle Queen-17 years old; and Nicole-6 years old, who is an elementary pupil. She hopes that she will be able to continue to support her three children.

loans.use: additional capital for business development

loans.name: Luisa Amanda

texts.es: Luisa Amanda  tiene  47 años de edad, su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de taxi, hace mas de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que ella empezó con fondos propios, y así poco a poco fue luchando para tener su propio medio de vida, por lo que se dedicaba a vender comida por las noches en las afueras de su vivienda y así fue realizando sus propios esfuerzos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la reparación de vehículo, pintura con espray que consiste en tapizado, cambio de llantas entre otras cosas. Su deseo es tener otro taxi para mejorar cada día las condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Luisa Amanda is 47-years-old and she works as a taxi driver. She has worked in this business for the past 11 years and she began it with her own money. Bit by bit she has worked hard for her livelihood which is why she also sells food at night outside her home through her own efforts. The requested loan is for working capital that will be used for vehicle repair such as spray painting, fixing the upholstry, and changing the tires, among other things. She desires to have another taxi to improve her daily living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: vehicle repair

loans.name: Sakin

texts.en: Mrs. Sakin E., a 50-year-old single woman from Svay Preak village in Kandal province, is a farmer. She owns a piece of land and cultivates both rice and vegetables. She faces an obstacle with her plantation because her field has infertile soil and she does not have enough money. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides and gasoline to pump water for the rice field.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides and gasoline to pump water

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene L. is from the village of District 1, Cauayan City. She is 29 years old and married with one school-aged child. To make a living, Arlene owns and operates a business offering computer encoding, printing and photocopying services. Her main source of income for the business comes from providing photocopying services in the local community. Arlene has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately $750 gross income a month from these activities.

In 2008, Arlene joined the Kiva field partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Arlene is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services she provides. This will be her 6th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand the services she provides

loans.name: Paterna

texts.en:
Paterna T. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 67 years old. Paterna is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Paterna makes and sells a variety of different foods in the local community. Paterna has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2004, Paterna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Paterna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. She used her previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Paterna is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and use as working capital. This will be Paterna's 10th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy items to sell and to use as working capital

loans.name: Orsoo

texts.en:
Orsoo is 65 years old and lives with his wife and 27-year-old son in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. He lives with his family in a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His son attends university. Orsoo owns and operates his own wooden product business, specializing in ger parts, ger furniture, and other larger furniture pieces. He started his business in 1990. Most of his profits come from the sale of his larger-sized furniture. All of his products are made with great care and attention to detail, which has earned him a reputation among his customers as a quality furniture provider. He would like to increase his sales so that he can afford his family's living expenses.

Orsoo is requesting a 4,000,000 tugrug (approximately 2,800 USD) loan to purchase more wood so that he can increase the number and the variety of large furniture pieces that he can sell in order to pay for his son's tuition fees.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make large furniture pieces.

loans.name: Modi

texts.en:
Modi D. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes, charcoal and beans in the market. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal and beans to sell. Modi is 30 years old and married to a policeman. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a retail shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC, a Kiva partner, has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. 

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal and beans to sell

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La señora Juliana es socia del Banco Comunal “Dios es Amor” desde hace 2 años, vive en el distrito de Juliaca, provincia de San Román y departamento de Puno, tiene 25 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 01 hijo. Ella estudió secundaria completa, se dedica a la compra - venta de lavadores y cocinas.

Juliana nos cuenta que el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, le sirvió para aumentar su capital.

Ella requiere un crédito  de S/. 1,800.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar  lavadores, baldes, cocinas, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es aumentar su negocio y sus ganancias. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es como esta organizado y las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
Juliana has been a part of the “Dios es Amor” (God is Love) communal bank for past two years. She lives in the Juliaca district of San Román, in the Puno department. She is 25 years old, is married and has one son. She completed junior high school and buys and sells washboards and kitchen supplies. Juliana tells us that she used her first loan of 300 PEN, through Movimiento Manuela Ramos, to increase her working capital. She needs this loan of 1,800 PEN ($650) so that she can buy more washboards, buckets, kitchen supplies, etc. Her dream is to grow her business and income. What she likes about her communal bank is its organization and opportunities.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in washboards, buckets, kitchen supplies

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa L. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 25 years old. Teresa is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Teresa owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Teresa has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Teresa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresa is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Teresa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 33-year-old married man with one child who attends school. He has been running a retail shop for nine years in the town of Machakos. He has one employee to help him in the business and has another shop on the outskirts of town.  Peter is grateful to Faulu Kenya for teaching him business management. He dreams of building his family a house to improve their standard of living. He has requested a loan of KES 20,000 to buy various types of cereals. Peter is a jovial and hardworking man.

loans.use: To buy different types of cereals

loans.name: Maria Thelma

texts.es:
La Señora Maria Thelma S. tiene un negocio de venta de cosméticos en el mercado central ubicado del almacén mundo elegante 10 vrs al norte 5 vrs al oeste vende todo lo que es cosméticos, perfumes, colonias, talcos, cremas, shampoo, rinse, etc.
 Este financiamiento la Señora S. lo solicito para abastecer su negocio comprando mercadería de los catálogos de la avón y zermat que tambien vende de esos productos en su tramo.
Su negocio lo empezo hace treinta años con apoyo de su esposo que fue el que le brindo la ayuda del capital para empezar su negocio, anteriormente vendía cosméticos ambulante y ama de casa a la vez pero se aburrió de andar buscando clientelas decidio tener un tramo en el mercado es una mujer dedicada a su negocio, y a sus nietas tuvo 4 hijos pero ninguno dependen de ella mas que solos dos nieta que estan a su cargo y es por las que se esfuerza día a día para salir adelante junto con ellas, lleva cinco años de trabajar con nuestra institución y se siente muy apoyada por nosotros ya que su negocio ha incrementado gracia a estos financiamientos obtenidos con nosotros.
texts.en:
María Thelma S. sells Cosmetics in the central market which is located 10 varas (an obsolete unit of length = 0.8359 m in SI units) north and 5 varas west of the Mundo Elegante store; she sells all sorts of cosmetics: perfumes, colognes, talc, creams, shampoos, rinses, etc. She will use the funds to stock her business with items from the Avon and Zermat catalogues because she also sells these brands of cosmetics in her stand. She started her business 30 years ago with support from her husband who provided her with her start-up capital. She used to sell door-to-door to housewives but she became bored with the process of looking for customers so she decided to have her own stall in the market. She is very dedicated to her business and to her granddaughters. She had four children but none of them depend on her any longer; however, she does support and care for two granddaughters and it is for them that she works every day to get ahead with them. She has collaborated with our institution for five years and she feels much supported by us since her business has grown thanks to financing obtained from us.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Wisma Cempaka 1 Group

texts.en: Dewa Mas Ayu M. S. (0) is a 35-year-old female living in the town of Melaya, Bali. She is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by MUK. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Wisma Cempaka 1 (MUK-0018). Dewa Mas is married and has four school-aged children. She owns and operates a general store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over a year and earns approximately 1,000,000 IDR a month. In 2010, Dewa Mas joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 2,500,000 IDR which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. The loan will be her first from MUK. Dewa Mas plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees. About MUK: The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives. Note to Kiva Lenders: This group uses a community lending model (commonly referred to as Village Banking) that is very common throughout Asia. In this model, a select number of group representatives will take out a large loan on behalf of their entire group (often an entire village).
