They will then distribute and manage the loan and collect repayments for the lender. This is a common and efficient practice in the region, but it makes reporting on Kiva somewhat unusual. Unlike most other loans, Kiva’s partner, MUK, will be in contact primarily with the group leadership team who in turn will be overseeing the end borrowers. As such, journal updates likely will reflect the performance of the lending group rather than the individual end borrowers. To learn more about Village Banking on Wikipedia, please click here. ***************************************************** Dewa Mas Ayu M. S. (0) merupakan 35 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali. Dewa Mas adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 4 anggota. Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Wisma Cempaka 1 (MUK-0018). Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari menjual produk untuk dipakai sehari-hari seperti shampo, sabun, & pasta gigi di tengah masyarakat setempat. Dewa Mas sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 1 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Dewa Mas menghasilkan sekitar 1,000,000 IDR. Dalam 2010, Dewa Mas bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Dewa Mas meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari MUK. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 2,500,000 IDR. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK. Tentang MUK: Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari. Pesan untuk Peminjam Kiva: Grup ini memakai model pinjaman komunitas/""community lending"" (biasanya dijuluk Bank Desa/""Village Banking"") yang populer di Asia. Di model ini, sejumlah representatif dari grup akan meminjam uang sejumlah lebih besar untuk seluruh grup (kadang-kadang seluruh desa). Representatif ini akan distribusi dan mengendalikan pinjaman, dan mengkoleksi pembayaran untuk peminjam akhir. Ini adalah praktek umum dan efisien di daerah ini, tapi merumitkan cara lapor untuk Kiva. Tidak serupa pinjaman lain, partner Kiva, MUK, akan menjadi kontak utama dengan tim kepemimpinan grup, yang sebaliknya menjadi kontak dengan peminjam akhir. Demikian, jurnal yang ditulis akan merefleksikan hasilnya tim kepemimpinan, bukannya peminjam-peminjam akhir. Untuk belajari lebih banyak tentang Village Banking di Wikipedia, mohon kunjungi website ini: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Village_Banking.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Esther Luzmila

texts.es: Cliente recurrente que viene cancelando en forma puntual su credito, solicita una ampliacion del mismo para gastos persoanles, cliente que no cuenta con deuda alguna, esta firmando con su madre quien tambien fue clienta  de la CRAC, se propone el credito por contar con buen comportamiento crediticio.
texts.en:
This is a previous client who repaid her loan punctually. She is applying for another similar loan for personal expenses. The client does not have other debt. She is signing with her mother who has also been a client of CRAL. She is eligible for the loan because she has a good credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal expenses.

loans.name: Biakoye Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Akua K. is a 52-year-old woman who describes herself as trustworthy.  She is married with 3 adult children.  For the past 4 years, Akua has operated a retail business where she sells items such as toffee and 'gari'.  Gari is a fried cassava dish.  She will use the loan to buy bags of 'gari', sugar and toffee.  Akua would like to eventually open a large supermarket.

Akua is currently the leader of the trust bank group named "Biakoye", which means “Unity” in Twi, the language most commonly spoken in Ghana.  There are 13 members in the group.  The members also operate retail businesses selling items such as fish, yams, and rice. They hope to receive the loan to enable them to buy various stock to grow their businesses and provide more support for their family.

loans.use: To purchase 'gari', sugar and toffees in bulk for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Group 3

texts.en:
Jalou C. is from the village of Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is 20 years old and the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Jalou is married and has one infant child. To make a living, she sells fresh fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $25 a month from this activity.

In 2008, Jalou joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Jalou is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the daily needs of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Chhoem

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhoem S., age 48, makes a living by selling fish. She sells the fish that her husband gives her or that she buys from other fisherman. She currently earns an average of US$5 a day, and she has been running her business for several years. Her husband is 46 years old and is a fisherman who works along a local river.

Chhoem S. is the mother of six teenage children who are no longer in school. Two are married and live separately; the others are unmarried and they each contribute some of their incomes to help the family meet its daily expenses.

Because she doesn’t have her own vehicle to transport the fish to sell at the market, Chhoem S. is applying for a loan to buy a secondhand motorcycle and to buy more tools for fishing.

loans.use: To buy a secondhand motorcycle to transport her fish and to buy more fishing equipment for her husband

loans.name: Kaija Abagambakamu, Mubende Group

texts.en:
As they say that determination leads to destiny, Benezel N. is gaining momentum in his charcoal-selling business at Kyegegwa in Mubende. Many people tend to undermine casual work here in Uganda, but the 48-year-old married father of nine children has been able to earn a living through that business for five years. 

Charcoal is commonly used here in Uganda as a form of energy in many homes to cook food and for housewarming in cold places, as prices for paraffin, gas and electricity are always high. Through the selling of charcoal, he is able to earn 70,000 Ugandan shillings as monthly profits, although it still has its drawbacks, like transporting his products to bigger markets like Kampala city. With this loan, he hopes to expand into bigger markets and supply to larger charcoal markets, as the loan will help pay for his transportation. This will help in improving his sales revenue to cater to his big family’s needs.

loans.use: Help with the transportation of charcoal to bigger markets

loans.name: Bokk Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BOKK JOM est né le 20 décembre 2010. Il est composé de 06 femmes issues du même village. Les membres ont décidé de se regrouper au sein du même groupe parce qu’elles habitent le même quartier et ont des affinités. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageoise de KOUNOUNE AIR FRANCE

Madame Rosalie T., à l’extrême droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 49 ans. Elle divorcée et vit avec son unique enfant. 

Elle fait de l’aviculture. Elle tient un poulailler où elle élève des poulets de chaire.

Avec son crédit de 165.000 franc CFA elle va développer un élevage de 70 sujets. Sur ce elle va acheter des poussins, de l’aliment de volaille et des produits vétos.

Son objectif est d’assurer le payement des factures d’électricité et d’eau et d’envoyer de la nourriture à ses parents qui sont à son village d’origine.
texts.en:
The Bokk Jom solidarity group was created on the 20th December 2010. It is made up of 6 women from the same village who decided to come together through friendship and family ties. They are a part of the Kounoune Air France credit association. Madame Rosalie T., at the far right of the photo, is the group leader. She is 49 years old, divorced and lives with her only child. She is involved in poultry farming and owns a henhouse where she breeds chickens for meat. With a 165,000 CFA loan she is going to set up a henhouse for 70, buy chicks, chickenfeed and related products. Her aim is to pay the electricity and water bills and to send food to her parents who live in her home village.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 70 chicks and chickenfeed

loans.name: Martha Eugenia

texts.es: La señora Martha Eugenia se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y perfumes para hombres y mujeres, tiene más de dos años de dedicarse a esta actividad. Por lo que siempre está pensando en la forma de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Ella se levanta muy temprano pues tiene que salir a ofrecer sus productos a diferentes lugares. Es madre soltera, tiene una hija de dos años, con sus ganancias mantiene el hogar  y a su mamá que le cuida a su hija, para poder dedicarse al negocio. Con el financiamiento invertirá en la compra de cosméticos y perfumes, para ofrecer a sus clientes y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Señora Martha Eugenia earns her living by selling men and women’s cosmetics and colognes. She’s been doing this work for more than two years and is constantly thinking about ways to improve her family’s standard of living. Martha gets up very early because she has to leave the house to sell the products at a variety of locations. She is a single mother of a two-year old daughter. The money she earns is used to maintain the household and pay her mother who looks after her daughter so she can go to work. With the loan Martha will buy cosmetics and colognes to sell to her customers and earn more money.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité “KUÑA ATY” está dentro del octavo
 Ciclo del Programa en la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso.

 Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas, preparación de comidas rápidas y otros.
 Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.
 La Señora Lourdes es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica  a la Venta de productos de primera necesidad. 
En fin realiza varias actividades, como también la venta tortas, minutas es una señora muy creativa en su actividad. 
Ella tiene una familia muy unida con 3 (tres) hijos y su marido quien trabaja como constructor de obra. 

La señora Lourdes solicita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías para el negocio y un freezer.
texts.en:
The group named Kuna Aty is on their eighth loan cycle. They are located in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. All of the members of the group are very close and they are capable of working together, a unity that reinforces their team. Lourdes is one of the members of the group. she sells basic needs products. But she carries out different activities; she also sells hamburgers and snacks. She is a very creative person in her business. She has a very close knit family made up of her 3 children and her husband. Her husband works as a construction worker. Lourdes requests a loan to purchase merchandise for her business and a freezer.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de mercaderias fideos, azucar, arroz, harina, y freezers

loans.name: Stephen Manyenze

texts.en:
Stephen Manyenze M. is thirty years old, single, and does not have any children yet. His business is located at Bar-Sheba, Bamburi estate, in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many many tourist attraction sites, not forgetting the Indian Ocean's white beaches. He owns a general store in which he sells such items as milk, detergent, sugar, flour and others. He has been in this business for two years now. 

He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is that there are so many other people in the area doing the same kind of business as his, therefore customers are not loyal as they are spoilt of choice. However, he works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep his business doing well. 

He is using his loan of Kes 40,000 to buy more general items to expand his business and meet the demand of his customers. He hopes to be a wholesaler in future. He also hopes to really grow his business so that when he gets married, he will be able to support his family. He describes himself as polite.

loans.use: Maize flour, milk, detergent, cooking oil, etc

loans.name: Celia Marianela

texts.es:
En la localidad el Cadi de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora y dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal Nueva Ilusión.

La señora Celia es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y está muy contenta, le ha gustado los créditos y la forma de trabajar de la institución.  Tiene 29 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y tiene dos hijos, uno de apenas 35 días de nacido y otro que está  en la escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Ella tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres de consumo en la cual a pesar de que es pequeña tiene de todo, sus clientes son muy exigentes y siempre trata de  satisfacerles, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h30 hasta las 18h00 dice que está a gusto con su tienda ya que le deja algunas ganancias y no tiene que salir de su casa, con esto nada le impide poder darles un buen tiempo a sus hijos.
 
Este crédito es para comprar más mercadería la misma que adquiere en Portoviejo junto con su marido que le ayuda.

Su sueño es tener una tienda mucho más grande.
texts.en:
The members of “Nueva Ilusión” (New Illusion) communal bank meet every two weeks in Cadi, Colon parish in the city of Portoviejo, a place renowned for its hardworking people dedicated to farming and cattle raising.

Celia, 29, is a founding member of the communal bank.  She is very happy.  She likes the loans and the way the institution operates.  She is in a common law relationship and has two children, one is only 35 days old and the other one is in school.  Her husband’s a farmer.

She has a small grocery store that, despite being small, is stocked with everything.  Her customers are very demanding and she always strives to meet their needs.  She is open for business every day from 6:30am until 6pm.  She says she is content with the store because it produces some profits and she doesn’t have to leave home.   This way nothing keeps her from spending good time with her children.

This loan is to buy more merchandise that she gets in Portoviejo with her husband who helps her.

Her dream is to have a much larger store.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, eggs, cheese and foodstuffs in general.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely D. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 44 years old. Fely is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, she makes and sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $50 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Fely joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. 

Fely is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 3rd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz M. is from the village of Casul, Sapang Dalaga. She is 55 years old, married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Luz owns & operates a business venture in the food sector in fishing. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling of ocean-caught fish in the local community. Luz has been engaged in her business for over 22 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Luz joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luz has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Luz is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing materials. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Luz from PMPC. 
About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing materials.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma L. is a widow who lives in Sitio Atabay, Brgy. San Isidro, Calatrava, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: general store and livestock.

Guillerma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1993 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Guillerma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,800, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 18th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000, which she intends to use to buy stocks for the general store and piglets to raise so that she can continue to save up for the future improvement of business. 

Guillerma L. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of goods to sell.

loans.name: Pedrita

texts.en:
Pedrita L. is from the town of Makawa, Aloran. She is 56 years old. Pedrita is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Pedrita owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafoods such as fish and shrimp in the local community. Pedrita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Pedrita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pedrita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Pedrita is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Pedrita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Phum

texts.en:
Phum M. is 45 years old and generates a daily income of $1.50 per day by selling fish.  She is married to Seang Yan who is 33 years old and he works as a construction worker as well as a fisherman in and around the Phnom Penh City of Cambodia.  He earns approximately $2.50 each day to support the family's expenses. 

They have four children who go to the local public school.  This approaching fishing season, the lakes are full of fish but her husband is lacking tools to fish with. Therefore, Phum M. is applying for a loan for her husband to purchase additional fishing equipment in order to support his business activities.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing equipment.

loans.name: Asaad

texts.ar:
اسعد  في عمر 32 سنة يعمل في تأجير الدراجات الهوائية له في عمله 10 سنوات يحب عمله ويسعى دائما الى
تطوير نفسه وعمله وتكوين مستقبل جيد له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة حيث كان له تأثير جيد على مستوى المعيشي
له وتجديد مصلحته يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة شراء دراجات هوائية قديمة وتصليحها حتى يستطيع بيعها
من جديد له طموح كبير بأن يصبح صاحب محل خاص له حيث يريد ان يزيد من مدخوله
texts.en: Asaad is 32 years old. He has been working in the bike rental business for 10 years. Asaad likes his work and wishes to secure himself a bright future. He always works on developing himself as well as his business. Asaad has a good credit history with Al Majmoua. His previous loan helped him improve his living standard and grow his business. He wants a loan from Al Majmoua to buy, repair and resell old bikes. He wishes to fulfill his strong ambition: owning a shop so that he can increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase, repair, and resell old bikes

loans.name: Lolita Benavente's Group

texts.en:
Lolita lives in the village of Cogon, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old, married, has three school-aged children and leads a five-person loan group affiliated with PMPC. While each member of Lolita B.’s group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
 
To make a living, Lolita owns and operates a hog-raising business. She has been in this line of work for more than two years and earns about 1,500 a month. In 2009, Lolita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC and plans to use her 4,000 PHP portion of this new group loan to buy more piglets to raise and later sell. She plans to use the additional revenue she earns from this loan to continue expanding her business.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and later sell

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita B. is 45 years old, married and has three school-aged children. She is from the village of Eastern Poblacion in the municipality of Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental province in the Mindanao islands. Lucita runs a general store from which she sells a variety of different products to the local community. Lucita has been in business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Lucita joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to buy additional inventory and for extra working capital. Lucita is requesting a new loan, her eighth from PMPC, of 15,000 PHP that will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy new items to expand her store's product offerings

loans.name: Prosperidad Y Esperanza 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.es:
Rosa es la coordinadora del grupo Prosperidad y Esperanza 1, 2 & 3, localizado en la ciudad D. Santiago, la segunda ciudad más granD. D. Republica Dominicana, donD. el comercio, grandes industrias y el sector D. ganadería y agricultura, son las principales fuentes D. trabajo. Se dedican mayormente a la venta D. Salon D. belleza, Joyas, Ropa, Calzados, Accesorios, cosméticos, alimentos, entre otros productos misceláneos.

Rosa es madre soltera D. 3 hijos, L. cuales conforman su familia. Como madre soltera ha trabajado siempre para sacar a sus hijos adelante, esforzandose para darles una buena educacion y guiarL., desea poder establecer su negocio, que este pueda ser sostenible y pueda ahorra para poder construir su casa. Sus dificultades van D. la mano con la crisis economica, ya que le afecta bastante, cuando en su ciudad hay menos flujo D. dinero. Sus planes a corto plazo son poder construir la cocina D. su casa, e ir poco a poco mejorando su vivienda. 

Rosa posee un salon D. belleza, el cual tambien combina con las ventas D. productos miscelaneos, como cosmeticos, accesorios, productos D. belleza y medicamentos. Inicio su pequeño salon, gracias a las ganancias obtenidas en la venta ambulante D. ropa interior, hace ya alrededor D. 5 años. En esta ocasion invertira su prestamo en la compra D. medicamentos primarios y otros productos cosmeticos.
texts.en:
Rosa is the coordinator for the group “Prosperidad y Esperanza 1, 2 & 3” (Prosperity and Hope 1, 2 & 3). This group can be found in the city of Santiago, the second largest city in the Dominican Republic. The main sources of jobs are traD., large industries, and the livestock and agriculture sectors. These members engage in business such as providing beauty services, selling jewelry, clothes, shoes, accessories, cosmetics, food, and other miscellaneous products.

Rosa is a single mother and her family consists of her three children. As a single mother, Rosa always works so that her children can get ahead. She strives to proviD. them a good education and guidance. Rosa wants to establish her business so that it can be sustainable and help her save toward the construction of her house. Her difficulties go hand in hand with the economic crisis that has had a great impact on her, especially when there is less cash flowing into the city. Her short-term plans incluD. building a kitchen in her house and gradually making improvements to her home.

Rosa manages a beauty salon along with selling miscellaneous products such as cosmetics, accessories, beauty products, and medicines. She started her small salon approximately five years ago with the money she earned selling undergarments as a street vendor. On this occasion, she will invest her loan in the purchase of basic medicines and cosmetic products.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics & medicines to sell

loans.name: Flor De Margarita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MOSOQ ALLPA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Flor; La socia tiene 35 años de edad, la socia  es divorciada,  tiene 2 hijos, el menor de 4 meses, la socia trabaja  en artesanía ella en el mes de abril tiene programado vender sus artesanías, para lo cual invertirá en la compra de artesanía y en la compra de materiales para elaborar diferentes tipos de trabajos en arcilla, la socia trabaja desde su casa elaborando diferentes trabajos en arcillas y decorando con óxidos naturales, la socia también confecciona trajes típicos, y es secretaria  medio tiempo en una institución privada, la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para elaborar la artesanía. 

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Flor is a member of the Communal Bank “Mosoq Allpa” which is located in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 35 years old, divorced, and has two children, the youngest being four months old. Flor works as an artisan. In April she plans to sell her creations, but she needs to invest in the purchase of materials for making different types of clay pieces. Flor works from home, making different clay pieces that she decorates with natural oxides. She also makes traditional costumes and works part-time as a secretary for a private institution. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of materials used in making her crafts.

Flor is happy with the loan that was provided and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase materials used for making crafts

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en: Uranchimeg, 41, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. They live in a house on a small plot of land that they own. Her husband drives a taxi and earns 200,000 MNT monthly. Her younger son attends a local secondary school. They used to live in the countryside until their son grew to school age. They came to live in the city in 2000 and she began operating a retail business of food and groceries. In the beginning, she used to rent a stall at a food market and then she started operating a clothes sales business in 2004. She wants to expand her current business and increase her working capital. She is a hardworking and modest person who says, " I want to expand my business more and try to save money for my children's future studies". She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase more clothes from China for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon K. K. is 42 years old, married, and has six children.  He has been farming for seven years.  He does both dairy and tea farming to earn a living.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money and manage his business.  He hopes to expand his business so as to earn more income in the future.  He is requesting a loan for 25,000 KES, which he will use to buy a cow.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan tiene  45 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Batangrande , una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en el distrito de Ferreñafe  en la provincia de Lambayeque, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de treinta minutos  de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica al alquiler de motobombas de riego. El negocio tiene mucha acogida en la zona ya que ella es una de las pocas personas que brinda este servicio y además es bastante rentable, esta actividad la realiza hace 5 años. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para el sostenimiento de los gastos económicos de su familia.

El desea adquirir reparar su maquinaria para brindar mejor servicio, y ampliar su negocio, por ello a creído conveniente  solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Juan, 45, is married and lives with his family in Batangrande district, an agricultural area located in Ferreñafe province, more than 30 minutes from Chiclayo, the capital city of the Lambayeque region.

He makes a living renting motorized irrigation pumps. The business has been well-received in the area since he is one of the few people to offer this service. He has done this for 5 years, and it is quite profitable. The income he earns from this he uses to cover his family's household expenses. He wants to repair his machinery so he can offer better service and expand his business. Therefore, he thought it best to request a loan of 1000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa, with which he hopes to meet this goal.

loans.use: to repair his machinery

loans.name: Ma. Lorena

texts.en:
Ma. Lorena P. is engaged in fishing. Her husband is a fisherman and the one who manages their fishing boat. Ma. Lorena sells his catch to the market. Lorena said they have been in this business for 14 years. She is asking for a loan to repair their pumpboat and purchase fishing nets and hooks. 

Ma. Lorena works hard to support her family. She has five children, two girls and three boys. Her oldest child is 13.

Ma. Lorena hopes to earn better. She hopes to buy another fishing boat to expand their business.

loans.use: to repair the pumpboat and purchase fishing nets and hooks.

loans.name: Peter Wanyoike

texts.en: Peter is 32 years old, married to Ann Muringe and the father of one child. For the last seven years, he has made a living as a farmer in the town of Naivasha. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and is applying for his first loan, which he plans to use to buy seeds and fertilizer. His goal is to become one of the leading farmers in his part of Kenya.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is a married woman with 7 children. Her oldest child is 27 years old.

Rosie is a farmer working in Banga, Agusan del sur. She has been growing corn and vegetables for 5 years. She earns 4,000 PHP per month doing this farming. 

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides. In the future, she hopes to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds, and pesticides.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua sells smoked fish and provisions in Elmina. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a farmer. Efua has been selling fish for 10 years. She is responsible for assisting her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke and sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save toward her child's university education.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to smoke and sell.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly is a married woman with six children, all of whom go to school. She does not care for additional family members. She operates a beauty salon in Kikoni, a Kampala suburb, and works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last 8 years. 

Milly has requested a loan of 300,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more weaves, oils and braids. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She resides in a rented house and has access to electricity but not piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and feeding the family .

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids and weaves

loans.name: Benkadi  2 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe  BENKADI 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35ans, 3enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à  KENA, un des villages de la commune de NANTIEN dans la préfecture de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : le riz, de l’arachide et du pois sucré avec MARIAM 1ère à gauche position debout de la photo.
 Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour, acheter des intrants et les semences pour entretenir : 0.5 hectare. 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du village et au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 35.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Benkadi 2 group are married women, on average 35 years old with 3 children, and live mostly in polygamous households in Kena, one of the towns in the district of Nantien in the Sikasso Prefecture, the 3rd administrative region of Mali.
They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to properly manage their agricultural activities during the rainy season.
They are on their sixth loan with the institution, and all the previous loans were repaid properly.
Mariam, standing all the way on the left in the photo, grows rice, peanuts, and tiger peas. 
With this loan, she intends to pay for labour costs and buy agricultural inputs and seeds to maintain 0.5 hectares of land.
The produce is sold throughout the town and at the Sikasso market after the harvest to a clientele composed of men and women.
She intends to realize an average profit of 35,000 FCFA for the season.
This profit will allow her to repay her loan and also help her husband provide for the family.

loans.use: To pay for labour and to buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: La Ponderosa (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal La Ponderosa está formado por 8 mujeres y 3 hombres quienes son amigos y conocidos, laboran diariamente en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten ayudar a la economía de sus hogares y sacar adelante a sus familias. Nuestros socios viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que en 1999 fue nombrada como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, tiene una gran belleza cultural, natural y arquitectónica, su gente es muy amable y siempre mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Señora. María Margarita, vive por el sector de Monay, tiene 42 años, es viuda y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 21 y 17 años de edad quienes son  casados e independientes. Nuestra socia no tiene casa propia y vive arrendando.
 
Doña María Margarita se dedica a la crianza de ganado, esta actividad  la realiza hace mucho tiempo, con la leche que obtiene de su ganado realiza quesillo y lo vende en la ciudad de Cuenca.

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de un ternero.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The “La Ponderosa” communal bank is made up of eight women and three men, all good friends who know each other well.  They each work daily in their own different businesses which allow each of them to help their families financially.  Our members live in Cuenca, a city that was named to be one of the fathers of human culture in 1999.  It has a beautiful architecture, natural surroundings, and culture.  Its people are very friendly and maintain their culture and traditions.

María Margarita is one of the group’s members.  She is 42 years old, a widow, and lives in the Monay sector.  She has two children, ages 17 and 21, both of who are married and on their own.  She lives in a rented home.

María Margarita raises livestock and has been doing this for a long time.  She uses the milk to make cottage cheese which she sells in Cuenca.

This will be her second loan through the communal bank and she will invest the money in a plot of land.  Someday she would like to have a home of her own.

loans.use: to buy a cooler.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: La señora Victoria es empleada domestica; trabaja en la casa una familia en la zona central de la ciudad de La Paz y también tiene un taxi, el cual lo hace trabajar para transporte de pasajeros. El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento de la movilidad, pues requiere comprar llantas  y cambios de aceites y lubricantes.  Vive en alquiler en una casa la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Llojeta Bajo  en la ciudad de La Paz; es soltera y no tiene hijos. Esta es tercera vez que solicita un crédito a través de IMPRO y la primera a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Victoria is a domestic employee.  She works in the house of a family in the central part of the city of La Paz.  She also owns a taxi that she has working providing passenger transportation.  She needs the loan to service the vehicle because she needs to buy tires, change the oil and lubricate it.  

She lives in a rented house located in the city of La Paz’s Llojeta Bajo zone.  She is single and has no children.  This is her third loan request from IMPRO and her first through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy tires and to service her taxi.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 34 years old, married and has three children. Loreta owns & operates a business venture selling rice products in the local community.  She has one year of experience in this business.  Loreta needs a loan of WST 1000 to purchase sacks of rice.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve her business.

Loreta joined SPBD in 2011 in order to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Loreta's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice

loans.name: Librada

texts.en:
Librada is from the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is the mother of two adult-aged children. They stand as the living witnesses of the hard work and sacrifices their parents have endured just to provide what they need and want. Librada started running a retail store with a small capital many years ago. This helps to sustain daily needs and enhance her entrepreneurial ability allowing her to earn PHP 3,500 (Philippine pesos) a month. In 2006, Librada joined GDMPC to ease the difficulty of financing for business subsistence and expansion. 

The cooperative allowed her a loan of PHP 10,000 to obtain grocery products to sell. She will be able to make a favorable profit to uplift the family's living  status.

loans.use: To obtain grocery products to sell.

loans.name: Angela Vctoria

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 24 De Diciembre se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Angela, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 14, 12, 11 y 9 años de edad, los  dos mayores estudian en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en un barco pesquero.

Es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y en su casa tiene unas vitrinas en las cuales ofrece sus productos, nos cuenta que  también trabaja bajo pedidos que le realizan sus clientes con anticipación. Trabaja todos los fines de semana, ella deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada semana. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene dos  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal dos años  y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy responsables.
 
Su sueño es tener un barco propio.
texts.en:
The “24 de Diciembre” communal bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi Canton known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are known both nationally and internationally; it’s the place where the famous straw hats come from.

We met Ángela, 34, here.  She’s married and has four children who are 14, 12, 11 and 9 years old.  The two older ones go to secondary school and the two younger ones are in elementary school.  Her husband works on a fishing boat.

She’s a housewife who in order to earn her own income works selling clothes of all types door to door; she also has some display cases at home where she also sells her wares.  She tells us that she also works based on prior orders placed by her customers ahead of time.  She works every weekend selling on credit and collecting weekly payments.  She goes to Guayaquil to buy her merchandise every time she needs to.  She has been in this business two years and does very well.


This loan will be used to buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, t-shirts and children’s clothes.  She’s been in the communal bank two years and likes it because her fellow members are very responsible.  Her dream is to have a boat of her own.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothes.

loans.name: Meyminatou

texts.fr: Madame Meyminatou  vit au Sénégal. Elle est âgée de 45 ans. Elle évolue depuis 5 ans dans  le commerce  et la vente de petit déjeuner, wax et thioups. Elle pratique aussi la couture et le tricotage qu’elle a appris en intégrant un centre de formation en couture et en tricotage.  Ce qui l’intéresse surtout dans son activité c’est l’esprit de création, la beauté et les retombées financières qui en découlent. Elle est membre de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis  avril 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat  d’habits et de portables à revendre. Son vœu est de voyager pour la Mauritanie  pour se les procurer. Elle souhaite encore diversifier les produits qu’elle commercialise  pour mieux développer son activité de commerce.
texts.en: Mrs Meyminatou is 45 years old and lives in Senegal. For the past five years she has been selling breakfasts as well as wax and thioup fabrics. In addition, she sews and knits. She learnt these skills in a training center for sewing and knitting. She particularly likes the creativity, the beauty and the financial spin-offs of her activity. She has been a member of one of the branches of the microfinance institution U-IMCEC since April 2011. She applies for a loan of 200,000 CFA francs to buy clothes and mobile phones for resale. She wants to travel to Mauritania to get them. She intends to further diversify her inventory in order to better develop her business activity.

loans.use: to buy clothes and mobile phones for resale.

loans.name: Giulumnaz

texts.en:
Giulumnaz is 40 years old. She is from the village of Karajalari, Gardabani District. Giulumnaz lives with her 70-year-old mother. 

Giulumnaz and her mother earn a living through the family agricultural business. In particular, they have 1000 sq meters of land where greens are grown. Giulumanz sells harvested greens in Tbilisi (the capital city). She also sells various vegetables which are purchased from neighborhood farms. The family also has a small livestock farm. Giulumnaz purchases calves in the fall, raises them and sells them in spring for a higher price. 

Giulumnaz requested credit to purchase calves. She will sell grown calves in spring for a higher price and get additional income. It will impact positively on family living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Yliane

texts.es:
Yliane de 44 años de edad, es soltera, vive en su casa propia con su madre y hermana, no cuenta con los servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Nueva Arica que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadería.

Yliane desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado caprino (cabras), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, los cuales son apropiados y amplios, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios personales y de su casa.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar animales de otras especies y su alimento respectivo, con los ingresos que adquiera por la venta puede cubrir su crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Yliane es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es poderle brindar comodidades a su madre con su hermana y que tenga mejoras económicas.
texts.en:
Yliane is 44 years old and she is single. She lives in a house of her own together with her mother and sister. It is not equipped with the basic services. It is located in the rural region of the district of Nueva Arica, belonging to the province of Chiclayo. The region is known for its agricultural and farming activities.

Yliane has been raising and selling goats for a few years. Her corrals are located in the rear part of her property. They are appropriate and ample and she feeds her livestock balanced feed and natural grasses. She raises them until they reach an optimum growth and she sells them at the different markets in the region. She obtains very good profits and she is able to cover her daily expenses and the household expenses.

She requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1500 nuevos soles to purchase other types of livestock and their feed. With the income that she will earn, she will be able to repay the loan and improve the quality of her life. Yliane is a hardworking person and very responsible. The only thing that she wants is to provide her mother and sister with certain comforts and to improve her finances.

loans.use: to purchase other types of livestock and their feed.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 31 years old and married with 3 children. Vivian works very hard to provide for them. Vivian runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her store. Vivian has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and school supplies. 

Vivian would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 42 years old and lives in the town of Masindi in Uganda. He is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past four years, William has been working hard to manage his small shop, which sells spare motor parts. 

To help expand his business, William has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more motor oil and tires, and it will help William to generate greater profits and complete the construction of his house. William hopes that in the future he will be able to buy a new, popular kind of motorcycle. 

William is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like William who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more motor oil and tires.

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina is a 44-year-old married woman with 4 children who is separated from her husband.  She's from Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur.  Magdalina operates a gardening business to earn her living. She's been in this work for 13 years and she earns 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Magdalina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This will be the third loan taken out by Magdalina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia sigue participando en el banco comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras” de la Unidad de Micro finanzas de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. La socia sigue dedicándose a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche y entre otros productos. 

La socia con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho. 

La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar productos como arroz, azúcar, leche y fideos al por mayor.
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The member continues to participate in the communal bank “Mujeres Emprendedoras” in the Unidad de Micro Finanzas of the Asociación Arariwa of the city of Cusco. The member continues selling staple products such as rice, sugar, milk, oil among other products.

The member did very well with the previous loan and was able to obtain benefits and for this reason wants another loan as it helps her a lot. 

The member wants the loan to buy products such as rice, sugar, milk and noodles wholesale.

The member is grateful for the opportunity afforded her by this means and thus agrees to make her repayments on a timely basis.

loans.use: to buy items such as rice, sugar, milk and noodles wholesale.

loans.name: Delaide

texts.en:
Delaide is a 49-year-old mixed-crop farmer. His wife, Virginia, is also a farmer. They are blessed with two children. Delaide has been rearing pigs for the past 4 years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Delaide will use the loan to buy more pigs and pig feed. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. 

In the future, he hopes to export pig products, thus earning more profits that will help him improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and pig feed.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 42 years old. She is married to Jovito, a farmer in the village of Carabatan Grande. They are thankful because they have been blessed with five children.

To make a living, Gemma is engaged in a hog-raising business, primarily hogs for breeding. The net profit she generates from her business is just enough to cover the cost of the family's daily meals. Therefore she is thankful for having other sources of income aside from the hog-raising business; she also buys and sells vegetable in the village.

To improve her business, Gemma is requesting a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy feed and additional pigs to raise and to buy different kinds of vegetables to sell. Gemma says that the loan she receives will be very helpful in the success of her businesses.

loans.use: To buy feed and additional pigs to raise, and to buy different kinds of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is 31 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business selling fish in Yei, South Sudan for five years. Charity is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Maria Kpewu Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MARIA KPEWU est composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Prisque est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Prisque est âgée de 42 ans et vit au Bénin. Prisque a appris la coiffure. Prisque est mariée à un certain Marc. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Prisque vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins de la maison. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Prisque exerce depuis neuf ans la coiffure dans son quartier, activité qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables. De façon secondaire ; Prisque vend des cartes de recharges téléphoniques, des mèches et des produits cosmétiques. Prisque s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Prisque sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MARIA KPEWU, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The "Maria Kpewu" group comprises four people who live in the same area. This is the third time this group is seeking financial support from ALIDÉ, in order to raise the level of its business. The group representative, named Prisque, is the woman whose hand is raised in the photo. Prisque is 42 years old and lives in Benin. Prisque trained to be a hairstylist. She is married to a man named Marc. The couple have four children, all of whom are in their care and attend school. Prisque lives together with her husband and children. The couple provide for the household together. In order to pay for various family expenses, Prisque has run a hairstyling operation in her area for nine years, an activity that provides her with significant income. On the side, she also sells rechargeable phone cards, hair extensions, and cosmetics. Prisque gets her supplies at a market in Benin. With the goal of satisfying her customers and increasing her sales volume and income, she is seeking a third loan with ALIDÉ along with the other members of the Maria Kpewu group. The two previous loans were repaid properly.

loans.use: To buy rechargeable phone cards, hair extensions, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en: Hai is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products such as food and vegetables to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred is a 38-year-old married man with four children living in Masindi, Uganda. Six years ago he decided to venture into a general merchandise trade. The business has so far helped him in providing basics to his family. Like all good fathers, he wishes to educate his children up to the university level and set up sustainable income-generating activities. His hardship is price fluctuation. His desire is to own a wholesale shop. Fred intends to use this loan to buy general merchandise such as salt and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as salt and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Ramona Margarita

texts.es:
La Señora Ramona vive en Quevedo (Ecuador), ella tiene 58 años de edad. Ella emprendió esta actividad de hacer jugos con hielo granizado, gracias a una idea de un amigo de ella, y así pudo criar a su hijo de 5 años. 
Ella vende sus jugos de hielo granizados sola, y lo realiza de 10:00 de la mañana hasta las 17:00 de la tarde. 

La dificultad que a ella se le presenta en su trabajo es por parte de los ladrones que muchas veces intentan apoderarse de sus ganancias diarias. Ella no está casada, tiene una hija de 5 años de edad, que estudia en una escuela fiscal.

Ella usara el préstamo para comprar hielo, esencias para los granizados y otra parte del crédito utilizar para su casa en ladrillo, cemento, etc. Ella desea que su hijo sea un profesional para que pueda defenderse solo en el futuro.
texts.en:
Ramona, age 58, lives in Quevedo, Ecuador.  She undertook this business activity of making juices with crushed ice thanks to an idea from a friend of hers.  This way she was able to take care of her five year old child.

She sells her juices with crushed ice alone from 10:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m.

The difficulty she faces in her work is that the thieves often try to take her daily earnings.

She is not married, and she has a five year old daughter, who goes to a public school.

She will use the loan to buy ice and flavoring for the crushed ice.  She will use the other part of the loan for bricks and cement, etc. for her house.

She wishes that her child will become a professional so that she is able to fend for herself in the future.

loans.use: to buy ice, flavoring, cement, and bricks.

loans.name: Mahugnon Group

texts.fr: MAHUGNON est un groupe est composé de cinq personnes qui résident dans la même zone. Avlessi, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 62 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Avlessi ne vit plus avec son mari. Avlessi a cinq enfants, scolarisés et à sa charge. Avlessi vit seule avec ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont supportées par Avlessi. Pour ce faire, Avlessi vend des noix de coco, des sacs de sucre et des produits congelés depuis de treize ans. Avlessi  s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la cinquième fois que Avlessi sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUGNON dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des noix de coco, des sacs de sucre et des produits congelés.

loans.name: Afi Nukunu

texts.fr: Afi est une femme mariée âgée de 45 ans résidant à Adidogomé. Avec six enfants à charge, Afi est une revendeuse d’ignames frit qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Afi sollicite ce prêt pour commander des calebasses d’ignames. Afi désire gagner plus de bénéfice suite à une bonne revente afin de venir en aide à ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire puis aider son mari à prendre en charge les diverses dépenses quotidiennes qu’elle éprouve en famille.

loans.use: Acheter 06 calebasses d'ignames.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is 45 years old. She is married and has 5 children. Nancy had benefited from Kiva by receiving a loan of USD 300 that enabled her to buy a dairy cow to improve her family income level. Nancy has also been voted in as the new treasurer of Queen Esther women group. The group elected its new official as per the group constitution. Nancy is one of the strong members in the group. Before the closure of the year, the group approved a loan of USD 300 for Nancy to enable her pay her son’s secondary school fees. The son is sitting for the final secondary school exam in 2007 and repayment of the school fees will enable him to concentrate in his studies without interruptions. The child is a bright student and Nancy wants to give him all the necessary support to enable him perform well. Nancy will repay his loan from the proceeds she gets from her farming activities. Nancy is aware of the group rules and regulations on repayments of all the loans given to the members. She will abide by the rules.

loans.use: Nancy would like to pay Secondary School Fees

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde and her family are from San Luís de Potosí but left that city to look for better opportunities elsewhere. They came to Juárez in the state of Nuevo Leon, where they were able to get some land. Matilde's husband works for a bricklayer. Their economic situation was quite bad when their second daughter was about to be born and they realized they couldn't afford another baby. That was when Matilde decided to make and sell tamales, which helped her buy necessary things for her child. Five years later, Matilde has three daughters, aged 2, 5, and 7.

Matilde needs a loan of only $200 which she will use to buy a tamale steamer to increase her production of tamales. This will help her business grow and allow her to sell in more areas. You can be an integral part of the growth of her business, this family's wellbeing is in your hands, they will be very grateful.

Matilde y su familia son originarios de San Luís Potosí, salieron en busca de mejores oportunidades y llegaron a Juárez, en el estado de Nuevo León, en donde consiguieron un terreno. Su esposo es ayudante de albañil y la situación económica en la que se encontraban era muy escasa. Cuando estaba por nacer su segunda hija, y ellos no se encontraban en posibilidades de pagar los gastos de un bebé, ella decidió empezar con la elaboración y venta de tamales, lo que le ayudó a comprar lo necesario para su hija, ya hace cinco años de esto, Matilde tiene tres hijas, de 2, 5 y 7 años de edad.

En estos momentos, Matilde necesita de un préstamo de solo $ 200 dólares con los que espera comprar una vaporera para poder incrementar su producción de tamales y así tener más oportunidades de hacer crecer su negocio y extender su área de ventas. Tú puedes ser parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio, en tus manos está el bienestar de esta familia, ellos te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: Purchase kitchen appliances

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Miss Thuy is 37 and her husband is 43 years old. They have 5 children between 17 and 2 who are going to school. They don’t have any land for cultivation. Mr Thao, her husband is a mason but he can only find work in the dry season. Miss Thuy sells vegetable and fruits at the small market. Her selling is thus important to increase her family about $1.5/person/month. Their income is $9/person/month. Miss Thuy has already repaid the first loan in time. Now, she wants to borrow a loan of $75 for her selling business.

loans.use: sells vegetable and fruits

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: D. Pauline is a dynamic 39-year-old single mother. She lives with her 2 children in Port-Bouët, a popular district in the southern area of Abidjan. Pauline is a good tailor. She performs her activities in the Port-Bouët open market. She takes care to the tuition fees of her two children. Pauline wants to purchase a stock of school uniforms. She will make primary school pupil dress for September. This is a good business opportunity for Pauline as she will get a good margin from the school uniform sales in September and October. Pauline joined the AE&I microcredit program in December, 2005 and has been a good performer since then. She is courageous and ambitious.

loans.use: Dago Pauline

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
Valentina’s family consists of five children. Her husband works abroad and sends money monthly. Valetina’s child vary in age and since they all depend on her, she struggles to provide them with security, good health and all of their needs. The business is located on ‘Tarata y Esteban Arce’ street in the city of Cochabamba. The title for her booth is in her husband’s name. Valentina has many years of experience selling women’s clothing exclusively, especially items from Korea which are in highest demand. There exists a lot of competition but Valentina differentiates herself by paying close attention to her customers and is very capable in offering great styles, both imported and those ready for export. The merchandise she is looking to purchase if imported from Korea, is of varying prices, of high quality and fall in line with the current desired fashions. Valentina has proven that she is very loyal to our institution. This is her forth loan request and she has always demonstrated responsibility and punctuality.

Translated from Spanish by Christian García, Kiva Volunteer.

Valentina tiene una familia compuesta por cinco hijos, el esposo trabaja en el extranjero y envía dinero en forma mensual para su familia. Los hijos de Valentina tienen diferentes edades y como todos dependen de ella, se esfuerza trabajando para brindarles seguridad, salud y para cubrir todas sus necesidades. El negocio se encuentra ubicado en la calle Tarata y Esteban Arce de la ciudad de Cochabamba, tiene un puesto fijo que esta a nombre del esposo. Valentina tiene muchos años de experiencia en el rubro de la comercialización de prendas de mujer exlusivamente, de prefencia la que es de Industria Coreana, ya que son de mayor demanda en el mercado. Si bien existe mucha competencia en este rubro y en esa zona la diferencia se encuentra en la calidad de atención que brinda Valentina a sus clientes, es una persona muy hábil para ofrecer la ropa de mujer tanto importada como exportada. La mercadería que adquirirá es de damas, industria coreana, los precios son variables (un poco más elevados que la nacional), son de buena tela y acorde a las exigencias de la moda actual. Valentina es una cliente fiel a nuestra institución, ya que esta solicitud es la cuarta y siempre demostró responsabilidad y puntualidad.

loans.use:
Purchase of Seasonal Merchandise

Compra de mercadería por temporada

loans.name: Ni Ketut Suarni

texts.id:
After married to I Made Darma, Ni Ketut Suami opened a small shop (or warung in local term, pronounced as waroong) in front of her house. She chose to open a small shop as she saw there was none open a shop in her neighborhood. Her small shop carries variety of stuffs such as snack and basic daily necessities such as vegetables. She opens her shop from 07.00 AM to 06.00 PM. As the shop is located in front of her house, when there is no customer, she can do her house chores. In running this business she needs fund to expand her shop. In addition of having retail (individual) customers, she also supplies other smaller vendors. At the moment after having additional funding to expand her business, she can earned net profit of IDR 150 thousand/ day. In the past she can only earned IDR 50 thousand/ day. She is hoping to be able to expand her warung business in the future.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Setelah menikah dengan I Made Darma, kini Ni Ketut Suarni mulai membuka warung kecil di depan rumahnya.Usaha ini dipilih karena di daerah tempat tinggalnya belum ada usaha warung yang menjadi saingan dalam usahanya. Barang yang dijual pun beraneka macam seperti makanan ringan dan kebutuhan pokok setiap hari bahkan sayur mayur.Setiap hari Ni Ketut Suarni membuka warung pada pukul 07.00 wita dan tutup pada pukul 18.00 wita. Karena warung ada didepan rumahnya, maka jika tidak ada pelanggan yang berbelanja Ni Ketut Suarni bisa melakukan pekerjaan rumah tangga lainnya. Dalam menjalankan usaha ini Ni Ketut Suarni membutuhkan dana untuk menambah usaha warungnya karena pelanggannya banyak sedangkan modal yang dimiliki sangat terbatas. Disamping melayani konsumen secara individu untuk kepentingan sendiri, Ni Ketut Suarni juga menjadi suplyer bagi para pedagang yang lain yang lebih kecil karena modal yang mereka miliki sangat kecil dan terbatas. Sekarang setelah Ni Ketut Suarni mendapat tambahan modal ia dapat melayani para konsumen lebih banyak lagi dengan keuntungan bersih perhari mencapai Rp.150.000,- yang dulunya hanya memperoleh keuntungan bersih perhari Rp 50.000. Usaha warung ini ditekuninya dengan harapan kedepannya usaha warung dapat lebih meningkat dan menjadi lebih besar lagi dari sekarang.

loans.use: To add the inventory for her small shop

loans.name: Im

texts.en: Mrs. Im S., age 55, is a widow and works selling porridge, earning around $1 each day. She has two children, one who is employed at a garment factory earning $80 per month, and one works growing cashew nut trees. Her granddaughter also lives with her and works in a factory earning around $80 per month. Im would like to request a loan of $800 in order to purchase a plot of land to help her son grow cashew nut trees.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of land to help her son grow cashew nut trees.

loans.name: Saryamah

texts.en: Saryamah, 32, is a mother of 3 children aged 16, 15 and 9. Her husband, J., does not work anymore. To support her family she sells instant noodles at her house, earning USD3 a day. She is asking for a loan of USD75 to add her business capital and as a member of MBK is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: Adding her business capital

loans.name: Kisanja Central A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Hasifa N.. She is currently in the business of operating a restaurant and is requesting a loan to buy food warmers. Hasifa is 47 years old and is married. Her husband is a builder. She has 2 children aged 18 and 19 and both do not go to school. Each week, Hasifa makes approximately UGX 40000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a commercial house. Hasifa has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Hasifa is joined in her small group by Lubanga N., Justine N., Janet B., and Jenifer Nabujjo. Lubanga N. has a business in selling matooke and wants to add more capital. Justine N. is currently operating a business in matooke selling and wants a loan to boost business. Janet B. operates a business of selling new clothes and wants to purchase more clothes for sale. Jenifer Nabujjo is currently in the business of running a beauty salon and is requesting a loan to buy a hair dryer and more salon equipment.

loans.use: To expand restaurant business

loans.name: Novruz

texts.en: Novruz was born in 1977. He is married, and has one child. The B.'s family lives in the town of Khachmaz.  Five years ago he started the butchery. Now he is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy cattle so he can increase his butchery business.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase Materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: As additional capital to buy more clothing for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothing to resell in her community.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of a large variety of cakes, sweets, and other goods to sell to small groceries stores and cafeterias.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
Wilson lives in his parents´home on Arturo Borda street in the Sopocachi area of the city of La Paz. He is 26 years old and his work is assemblying computers and installing software. In addition to this activity, Wilson is a technician and he also repairs radios and other electrical equipment.

He is requesting a loan to make repairs to his home. The wood flooring in the living room is deteriorating because of humidity and runs the risk of collapsing if it is not fixed immediately. His record with IMPRO is good, his payment history is excellent and this qualifies him to obtain a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Wilson vive en casa de sus padres en la calle Arturo Borda de la zona de Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz; tiene 26 años de edad y la actividad a la que se dedica es el armado de computadoras y el software de las mismas; además de esta actividad, Wilson es técnico y también arregla radios y artefactos eléctricos.

El crédito que solicita es para refaccionar su casa ya que el piso de machimbre de la sala esta cediendo por la humedad y corre el riesgo de hundirse si no se efectúan los arreglos inmediatamente. El historial que tiene con Impro es bueno, su historial de pagos es excelente y esto lo califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: Buy supplies to repair the floors in his home.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina tiene 45 años, vive con 2 de sus 4 hijos. Todos los días, se dedica a atender su propio restaurante, el cual instaló hace 3 años, en una de las avenidas principales de su barrio, desde entonces no ha dejado  su negocio, con mucho esmero y dedicación, prepara todo tipo de comidas, lo que vende principalmente son almuerzos, para ello, durante toda la mañana cocina y a medio día abre su restaurante para vender sus menús, cerca de las 5 de la tarde cierra para lavar los utensilios, afortunadamente  Dina es apoyada  por sus 2 hijos, que también lavan los cubiertos y el menaje, en ocasiones  le ayudan a atender su negocio; este ritmo de trabajo es de lunes a sábado, el domingo es su día de descanso, no considera una dificultad grande que se presente en sus actividades diarias, ya que mira este negocio con mucho optimismo.
Dina se esfuerza porque ella sola es el sostén de su hogar, desea que sus hijos se sigan superando.
Solicita este préstamo con el que podrá comprar abarrotes, y demás ingredientes básicos para preparara sus alimentos, de esa manera almacenarlos para que la inversión sea menor y las ganancias sean mayores.
texts.en:
Dina is 45 years old, she lives with 2 of her 4 children. Everyday she works in her own restaurant, which she began 3 years ago, in one of the main streets of her neighborhood. Since then she has not left her business. With great care and dedication, she prepares all kinds of meals. She primarily sells lunches, and so during the mornings she cooks and at midday she opens her restaurant to sell her meals. Around 5 in the afternoon she closes to wash her utensils.
