Fortunately Dina is supported by her two children, who also wash the dishes and kitchen pans, and occasionally they help her take care of her business. This work takes place Monday through Saturday, Sunday is her day of rest. She doesn't consider her daily activities a great difficulty as she sees this business wtih great optimism. Dina works hard because she is who supports their home, and she wishes her children to be successful. She is seeking this loan in order to buy groceries and basic ingredients to prepare her meals. In this way she will be stocked and the investment will be small and the earnings will be great.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supply her business and stock ingredients to prepare her meals

loans.name: Faaopopo

texts.en: Faapopo S., 48, is married and has two children. She has many years of experience in the taro and banana plantation business. She sells her products two days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 540 Tala (about $225 USD).  She is asking for a $300 USD loan to buy equipment and supplies (such as a wheelbarrow, spade, crowbar, weedkiller chemicals, and focshek fungicide for prevention of taro blight) for her plantation. SPBD loans are Faapopo's only access to capital because she cannot qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Tajir

texts.en:
Tajir H. is 22 years old; a young and very hard-working entrepreneur. He owns a store where he sells laundry soap, bath and washing powders, soaps and shampoo. He started his business in 2004 with the financial support of his father, who is now living on his pension. Tajit lives with his elderly parents and his business is the only financial source for his family.  

Tajir has applied for a loan of $1200 to purchase more inventory for his shop. This will allow him to generate more income and better support his family.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Martina Del Carmen

texts.es: La joven Martina  está solicitando a AFODENIC refinanciamiento de su 3er crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (Construcción de una Habitación), trabaja como Jefe de Operaciones en Finca Nicaragua, vive  en la zona # 2  de Nueva Guinea, a pesar que ella no tiene hijos es una joven que ha luchado para que a su ancianos padres no les falte nada, pues como es la hija menor, vive con ellos para atenderlos en lo que mas pueda, Martina  es una mujer profesional, responsable, honesta,  trabajadora, profesa  la religión católica, su sueño es tener un porvenir mejor, estudiar una maestria,  tener una vivienda bonita, trabajo, y tratar que a sus padres no les falte nada del hogar.
texts.en:
Martina would like AFODENIC to refinance her third loan in order to construct a new bedroom in her home. She works as Chief of Operations at “Finca Nicaragua,” and lives in Zone 2 of the New Guinea neighborhood. Although she has no children, Martina is a young woman who has worked hard so that her aging parents do not want for anything. Since she is their youngest daughter, she lives with and cares for them. Martina is a professional woman. She is responsible, honest, hard-working, and Catholic. Her dream is to have a better future. She wants to earn a master's degree, have a beautiful house, be gainfully employed, and make sure that her parents have a comfortable home.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To construct a bedroom

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Don Ramón C. de 43 años de edad está casado hace 20 años con Doña Celina Vázquez, de 44 años de edad. El matrimonio tiene 4 hijos de 19, 14, 11 y 5 años de edad; de los cuales, el mayor esta en el primer año de la universidad, el segundo esta en el 1º de la media, el tercero está cursando el 7º grado. y el último este año empezó con el pre escolar.
El Señor Ramón se encuentra trabajando en el rubro de la carpintería desde hace 9 años, se había iniciado en este oficio con un pequeño ahorro que contaba de su antiguo trabajo, que fue el macate (venta ambulante), el cual tuvo que abandonar por un accidente de tránsito que había sufrido. En su carpintería recibe la ayuda de su señora y su hijo mayor.
El cliente solicita el préstamo para la compra de materias primas, tales como: maderas, terciadas, pegamentos, clavos y otros. Ya que él distribuye sus productos en diferentes mueblerías y cuenta con mucha demanda por la buena calidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Mr. Ramón C. is 43 years old and has been married for 20 years to 44 year old Mrs. Celina Vázquez. The couple has 4 children ages 19, 14, 11 and 5 years old. The oldest is in the first year of studies at the university, the second in the first year of high school, the third in 7th grade and the last began preschool this year. Ramón has been working in the field of carpentry for 9 years, starting his business with a small savings he had from his previous job as a street vendor, which he left because of a traffic accident. His wife and oldest son help him with his carpentry business. The client is seeking a loan to buy materials such as: wood, plywood, glue, nails, and more. He distributes his products in different furniture stores and has a lot of demand because of the good quality of his products.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood, plywood, glue, nails, etc.

loans.name: Khadija M. Aslam Group

texts.en:
Khadija baji is a 48 year old married lady who has resided in the city of Arifwala, Pakistan for the past 20 years. Her husband, Mr. A. is a trader by profession. He deals with wheat and corn, which he buys in one place and sells in another place. He has been doing this work for 25 years. Khadija baji is the mother of three children; two sons and one daughter. Both of her sons are in the vegetable selling business. Her daughter is 15 years old, lives at home and helps her mother with  the clothes sewing  business. Khadija baji has taught her daughter, how to sew clothes. Now the daughter is an expert and can sew clothes by herself. Khadija baji invests the income in a banking committee and is planning to marry off her daughter when she has saved enough. 

Khadija baji is a group leader with several other women in her locality. She is applying for a loan to buy wheat and corn for her husband’s business. Mumtaz baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Zainab baji wants a loan to pay off the installments on her buffalo. Tasleem baji wants a loan to buy material (beads, colored thread and cloth) to expand her decorative embroider business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy wheat and corn

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
Luís es socio del Bancomunal Mi Buen Pastor.
Luis es soltero, tiene 23 años, termina la escuela, y esta  estudiando pastelería fina.
Luís trabajo en wong en el área de pastelería, es allí donde se inclino mas por el negocio de pastelería, y viendo a su mama hacer pasteles. Empezó vendiendo leche asada y postres en los puestos del mercado y en dulcerías; cada día reparte cincuenta leches asadas.
Luís necesita un crédito de 1600 soles para la compra de un horno industrial e ingredientes para preparar  pasteles.  
El sueño de Luís abrir una pastelería y hacer pasteles para empresas grandes como wong.
texts.en:
Luís is a member of Bancomunal Mi Buen Pastor. Luis is single, 23, is finishing school and studying fine baking. Luis works at Wong in the pastry section, which is where he became more inclined towards the pastry business, as well as seeing his mother make pastries. He started selling puddings and desserts to market stands and sweet shops. Every day he would distribute 50 puddings. Luis needs a loan of $500 to buy an industrial oven and ingredients to prepare pastries. His dream is to open a bakery and make pastries for large companies such as Wong.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Luis needs a loan of $500 to buy an industrial oven and ingredients to prepare pastries.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Nataliya is married with two daughters who are 11 and 15 years old and who need her care and support. She sells clothing at the market in Pavlograd city and has a very good location that brings many clients her way. Her business does well. Nataliya has been in this business for four years, ever since she saw that women's clothing is one of the few products that sell well and produce a stable income. Nataliay's husband works in a mine. 

Nataliya would like to get a loan of $600 in order to build her own kiosk. A kiosk would improve her business as well as her working conditions, as she would not need to hang all the clothing every day and re-bag it at the end of the work day.

loans.use: To build a kiosk

loans.name: G.s Pablo Ii Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario Pablo II esta conformado por Gregoria C. Moreno y Petrona de los Milagros C. U. ambas integrantes poseen diferentes actividades económicas en el caso de Doña Gregoria se dedica a la elaboración de repostería. La edad de Doña Gregoria es de 55 años. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que empezó a comercializarlas en el mercado y mas tarde con la ayuda de los financiamientos es que ha logrado establecerse en su vivienda. La Señora Petrona de los Milagros C. U. tiene 32 años, la actividad económica de Doña Petrona es la elaboración de bordados de manteles, toallas y sabanas. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio por lo que inicio a comercializarlos con pequeños vendedores ambulantes ya que ellos le realizaban los encargos correspondientes. Es por eso que ambas recurren al financiamiento para mantener activos sus negocios para invertirlos en capital de trabajo en caso de Doña Petrona en la compra de hilo, cintas, tijeras y telas. Y Doña Gregoria lo solicita para la compra de materia prima como huevos, azúcar, mantequilla entre otros. La Señora Gregoria C. Moreno solicita la cantidad de C$ 6.000 cordobés y su amiga Petrona de los Milagros solicita la cantidad de C$4.000 córdobas.
texts.en:
Ms. Gregoria and Ms. Petrona de los Milagros form the Pablo II Solidary Group. Each of them has a different activity. Ms. Gregoria is 55 years old. She makes pastries and has been doing it for more than 15 years. She started selling them at the markets, but with help from previous loans, she has established herself at her home.

Ms. Petrona de los Milagros is 32 years old. She embroiders linen goods and has been doing it for seven years. She started by selling them to peddlers who place different orders. The two of them request the loan to be able to continue with their businesses and to buy necessary supplies. Ms. Gregoria requests C$ 6.000 cordobés to buy the necessary ingredients for the pastries, like eggs, sugar and butter, and her friend, Ms. Petrona de los Milagros is asking for a loan of C$4.000 córdobas to buy thread, ribbon, scissors and fabric.

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mahliyo

texts.ru: Махлиё - молодая девушка 19 лет. Еше не замужем, но скоро выйдет замуж. Она помогает своим родителям. Отец пасет скот на горах. Махлиё с матерью и сестрами откармливают крупно-рогатый скот дома. У Махлиё есть 2 сестры и 3 брата. Махлиё самая старшая и ей приходится работать и за одно присматривать за своими братьями и сестрами. Для приданого невесты нужно немало денег, поэтому Махлиё помогает родителям, чтобы они могли заработать больше.
texts.en:
Mahliyo is a young, 19 year old woman. She is not married yet, but will be married soon. She helps her parents. Her father tends livestock in the mountains. Mahliyo with her mother and sisters fattens large livestock at home. Mahliyo has 2 sisters and 3 brothers. Mahliyo is the oldest and she needs to work and also to watch over her brothers and sisters. A bride’s dowry requires an amount of money that is not small, that is why Mahliyo helps her parents so that they can earn more.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling livestock

loans.name: Srun

texts.en:
Mr. Srun D., 54, and his wife, Mrs. Vouch Sin, 53, who live in a small village in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia, were married in 1977 and have seven children: four sons and three daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home; two daughters are garment factory workers; one son is a musician and another one attends school.

Srun has been a flat-tire fixer at his house for two years while his wife has been selling groceries for four years. She buys grocery items from the market for re-sale at her house. Their house is very old and broken in some parts so that's why they decided to build a new house to live in, but it isn’t finished yet. Srun is asking for his first loan of US$ 1,000 to build his new house.

loans.use: To build a new house

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita P. is from the town of Lallo, Cagayan. She is 51 years old, married, and has two adult-aged children. Jovita owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community.

Jovita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jovita is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. She also plans to renovate their house in the future.


About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Benkadi 4 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi 4 est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de Sirakélé de la ville de Koutiala  région de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux parents, belles sœurs  etc. Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et au moins  5 enfants.
Elles cultivent uniquement  de l’arachide.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe Benkadi 4 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant cinq ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés  les quatre   prêts précédents, elles sont à leur cinquième  prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, des semences d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, au grand marché de Koutiala. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Koutiala et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe Benkadi 4 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 65 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du  prêt de Soro Yiriwaso  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Benkadi 4 group brings together married women of the village of Sirakélé, town of Koutiala, region of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in big traditional extended families with their children, husbands, parents-in-law, sisters-in-law, etc. They are 40 on average and have at least 5 children. They plant only peanuts.

In the interest of making their agricultural businesses profitable, the members of the Benkadi 4 group decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso five years ago. After having correctly reimbursed the four preceding loans, they are on their fifth rural loan.

This loan will be used to buy peanut seeds, small agricultural materials, and intrants for this crop in the big open-air market of Koutiala. After the rainy season, the harvest is stockpiled for a certain time until it gains value before being sold at the big marketplace of Koutiala and in surrounding markets, retail (often wholesale) and for cash, to a clientele mostly coming from the big cities.

Each of the members of the Benkadi 4 group expect to make, after their crops have been sold, a profit of 65,000 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the interest on the Soro Yiriwaso loan and for current family expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of intrants, seeds, and minor agricultural materials

loans.name: Oralia Del Carmen

texts.es:
la sra Oralia del Carmen M. se dedica al comercio, ella cuenta con una pulperia y venta de cosmeticos, su negocio le permite generar ingresos pra cubrir con los gastos del hogar, ella es madre de 4 hijos los cuales estan en edad escolar.
ella necesita invertir en su negocio para hacerlo crecer para poder tener mejores ganancias, ella es madre soltera y tiene que esforzarse para sacar adelante a sus hijos y darles educacion, alimento y vivienda, el sueño de ella es ver a sus hijos que sean unos profesionales y que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Señora Oralia del Carmen M. has a grocery store and also sells cosmetics. Her business lets her generate income to cover her home's expenses. She is the mother of four school-aged children. She needs to invest in her business to make it grow so she can make better profits. She is a single mother and has to strive to take good care of her children and give them education, food, and a home. Her dream is to see her children become professionals so they will be worthy people.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase churros, juices, salt, coffee, bread, cookies, candy, butter, rice, sugar, beans, and corn.

loans.name: Flores De Febrero Group

texts.es:
“F. de febrero” es un grupo de  señoras dinámicas que elaboran su reglamento interno, es decir, ponerse de acuerdo en el día y hora de la reunión, así como las multas por retrazo, falta e incumplimiento de la cuota, a la cabeza de su presidenta Lourdes G. quien las dirige bajo un ordenado orden del día. 

Lourdes cuenta que ella tiene una librería y requiere del préstamo para incrementar su  mercadería , es decir, comprar hojas, cuadernos, lápices, cartulina y otros. Las demás integrantes también tienen su propios negocios como la venta de zapatos, ropa y CD, pero una mayoría tiene el negocio de macramé, es un tipo de tejido que se hace con las manos y pueden elaborar carteras, chalinas y sombreros y necesitan el préstamo para comprar insumos como la cola de rata.
texts.en:
The “F. de febrero” (Flowers of February) Association is a dynamic group of women who draw up their own rules such as the agreed day and time for their meetings, penalties for late payments, etc. The group’s president, Lourdes G., maintains order at each meeting.

Lourdes runs a bookstore and needs a loan to increase her merchandise, such as writing tablets, notebooks, pencils, greeting cards, and other items. The remaining members also have their own businesses selling shoes, clothing, and compact discs. However, the majority have macramé businesses that produce handmade satchels, scarves, and hats. They need a loan to buy supplies such as crochet materials.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & supplies

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 22-year-old single man living with his parents. In 2007, he decided to open a special tobacco shop as his own business. Today, Hussein is requesting to borrow $1,200 to purchase additional merchandise in order to satisfy the needs of his clients.

loans.use: purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Rafiatou

texts.fr: Rafiatou est née en 1980 à Adjarra, elle est mariée à Idrissou. Idrissou et Rafiatou ont deux enfants mais c’est l’ainé seul qui est scolarisé. Rafiatou vit avec sa famille à Cotonou, Capitale Économique  de la République du Bénin depuis trois ans. C’est le mari de Rafiatou qui supporte les dépenses de la famille. C’est des draps de lit, les taies d’oreillers, les foulards et chapeaux de femme et des rideaux que Rafiatou vend à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Rafiatou va au Togo, pays frontalier au Bénin pour s’approvisionner en ces différents articles. Rafiatou veut renforcer son fonds de roulement ; c’est pourquoi elle sollicite ce premier prêt d’ALIDé.

loans.use: Achat de draps de lit, taies d’oreillers, foulards et chapeaux de femme et des rideaux.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is 26 years old and married with two young children. Amal lives in Nabatieh, in southern Lebanon, where she sells clothes and fabric. She has been in this business for four years and she is requesting a loan of $2000 from the Kiva field partner, Al Majmoua, to repair the transportation van she uses to sell her products. She is good at what she does and her clients are mainly her friends and neighbors.

Amal hasn’t faced any problems and she hopes to expand her working space and improve the quality of her products in the future.

loans.use: To repair the transportation van she uses to sell her products.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene S., 36 years old, is a rice grower. She has five children, the eldest is 18 years old. Currently, she is helping her husband till their one hectare farm. She hopes that their farm will provide her family with enough food, clothing and income to pay the school tuitions and other needs.

She would like to ask for a loan of PHP 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her rice farm. The loan will hopefully help improve her yield to support the needs for her family.

loans.use: Farm financing.

loans.name: Bukky

texts.en: Bukky is 34 years old and married with 2 children.  She buys crates of soft drinks to retail to her customers. She hopes to receive a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more supplies of drinks to resell. She is indeed grateful to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies of soft drinks to resell

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en:
Ruta M. is a 22-year-old woman living in the town of Faleasiu Tualesolo. She is single and does not have any children. To make a living, Ruta is starting a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Ruta has been engaged in this business for over 1 year and earns approximately 400 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Ruta joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruta is now requesting a loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Ruta plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Sodnompil

texts.en:
Sodnompil B. is 22 years old and lives with his parents in the Uvurhangai province of central Mongolia. He and his parents live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. B. operates his own taxi service. He began working for another taxi service in 2005 as a shift driver and since then he has been able to purchase his own microbus and begin his own business. Eventually, he would like to trade-in his microbus for a larger bus so that he can take on more passengers and bring in more money. B. is a young man who is not afraid of hard work and long hours in order to improve both his and his parents’ lives. He is requesting a 4,000,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase repair parts and upgrade his microbus for winter. About XacBank: XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase repair parts and upgrade his microbus for winter

loans.name: Alice Indangasi

texts.en:
Alice owns the Mama Melvo Fashion Shop and sells shoes, bags, t-shirts, dresses and trousers to repeat and walk-in customers. She has been operating this business for the last two years. Her business is located by the roadside and alongside a busy local market. Her business challenges are strong competition from similar businesses and disturbances from local authorities (municipal police).

She is using the loan of 20,000 KES to buy bags, ladies' trousers and t- shirts. In the future, she wants to expand her business into a big boutique shop and to build a decent house for her family. Alice is married with two children and describes herself as a hardworking and aggressive person.

loans.use: To buy twenty bags, two hundred ladies trousers and one hundred T-shirts.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora S.'s main source of income comes from raising pigs to sell. She is 42 years old and single, from the village of Gud, San Isidro. Flora earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Flora joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Flora is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Sumya

texts.en:
B. is 29 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a house in the Arkhangai province of Mongolia. His oldest son, 11, attends a local secondary school while his youngest son, 6, attends a local primary school. 

He and his wife operate a jewelry retail business in a rented stall at a local trading center. They began their business in 2006 with working capital of 300,000 tugrugs. Since then, they have grown their business and now his working capital is 2,100,000 tugrugs. With the business earnings, he was able to purchase a home for his family so that they might be more comfortable. 

B. hopes to continue growing his business in the future and is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase a large amount of jewelry to sell during the upcoming Christmas and New Year season.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of jewelry

loans.name: Bermarie

texts.en:
Bermarie T. is from the village of Caputol located in Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old. Bermarie is married and has seven infant-aged children. To make a living, Bermarie owns & operates a business transporting local community members around the various neighborhoods. Bermarie has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2001, Bermarie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bermarie has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Bermarie is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase parts for her motorcycle needed to provide service. This loan will be the 14th loan taken out by Bermarie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase parts needed for her motorcycle

loans.name: Kea

texts.en: Mr. Kea C. is 54 years old and he lives in Toul Sala village in Kandal province. He and his wife, Mrs. Yem Uor, are farmers who own a two-hectare field of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables to support their family. In the dry season, they do not have enough money to support their rice cultivation.  Thus, Mr. Kea C. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed and fertilizer. He will use the rest of the loan to buy pesticides to support their crops and increase their yield. He is a father of two children. One of the children is employed in a garment factory and the other is studying in a local public school.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Charlita

texts.es:
Charlita, es una mujer muy jovial, vive en el Distrito de Yarina cocha, región Ucayali, tiene 27 años, es madre de un menor de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa usadas, esta actividad la realiza de manera ambulante, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja como obrero en una triplayera (venta de madera). Charlita forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Dinámicas”, desde hace un año y medio, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la venta de cerveza.
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1000 soles, que será invertido en la compra de ropa usadas para su posterior venta. La meta de Charlita es poner un negocio de venta de cerveza y una tienda de piñaterías y decoraciones.
texts.en:
Charlita, a very cheerful woman, lives in the Yarina Cocha district, in the Ucayali region. She is 27 years old and the mother of a small child. She sells used clothing, which she does as a traveling salesperson. She has the support of her husband who works in a plywood factory. Charlita has been part of the community bank "Las Dinámicas" for a year and a half. The first loan she received was for 300 soles, which she invested in beer to sell.

Now she needs a loan of 1000 soles, which will be invested in buying used clothing to sell. Charlita's goal is to start a business selling beer and a store with piñatas and decorations.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Second-hand clothing

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena P. is from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 57 years old. Lucena is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Lucena owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling powdered soap, sugar and coffee, Milo (cocoa powder), etc. in the local community. Lucena has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lucena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Lucena is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Lucena from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es un padre de familia de 62 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el sector Chacupe, una zona rural dedicada a labores agrícolas que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de La Victoria, a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde que era muy joven a trabajar en la agricultura, empezó trabajando como obrero agrícola y hace diez años pudo adquirir un terreno de 1.5 herctareas en donde viene sembrando arroz para ganarse la vida. Este cultivo es de mucha importancia para su familia ya que sus ingresos económicos dependen de su correcto desarrollo.

Pedro desea brindarle mantenimiento constante a su cultivo para asegurarse una buena producción, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de foliares para abonar su cultivo de arroz.

El es un hombre bastante honrado y que es muy entregado a su trabajo. Su mayor anhelo es tener exito en esta campaña para asegurarle a su familia la estabilidad que necesita. Pedro ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual y responsable.
texts.en:
Pedro, age 62, is the head of a family. He lives with his wife in the Chacupe sector, a rural agricultural area located in the La Victoria district, 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Since he was very young he has worked in agriculture. He began working as an agricultural laborer, and ten years ago he was able to acquire 1.5 hectares of land where he plants rice in order to earn a living. This crop is very important for his family since they depend on his earnings for their continued development.

Pedro wants to offer consistent maintenance to his crops in order to assure good production. That’s why he is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 new soles that he plans on investing in the purchase of nutrients for fertilizing his rice crop.

He is a very honest man and is very dedicated to his work. His greatest wish is to have success in this field in order to assure his family the stability that it needs. Pedro has worked with our institution previously and has shown himself to be a punctual and responsible borrower.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of nutrients for fertilizing a rice crop.

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en: Parveen is an ambitious and happy-natured lady. She runs a business selling sugar cane. She supplies sugar canes to the juice corners on a daily basis, and in this way earns income. Her income helps her to run the financial unit of her house. Parveen's husband, N. M., has had a wheat-selling business for the past five years. Parveen is applying for a loan to buy wheat in bulk to expand her husband’s business.

loans.use: To buy wheat to sell

loans.name: Cora's Group

texts.en: Cora L. is from the village of Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old and is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Cora is married and has four adult children. She owns and operates a business raising and selling pigs. She has been engaged in her business for over thirteen years and earns approximately 2,400 PHP a month. In 2009, Cora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the standard of living of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her pigs

loans.name: La Rubia Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Rubia lo integran tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Damaris L. M. quien se dedica al comercio de artesanía en el norte del país. L. por su negocio vive viajando según comento una semana está en el norte comercializando con una muchacha y otra semana viene a traer mercadería a Masaya.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Martha Azucena García quien desde hace diez años vende calzado y Martha M.  quien tiene una tortillería y los fines de semana realiza nacatamales, moronga, frito etc.
texts.en:
The group “La Rubia” consists of three strong, hardworking, and enterprising women. The group coordinator is Sra. Damaris L. M., who sells handicrafts in the northern part of the country. She spends most of the time traveling for her business. Damaris says that one week she will be in the north selling with another young woman, and on another week, she will be bringing her merchandise to Masaya. Her fellow group members are Martha Azucena García, who has been selling shoes for ten years, and Martha M., who sells tortillas and makes Nicaraguan tamales, blood sausage, and fried foods on the weekends.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase crafts to sell

loans.name: Jogueraha Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su décimo segundo ciclo.
Todas las integrantes esta realizando alguna actividad que les genere ingreso y con la ayuda de las asesoras logran abrir o mejorar la actividad que cada una realiza.
Una de las integrantes es la  Sra. Sandra R., su principal actividad es la limpieza de casas de familia en la semana, pero esta actividad lo separa mucho de su familia y quiere independizarse dedicándose a la venta de frutas y verduras desde su casa.
Solicita el préstamo para llevar a cabo el proyecto de venta frutas y verduras (naranjas, manzanas, plátanos, cebollas, tomates, locotes y otros).
texts.en:
This committee finds itself in its tenth cycle. All the members are involved in some type of income-generating activity, and with the help of the group’s advisors, are succeeding in starting or growing the businesses that they are all involved in. One of the members is Mrs. Sandra R.. Her primary business is housecleaning during the week, but this takes her away from her family, and she would like to be more independent by opening and fruit and vegetable stand in her home. She is requesting this loan to make this a reality, selling oranges, apples, plantains, onions, and tomatoes, among others.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia A. is from the town of Talibon. She is 54 years old. Delia is married and has 7 children. To make a living, Delia owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community. Delia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years now.

Delia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Delia is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Delia from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business and supplement the family's income.

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Ronerie

texts.en:
Ronerie J. is a 28-year-old married woman who lives in Zone 4, Brgy Tabao, Valladolid, Negros Occidental. She earns her living owning and operating a general store.

Ronerie’s 29-year-old husband, Archie, is an employee of Sugar Central, and they have two children who are 6 and 7 years old. The children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Ronerie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve their family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income through the general store. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000 from her business activities.

Ronerie is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 9,000 was used to fund operations for her general store, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 13th cycle loan, the amount of PHP 10,000, which she intends to use on her general store. Ronerie is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Mrs. Suosdei Meoung Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of 19 people who live in Kaoh Krabei village in Kandal province. Mrs. Suosdei M. is the village bank president selected by the other members, who will use their loan in different ways. She is 50 years old. She is a flower and banana seller in the local market, where she earns little money to support her family because she does not have enough capital to invest. So to improve this business, Mrs. Suosdei M. is asking for a loan to buy more bananas to resell. 

Her husband, Mr. Saroeurn Dy, is a chef. She is the mother of seven children, four of whom are chefs and help her to sell flowers and bananas, while the others are attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to resell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has one child, who is not in school. Jane has a business of selling charcoal, which she has had for two years. To help expand her business, Jane is requesting a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda, a Kiva partner. The loan will be used to buy more charcoal. Jane hopes that the loan will help her by allowing her to expand her business. In the future, Jane hopes to make her business international. About BRAC Uganda: This loan is administered by BRAC Uganda, a registered non-governmental organization (NGO) in Uganda that is also a part of the BRAC international network. BRAC Uganda attempts to address poverty through a holistic model, offering programs in education, health, water and sanitation, agriculture, and microfinance. BRAC Uganda’s microfinance program aims to provide the poor with easy, reliable and efficient access to institutional financial services, and reaches more than 150,000 families in Uganda. For more on BRAC Uganda, please see our partner page at http://www.kiva.org/partners/65, and join our lending team, Friends of BRAC Uganda, at http://www.kiva.org/team/friends_of_brac_uganda

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Fight For Progress Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Fight for Progress” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. This is not the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. However, with the help of this new loan, they will be able to further expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Alimamy K.. Alimamy is now age twenty-eight; he was born in Magburaka town where he lives with his wife and one child. Alimamy’s wife is a businesswoman and his child is still not of school-going age. 

For four years now, Alimamy has been running an Internet café wherein he also does photocopying for a fee. Alimamy will use his share of this loan to expand his business. He will use it to buy some stationery, pay internet connection fees, etc.

loans.use: buy some stationery, pay internet connection fees, etc.

loans.name: Hernestina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “PATRON DE SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Santiago, perteneciente a la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

La socia es  la Sra. Hernestina;  Ella tiene 44 años de edad,  es madre soltera  y  tiene 1 hijo, se dedica al comercio minorista, la socia compra al por mayor fruta y vende en el mercado central en la sección de frutas.  Ella también vende verduras pero por medio de su hija.  La socia solicita el préstamo para  invertir en la compra de frutas y verduras de los proveedores.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “PATRON DE SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO” communal bank. This bank is located in the Santiago district, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco. Her name is Hernestina, and she is 44 years old. She is a single mother with 1 child. Her work is in trade, buying and selling fruit wholesale, and also selling it in the fruit section of the central market. She also sells vegetables but through her daughter. She is requesting the loan to invest in buying merchandise. The borrower appreciates and values the loan, and accordingly she is committed to making her payments in a disciplined manner according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in buying merchandise

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Qorimankacha”; El banco  está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marina; ella tiene 53 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, juguetes y regalos en forma independiente, ella lleva a diferentes tiendas y también a sus amigos para poder venderlos, la socia quiere tener una tienda para vender la ropa que trae de diferentes lugares como Bolivia, Tacna y Lima. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería, ella compra pantalones, polos, blusas y juguetes.

 La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Marina, 53, is married and has three children. She’s a member of the “Qorimankacha” communal bank located in Wanchaq district, Cusco province, Cusco department. She combines her household chores with the sales of clothes, gifts and toys. She takes her wares to various stores to sell and also to friends. She’d like to have a store of her own to sell the clothes that she brings from various places like Bolivia, Tacna and Lima. She is asking for funds to buy merchandise; she will buy pants, polo-type shirts, blouses and toys. She uses this forum to thank all those who form part of her dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise like: pants, polo-type shirts, blouses and toys.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La señora Lucila S. Ortiz vive en la ciudad de Carapeguá, tiene 26 años, es casada con 2 hijos menores.
La señora Lucila S. montó una despensa  la cual tiene una antigüedad de 6 años; ubicada en el barrio San Vicente de la misma ciudad;  cuenta con casa propia.
Su cónyuge se dedica a la reparación de embarcación, y apoya con sus ingresos a la canasta familiar.
El crédito otorgado será de gran ayuda para acrecentar su despensa teniendo en cuenta la demanda existente en los meses venideros. El crédito destinrá a la compra de productos empaquetados, enlatados, verduras, carnes, aceites y articulos de limpieza, bazar, bebidas, etc. al por mayor 
Agradece a Fundación Paraguaya por el préstamo otorgado y afirma tener muchos emprendimientos para más adelante y seguir trabajando con nosotros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucila S. Ortiz, 26, lives in the city of Carapeguá. She’s married and has two minor children. She set up grocery store six years ago in Carapeguá’s San Vicente neighborhood. She owns her house. Her spouse is a boat repairman and his earnings help meet household expenses. The loan will be of great use to increase stock keeping in mind the increased demand that will occur in the coming months. The loan will be used to buy packaged items, canned goods, vegetables, meats, cooking oil, cleaning supplies, kitchenware, beverages, etc. at wholesale. She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the loan granted and states that she has several enterprises planned for the future and intends to continue collaborating with us.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy packaged products, canned goods, vegetables, meats, cooking oil, cleaning supplies, kitchenware, beverages, etc. at wholesale.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es una madre de familia de 51 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo en el caserío Fanupe Casa Blanca del distrito de Mórrope, una zona rural del distrito de Lambayeque, se encuentra situado a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de desayunos y almuerzos en un pequeño establecimiento situado en su domicilio. Su casa se encuentra situada frente al paradero de autos y mototaxis que se dirigen hacia las diversas zonas aledañas y esto le permite ofrecer sus productos a los transportistas y transeúntes que suelen visitar la zona. Adicionalmente suele vender salchipollos en su carrito sanguchero por las noches.

Yolanda desea adquirir calaminas (material para techar viviendas) para poder reforzar el techo de su vivienda, así como algunas sillas y mesas para implementar su negocio. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Yolanda es una mujer tranquila y responsable. El negocio que tiene le permite sentirse activa y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su familia. En la zona las personas que le conoce le quieren y estiman mucho.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 51 years old and a mother who lives with her husband in a farmhouse called Fanupe Casa Blanca in the Mórrope district, in a rural area of the  Lambayeque district. It is located an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

She sells breakfast and lunch in a small establishment located in her home. Her house is in front of the whereabouts of cars and motorcycle taxis that go to various surrounding areas and this allows her to offer her products to carriers and bystanders who often visit the area. In addition, she also sells salchipollos in a vending cart at night. 

Yolanda wants to purchase "calaminas" (material for roofing houses) to reinforce the roof of her house and also some tables and chairs for her business. Because of this she has decided to apply for a loan of 1000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help her to achieve her goal. 

Yolanda is a quiet and responsible woman. This business allows her to be active and help her husband with family expenses. People in the area who know her love her and think highly of her.

loans.use: Purchase of furniture for expanding business selling food.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta P. is a single woman who lives in Brgy. Himaya, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  Guava jelly production and a pig fattening business. Violeta joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Violeta has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5000, uplifting the family's standard of living. 

This time, for her 17th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to buy feeds for her pigs and ingredients for her guava jelly-making business so that she could continue to save up for future improvements of her business. Violeta P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund the operations of Food Products

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane, age 24, owns a sari-sari (variety) shop where she sells such items as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, instant noodles, and snacks. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. She and her husband have one small child and live in the village of Lilingayon, Valencia City, Bukidnon. 
  
Earlier this year, Mary Jane joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell in her shop. Mary Jane is requesting a second loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and employed as working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Mr. Aun Chhorn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The ten people who make up this village bank loan group live in Kampong Pou village in Takeo province. They will use their portion of the loan in various ways to support their family's. All the members have selected Mr. Aun C. as the village bank president. He was born in 1954. 
 
Mr. Aun C. and his wife, Mrs. Yen Yung, are farmers who own a one-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell and support their family. His problem is that his rice field has infurtile soil. So to improve production, Mr. Aun C. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer. He is a father of two children who all are employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: James Ndirangu

texts.en:
James has operated a transport business for one year in Naivasha town. He is 38 years old, married to Beth Wambui and they have four children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan. He paid his first loan of Kshs 64,800 well and in good time. He plans to diversify his sources of income so he will use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow and sell the milk locally.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nub

texts.en: Nub K. is 46 years old, married, and has three children.  She and her family live in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area knows for pre-ankorean temples.  K. sells food and coffee, earning $6 per day. She is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase more food to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. The family has to spend $30 on food, $15 on electricity supply, and $30 on other necessary expenses every month. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To purchase food to sell

loans.name: Roxana Katherine

texts.es:
Roxana Katherine V. M. tiene 19 años, es soltera, y vive con sus padres en el cantón de Babahoyo en la provincia de Los Ríos. 

Roxana Katherine es miembro de la ventanilla rural Unidos Somos Más. Esta nueva ventanilla hace parte de la comunidad Matilde Esther en la provincia de Guayas. Esta comunidad esta ubicada a 2 horas de la oficina de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. El grupo cuenta con 23 socios y se dedican a diferentes actividades como agricultura, cría de ganados y pequeños restaurantes y comedores.   

Roxana Katherine se dedica a quehaceres domésticos. Ella solicita el crédito para su propio negocio. El crédito incrementaría sus ingresos. 

Para el futuro la meta de Roxana Katherine es aumentar su negocio y tener buenos ingresos para su familia. El mayor desafío para ella y su familia es no tener suficiente dinero. 

Los hobbies de Roxana Katherine son leer y disfrutar las fiestas de patronales de su cantón.
texts.en:
Roxana Katherine V. M. is 19 years old.  She is single and lives with her parents in Babahoyo canton, in Los Ríos province.

Roxana Katherine is a member of the 'Unidos Somos Más' (United We Are Stronger) rural loan group.  This new group is located in the community of Matilde Esther, in Guayas province, 2 hours from our Chillanes office in Bolívar province.  The group has 23 members who work in different business activities such as farming, livestock raising and running small restaurants and eateries.

Roxana Katherine does household chores.  She is requesting this loan for her own business.  The loan will help to increase her income.  In the future, Roxana Katherine's goal is to increase her business and to have good income for her family.  The biggest challenge she and her family face is not having enough money.  Roxana Katherine's hobbies are reading and taking part in the local fiestas in her canton.

loans.use: Own business

loans.name: Edreda

texts.en: Edreda is fifty-one years old, a single mother of six children, living in her own permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a retail shop and a bar and has been running it for four years after farming. Her dream is to own a wholesale shop and her hardship is limited capital. Edreda needs the loan to buy sugar, salt, and rice for resale.

loans.use: Buying sugar, salt, and rice for resale

loans.name: Bodesmus

texts.en:
Bodesmus is a farmer from Kitale, in western Kenya. He has been farming for six years and his main products are milk, beans and maize, which are all sold locally. He also earns income from his hotel business in the same region. Bodesmus is 33 years old and married with 2 children, ages 2 and 12. 

Bodesmus has requested a loan of 31,200 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that this acquisition will guarantee his family enough milk for domestic consumption and sale. He plans to acquire 3 quality dairy cows in the next 5 years to improve his milk production.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Ana Viviana

texts.es:
Ana Viviana de 24 años vende calzado y ella necesita comprar al por mayor, pues quiere vender estos productos a un mejor precio que su competencia  y con este sistema de compra podrá ofrecer una   opción superior a sus clientes;  esta es la razón por la cual acude a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo pues quiere acceder a un crekiva, porque va a hacer esta inversión, que proyecta ser exitosa pues su venta está asegurada en pedidos de calzado colegial y además competirá con unos muy buenos precios en el mercado. 
Ana  inició su negocio en el año 2010 pues antes trabajó como empleada en diversos almacenes y allí tomó toda su experiencia emprendedora y en el manejo del mercado.  Su negocio está situado cerca a un centro comercial de gran tamaño en el sur de Barranquilla y muy cerca a uno de los escenario de futbol profesional mas importantes de Colombia, allí Ana vende sandalias, chancletas plásticas en diferentes modelos y estilos, formales e informales, su horario de permanencia en el negocio es de 8:00 am a 8:00 Pm todos los días, sus principales clientes son las personas que tranansitan por este lugar, conocidos  y jóvenes estudiantes que constantemente concurren a hacer compras, recibir clases o a practicar deportes.   Aunque su principal desafío es la competencia, ella se sostiene con buenos precios y una excelente servicio al cliente. Su meta más próxima es formalizar su negocio y también tener   su propia casa. Su persistencia en el trabajo es su gran fortaleza y desde su trabajo proyecta su crecimiento personal y familiar porque con su cónyuge, están haciendo todos los esfuerzos  para que su hija de dos años tenga un futuro exitoso.
texts.en:
Ana Viviana, age 24, sells footwear.  She needs to buy wholesale because she wants to sell these products at a better price than her competition.  With this sales system she will be able to offer her customers a better option.  

That is the reason that she comes to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo; she wants to gain access to a Kiva loan.  She will make this investment, which she plans to be successful.  Her sales are assured because of the orders for school footwear.  Also, she will be competitive with the very good prices in the market.

Ana started her business in the year 2010.  Before that she was an employee with different stores.  That is where she got all of her entrepreneurial experience and experience in handling the market.  Her business is located close to a very large commercial center in the southern part of Barranquilla.  It is very close to one of the most important venues for professional soccer in Colombia.

Ana sells sandals and plastic flip flops in different patterns and styles, both formal and informal.  Her schedule for working in her business is from 8:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. every day.  Her main customers are the people who travel through the area, acquaintances, and young students who always come shopping, for classes, or to practice sports.

Even though her main challenge is the competition, she maintains good prices and excellent customer service.  Her next goal is to formalize her business and to also have her own house.  Her persistence in her business is her great strength.  Through her work she plans her personal and family growth.   She and her husband are making every effort for their two year old daughter to have a successful future.

loans.use: To buy footwear

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Flora; la socia tiene 42 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias realizando el lavado de ropa ella trabaja de acuerdo a sus clientes que le solicitan a la vez la socia cuenta con un carrito que ofrece el servicio de taxi siendo su esposo quien maneja este carrito y ella administra, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su carro y para comprar algunos accesorios que necesita.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This is Sra. Flora. She is 42 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children. Flora divides her time between her daily activities and providing laundry services based on her customers’ requests. She owns a compact car that her husband drives for providing taxi services. Flora is a cheerful person who is eager to move forward. She is requesting a loan to maintain her vehicle and buy some necessary accessories.

Flora is happy to receive this loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: Pay for vehicle maintenance & purchase accessories for her taxi

loans.name: Sypaada's Group

texts.ru:
Сыпаада Жаманакова, 19, молодой лидер этой группы. В отличии от многих своих сверстников, она всегда точно знала чем она будет заниматься в жизни. В выборе профессии Сыпаада руководствовалась не престижем и востребованностью профессии, а тем , к чему у нее настоящая склонность и от чего она получает удовольствие. Этим занятием стало парикмахерское дело. В 17 лет Сыпаада закончила курсы обучения имиджмейкерства и парикмахерских услуг. Два года работы у опытных специалистов в столице помогло ей по возвращении в родной город Токтогул поделиться своими навыками с коллегами. Многочасовая ежедневная работа повысила привлечение клиентов. Таким образом ежемесячная прибыль для Сапаады составляет 10 000 сомов. Чем больше услуг предлагает парикмахерская, тем больше затрат она требует. Основные затраты включают оборудование, инструменты и косметические средства. Сыпаада планирует потратить этот кредит именно на приобретение дополнительных приборов для салона. Ее большая мечта – открыть свой салон красоты с высококачественным обслуживанием. 


        --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.
texts.en:
Sypaada J. is 19 years old, a young leader of this group. Unlike many of her peers she always knew exactly what she wants to do in life. When she chose her profession Sypaada was not driven by prestige or the demand of the profession, but rather by what she had a real aptitude for and what gave her gratification. She became a hairdresser.

When she was seventeen Sypaada finished a school of image making and hairdressing. Two years of working with experienced specialists in the country's capital helped her when she moved back to her home town of Toktogul to share her skills with her colleagues. Daily long hour shifts have increased her clientele base. Thus the monthly income for Sypaada is now 10000 soms. With more services offered in her salon there are more expenses. Most expenses include equipment, instruments and supplies. Sypaada plans to spend this loan mainly on buying additional instruments for the salon. Her biggest dream is to open her own beauty salon with highest quality service.

loans.use: to buy supplies for the hairdressing salon

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 40-year-old single woman living with one parent and two siblings. She is from Lebanon. She has owned a chocolate shop for three years. She makes different chocolate designs for all occasions such as weddings, newborns etc. She is very talented at her work. Her business is very essential because with its income, she helps support her family.
  
Today, she is requesting to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional products needed for her business. In that way, she will be able to create new original designs which will result in attracting more customers. She is very optimistic about her future plans and willing to more expand her business operation. This will be her third Kiva loan.

loans.use: to purchase additional products.

loans.name: Isata M

texts.en:
This is 35 year-old Isata J., who is married and has four children aged 4, 7, 9, and 15 years. In 2001, Isata established her imported assorted foodstuff business in order to generate income and help her husband provide for their family. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 350,000 every month from this business.

She is now requesting a loan of Le 4,000,000 to buy more imported foodstuffs for her enterprise. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 400,000. In the future, Isata plans to buy larger quantities to supply other traders, open another food stall, and generate enough income to educate her children to the university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy various imported foodstuffs for her business.

loans.name: Bonifrida

texts.en: Bonifrida is 26 years old. She has 2 children who are 6 and 4 years old. Bonifrida owns a general store where she sells cooking oil, Vaseline, salt, soap, etc.. She works together with her husband. They have been running this business for the past 7 years. She is requesting a loan to buy more cooking oil, Vaseline, salt etc. She plans to save all her profits and use them to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items for her general store

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzame is a single woman who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has owned a school where children from the neighboring village are her students. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments by parents who have enrolled their children and have not paid school fees. She dreams of expanding her school in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase school chairs and tables. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase school chairs and tables.

loans.name: Gbenonkpo Dedokpo Group

texts.fr: GBENONKPO DEDOKPO est un groupe de deux personnes, dont les membres habitent dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Véronique (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est née en 1978 au Bénin. Mariée et mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés, Véronique vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Véronique assure avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Il y a près de vingt ans que Véronique fait le commerce du charbon de bois au Bénin. Cette activité l'aide en effet à subvenir à ses besoins, tout en assurant les besoins de ses enfants. C’est la deuxième fois que Véronique et son groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Véronique  ambitionne dans l'avenir construire sa propre maison.
texts.en: The "Gbenonkpo Dedokpo"  group is composed of two individuals living in the same neighborhood in Benin. The group’s representative, Veronique (raising her hadn in the photo) was born in Benin in 1978. Married and the mother of two children, both in school, Veronique lvies together with her husband and children. Veronique and her husband jointly provide for various family needs. For almost 20 years, Veronique has been selling charcoal. This business activity helps her to support herself and her children. This is the second time that Veronique and her group is seeking financing from ALIDe in order to bolster their working capital and better meet customer demand. Veronique’s goal for the future is to have her own house built.

loans.use: to buy five bags of charcoal

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José de 23 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijo en su casa propia que solo cuenta con servicio de luz, esta ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Estas zonas se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

La actividad que desarrolla José  es la crianza y venta de ganado ovino, desde hace unos años el lugar donde cría  sus animales es la parte posterior de la casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada  y granos naturales, una vez que tengan el tamaño y el peso ideal los oferta en los distintos mercados, ya que cuenta con su propia clientela en la ciudad de Piura. Adicionalmente, José cuenta con una mototaxi que la trabaja para tener más ingresos.  Esto le permite obtener mayores ganancias para cubrir sus gastos diarios. 

José solicita un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1200 nuevos soles para comprar el alimento para sus animales, lo que le permitirá tenerlos bien alimentados  para ofertarlos a un mejor precio.  José es una persona muy conocida en el lugar donde vive porque siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de los suyos.

José tiene muchos deseos de  brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
José is 23 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and child. The only service he receives is electricity. José resides in the District of Tambogrande, which is part of the Department of Piura. This area is known for agriculture, livestock breeding, and handicrafts.

José has been raising and selling sheep for a few years. The animals are kept in an area behind his house. Their diet consists of balanced feed and natural grasses. Once the animals have reached the ideal size and weight, José offers them for sale at different markets. He has his own customers in the city of Piura. In addition, José drives a motorcycle taxi to earn more income to help with covering daily expenses.

He is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1200 PEN in order to buy feed for his animals. This will allow him to provide a good diet for his animals so that he can offer them at a better price. José is a person who is well-known in the place where he lives because he is always concerned about the welfare of others. What he desires most is to provide his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase feed for his animals.

loans.name: Yawoavi

texts.fr: Patronne d’un salon de coiffure (GOD IS WINNER), Yawoavi a 34ans et maman d’01 enfant. Elle désire satisfaire ses clientes en leur vendant des mèches pour les rendre encore plus belle. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Lomé et revend dans son salon. C’est une ancienne cliente de WAGES et elle est à son cinquième prêt. Son mari est gendarme et ils ont un enfant.
texts.en: The owner of a hair salon (GOD IS WINNER), Yawoavi is a 34-year-old mother of one child. She would like to satisfy her customers by selling them hair extensions for making them even more beautiful. She gets her supplies at the Lomé market and resells them in her salon. Yawoavi is a previous client of WAGES and is now on her fifth loan. Her husband is a policeman, and they have one child.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and weaves

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 32 years old, married, and they have two children aged seven and three. He operates a motorcycle transport service business at a local market in Kakamega. He has been in this business for two years now. He says the business is profitable and the only major challenge he has is the high cost of fuel.
