Francis plans to use this loan to purchase another motorcycle to expand his business. In the future, he hopes to grow his business and own a fleet of motorcycles. He also has hopes of giving a quality education to his children. He describes himself as a focused person.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Pov is working in a restaurant. Her husband is an electric mechanic; their income is $10 per day. She has two children, 5 and 1 year old. Every month, she has to spend $75 on food, $11 on electricity, $10 on school fees and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 for repairing her house. Her house is getting flooded, so she needs to repair it; otherwise, she could not have a proper place to stay with her family. Before her family used to sell fish, but she could earn so little income with her husband, she tried to find another job to do. Her current job can make quite a good income. In the future, she wants to get a small shop to sell grocery goods at home.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Freddy Alberto

texts.es:
En municipio de Managua, el señor Freddy Alberto  se dedica   a laborar como recibidor y entregador en una institución del estado, dedicándose a esta labor desde hace seis años. Es soltero y con unas personas a su cargo que le proporciona las condiciones necesarias a su familia. 

El señor Freddy Alberto ha acudido a ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para mejorar la condición de su vivienda en la compra de materiales de construcción tale como bloque, cemento, arena, y pago de mano de obra, para levantar  muro de frente para darle seguridad a su vivienda, por medio de esta obra brindarle mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, Sr. Freddy Alberto works in the shipping and receiving department of a state institution. He has been in this job for six years. Freddy is single, but he has family that he is responsible for, so he has to provide for their needs.

He approached CEPRODEL in order to request a home improvement loan. Freddy will buy construction materials such as blocks, cement, sand, as well as pay for labor. He will build a front wall to provide security for his home and better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to pay for materials and labor in order to build a security wall.

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en: Phoebe is 50 years old and married with seven children. With three children in school, Phoebe works very hard to provide for them. Phoebe buys and sells charcoal in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 19,500 Philippine pesos through NWTF to purchase additional stock of charcoal to sell. Phoebe has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Phoebe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Mirzomahmad

texts.ru: Мирзомахмад проживает в районе Хуросон. Ему 42 года. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Его жена занимается торговлей одежды на рынке. Сам он тоже занимается торговлей. Он в основном продает продукты питания. В этой области он 15 лет. Мирзомахмад имеет высшее образование, бухгалтер. По профессии проработал 6 лет. Он берет кредит для покупки сахара, масла, муки, натуральных соков и мороженного.
texts.en: Mirzomahmad lives in the Khuroson district.  He is 42 years old, married and has five children.  His wife is involved in sales of clothing at the market.  Mirzomahmad is also involved in sales.  He primarily sells food products and has been in this business for 15 years.  Mirzomahmad has a higher education as an accountant.  He spent six years working in that field.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of sugar, oil, flour, natural juices and ice-cream.

loans.use: to buy sugar, oil, flour, natural juices and ice-cream

loans.name: Eudosia

texts.es: Eudoxia, de 30 años, es una mujer sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Abrahán de 33 años y sus 02 queridos hijos Giuliana de 12 y Frans de 08 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Trabajando arduamente, Eudosia ha logrado que sus chacras le brinden los productos necesarios, para mantener a su familia. Antes que el sol deje ver sus primeros rayos, sale de su casa y camina cerca de una hora para llegar a sus tierras, donde tiene sembrado plantas de cacao, café y árboles maderables, productos que posteriormente lleva a vender a distintos acopiadores. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, ya que siente que les da un buen uso. Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que los costales que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para incrementar sus ingresos. Este será su sexto crédito con MFP, está muy feliz de seguir accediendo su crédito y quiere agradecer a todas las personas que harán posible que obtenga el dinero que necesita. Con el dinero contratará jornaleros para que aren la tierra.
texts.en:
Eudosia, 30, is an unassuming, hardworking woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband, Abrahán, 33, and their two beloved children, Giuliana, 12, and Frans, 8, who are the motivating force behind all her efforts.  

Working hard, Eudosia has managed that her fields produce the necessary products to support her family.  Before the first sun’s rays appear she leaves her house and walks nearly an hour to reach her fields where she has cocoa beans, coffee and hardwood trees planted - products that she subsequently takes to various gathering sites.  

What she most likes about her work is cultivating her fields because she feels she’s putting them to good use.  She’s been in this activity for 10 years and considers the most difficult part having to transport her products because the sacks she carries are very heavy and they tire her out quite a bit.  In time, she’d like to buy more land to increase income.

This will be her sixth MFP loan.  She is very happy to continue to access credit and wants to thank all the people who will make it possible for her to obtain the money she needs.  She will use the money to hire day laborers to till the soil.

loans.use: to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a hardworking business woman aged 25. She is married and blessed with two children. For the last two years, she has been managing a salon to earn a living. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business.

She is requesting a loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings to buy hair chemicals and braids.

loans.use: to buy hair chemicals and braids

loans.name: Miguel Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Miguel Carlos es casado, tiene 21 años de edad, cursó los 4 años de educación primaria, aun no tiene hijos, se dedica a la fabricación de zapatos, inició este trabajo como empleados para otro negocio y ahora con su propio negocio lleva 2 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo para utilizarlo para la compra de una maquina pegadora ya que de esa forma mejorará su productividad y por lo que puede mejorar sus ganancia, espera en el futuro tener un negocio grande.
texts.en:
21-year old Señor Miguel Carlos has four years of primary education. He doesn’t have any children yet. He earns his living making shoes. He started out as an assistant in another business and now has had his own shoe-making business for two years.

Miguel is seeking a loan to buy a sewing machine so he can improve productivity. This will lead in turn to more earnings. In the future he hopes to have a large business.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Kelvin David

texts.es:
El Señor. Kelvin es socio del banco comunal El Ahorro, vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, cuenta con una gran belleza natural y cultural, su amplia gastronomía cautiva el paladar de sus visitantes, su gente es amble, cordial y carismática, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

El Señor. Kelvin tiene 21 años de edad, vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo de un año y seis meses. Su esposa se dedica al comercio, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus suegros con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar.

Él se dedica al comercio, vende variedad de productos como ollas, cucharas, jarros, etc., se dedica a esta actividad desde que tenía 12 años y aprendió este oficio que era de su padre, trabaja ambulantemente todos los días sin un horario fijo.
 
En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 4 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de  cucharas, jarros, ollas, etc. para incrementar su mercadería.

Su meta es comprarse un vehículo para el negocio.
texts.en:
Kelvin is a member of the 'El Ahorro' community bank and lives on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca.  This is a cold-climate area which has great natural and cultural beauty.  It has a wide-ranging cuisine which delights visitors' palates.  The people are kind, friendly and charismatic.  They still maintain the culture and traditions of their villages.

Kelvin is 21 years old, lives with his partner, and has an 18-month-old child.  His wife is a saleswoman.  They do not own their own home but live in his in-laws' house, sharing the household expenses.

Kelvin is a salesman.  He sells a variety of products such as pans, spoons, pitchers, etc.  He has been in this business since he was 12 years old and learned the trade from his father.  He works as an itinerant vendor every day and does not work regular hours.

Kelvin has been a member of his community bank for four years and he will invest his new loan in buying spoons, pitchers, pans, etc. to increase his stock of merchandise.  His goal is to buy a vehicle for his business.

loans.use: to buy spoons, pitchers, pans, etc.

loans.name: Raga

texts.en:
Raga is married and has four children. She is 42 years old and resides in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. 

Raga operates a business venture in fish-selling in her barangay (village) to earn a living. She has been in this business for more than 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 6,000 doing this type of work. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to purchase new equipment and tools.

Raga has been a member of GDMPC for nearly one year. Raga's plan is to finish the studies of her children and to gain double income from her business.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment and tools.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
El señor Juan tiene 57 años de edad, esta acompañado con dos hijos.

Él aprendo los trabajos de la agricultura, desde los 14 años de edad. Fue su padre quien le enseño, ya que era esta la manera en que se ganaban la vida.

Don Juan compra los insumos agrícolas en una ciudad del oriente del país, para esto el debe caminar a pie durante treinta minutos hasta llegar a la calle pavimentada, donde aborda un vehiculo (pick up) durante cuarenta minutos hasta llegar al lugar donde compra los insumos agrícolas.

Don Juan esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar 12 sacos de abono, 80 libras de semilla, 15 litros de insecticidas, entre otros insumos para sembrar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz bajo riego  por gravedad (sistema a través del cual se dispersa el agua para regar los cultivo, sin usar dispositivos solo por la gravedad, se busca una pendiente para derramar el agua y que esta busque su cause, atravesando todo el cultivo).

Al comprar los insumos de una sola vez, don Juan estará seguro de dar a sus cultivos un manejo adecuado y a tiempo; esto permitirá que su producción aumente y también sus ingresos,  asegurando la alimentación de su familia y cancelar su préstamo a tiempo.

Don Juan espera proporcionarles el estudio a sus hijos, para que ellos estudien en la universidad y puedan graduarse.
texts.en:
Señor Juan is 57 years old and has 2 children.

He learned how to farm when he was 14 years old. He was taught by his father who made a living by farming.

Don Juan buys his consumables in a city to the west of the country. To get there he has to walk for 30 minutes to get to the paved highway where he boards a pick-up and travels 40 minutes to get to where he buys his agricultural supplies. 

Don Juan is asking Fundacion Campo for a loan to buy 12 sacks of manure, 80lbs of seed, 15 litres of insecticide and other items to allow him to sow 14,000 square metres of corn with a gravity watering system ( a watering system which disperses water to the crops without storage tanks using only gravity, as the water seeks to flow downhill naturally and so waters the entire crop).

By buying the items at the same time, Don Juan will be certain of providing his crops with adequate and timely care. This will give him a bigger yield and income and guarantee his being able to provide food for his family and make the repayment of his loan on time.

Don Juan hopes to provide his children with an education so that they are able to attend university and graduate.

loans.use: to buy 12 sacks of manure, 80lbs of seed, 15 litres of insecticide and other consumables.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
Alejandro is 27 years old and a married man with one child. He lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with his family.

Alejandro has been engaged in seaweed farming for two years. He also sells fish to add to his income.

Alejandro has requested this 4,000 PHP loan to purchase seaweed seedlings, straw and wooden poles necessary for seaweed farming. He hopes to buy a fishing boat and start his own fishing business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings, straw line and wooden poles.

loans.name: Nicanor

texts.es: Nicanor de 33 años casado con julia de 33 años, que fruto de esta relación tienen 3 hijos, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Monterrico del distrito de Sivia. Cuando Las necesidades se hicieron constantes en la vida de Nicanor desde el momento que contrajo matrimonio con su adorada julia ellos aún no contaban con ningún bien, menos tenían suficiente economía, es donde ambos decidieron trabajar con el único fin de ver crecer su estatus familiar, al principio trabajaron de peones en las tierras de cultivo de sus vecinos sembrando y cosechando café, que después de un tiempo tuvieron su primer hijo quien les lleno de satisfacción y las ganas de seguir trabajando con més entusiasmo. De un tiempo adquirió un pequeño capital que le sirvió para comprarse una pequeña parcela de terreno agrícola donde ahora se dedican juntamente con su esposa en el cultivo de café y árboles maderables, ellos están contento con los logros que vienen obteniendo. Este será su tercer credito con MFP, por el que se compromete en cancelar puntualmente su tercera cuota. Con los 500 nuevos soles Nicanor comprará abono orgánico para fertilizar su campo agrícola de café
texts.en: Nicanor is 33 years old, married with Julia, has three children, and they all live in their own home in the Monterrico community, Sivia district. When his needs became constant after marrying his beloved Julia they had no resources to count on. They did not have enough money either and decided to begin working in order to improve their family's conditions. First they began working as farmers in neighbor's crops sewing and growing coffee beans. Soon after, they had their first child who brought them much satisfaction and a stronger enthusiasm to continue working. At one time he was able to have the funds to buy a small plot of land where he and his wife now grow coffee beans and timber-yielding trees. They are happy with the achievements they are accomplishing. This will be their third loan with MFP with which he commits to punctually cancelling his third payment. Nicanor will use the 500 Peruvian Soles loan to buy organic fertilizer for his coffee bean crops.

loans.use: buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Kwayedza Group

texts.en:
This is 57-year-old Entineth from Machipisa, a high-density surbub in Harare, the capital of Zimbabwe. She is a single mother of two children.

Entineth runs a business of selling clothes that she buys from local shops as well as from Zambia. The business has been in operation for three years. She says the main challenges she faces are low business activity due the mid-month and competition from established shops. 

Entineth has requested a loan of $400 to buy clothes for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve the welfare of her family. 

In the future Entineth plans to be operating a big and well-stocked clothing shop in the city center.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a hardworking and patient mother. She is 57 years old and has sent all three of her children to school. They are now living separately from her. Through the income from her retail business, she provided their allowances when they were still completing their studies. 

Lilia still generates income from her business and would like to keep improving it, so she is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy soft drinks, canned goods, shampoo, and vegetables to sell. She promise to pay her loan on time and use it well for further development of her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, shampoo, and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Batbileg

texts.en: Batbileg wants to assist his younger brother to pay his school fee. His younger brother Erdenbaatar studies as a human resource manager in Mongolian State University of Education. Erdenebaatar has a plan to establish his own human-resource agency which is a professional job. He needs to graduate from school successfully first. It is one of his biggest wishes and plans of life he said. Therefore, his good brother Batbileg is taking a loan to assist his younger brother in paying his school fees so he can successfully graduate.

loans.use: to assist his younger brother in paying his school fees

loans.name: Dieu Est Grand Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DIEU EST GRAND est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier et mènent leurs activités dans le même marché. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Pierrette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Pierrette est âgée de 38 ans et vit au Bénin. Pierrette n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pierrette est mariée à un tailleur du nom de Gilbert. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Pierrette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants.  Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Afin d‘assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Pierrette vend depuis huit ans, des friperies dans un marché du Bénin. Pierrette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Pierrette sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DIEU EST GRAND, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers crédits ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
DIEU EST GRAND Group is made up of three persons who live in the same neighborhood and run their businesses at the same marketplace. This is the third time that the members of the group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their businesses.

The group's representative, named Pierrette, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. She's 38 years old, lives in Benin, and is married to a tailor named Gilbert. The couple has three school-attending children to support.

Pierrette lives together with her husband and children. The couple covers the various household expenses together. Pierrette never attended school. In order to cover the various family expenses, she's been selling secondhand clothing in one of Benin's markets for eight years.

She gets her supplies in one of Benin's markets. Eager to satisfy her customers and to increase her revenue and income, Pierrette, together with the other members of the group is seeking a third loan from ALIDé. The first two loans were repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing

loans.name: La Chilana Group

texts.en:
The members of La Chilana Group are the heads of the families living in that Mexican village, who have decided to improve their living conditions by accessing, for the first time, to a basic electricity service with the installation of Small Solar Home Systems (SSHS) in their houses. Funding is asked for financing the 53% of the cost of those SSHS, which will be paid back with the monthly fee that these farmers pay for maintenance services during the first year of operation.

Adela is the woman standing second from the left in the picture. She is a housewife of 35 years old, married, with 2 children of 14 and 12 years old. The SSHS installed in her home will provide all her family with an electricity service during the next 20 years, approximately, that allows them to have 4 additional hours of lighting to use in increasing their productivity, but especially Adela's children to do their homework.

loans.use: for paying PV systems installed in their houses.

loans.name: Noemi Del Rosario

texts.es:
Noemi, de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta primer grado, está casada, su esposo trabaja como albañil y son padres de tres jóvenes que están estudiando.

Noemi, tiene dos años de tener venta de productos básicos, este negocio decidió colocarlo porque solo su esposo era el que trabajaba y necesitaban más ingresos y fue por esa razón que decidió colocar una tienda y su horario es de 6 de la mañana a las 7 de la noche.

Noemi, necesita el préstamo para comprar frijoles, sodas, jugos, arroz, condimento, azúcar y jabón; el crédito le ayudará para surtir más su tienda.

Los sueños de Noemi son, que su negocio crezca y que sus hijos se prepare academicamente, para que en un futuro tengan mejores oportunidades.

loans.use: para comprar frijoles, sodas, jugos, arroz, condimento, azúcar y jabón; el crédito le ayudará para surtir más su tienda.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Susan would like to buy shares from the stock exchange market.

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.en:
My business is located near the public hospital in my country. Many people go to this hospital which helps me sell more in order to support my family. I now need to buy a greater variety of high-quality food so that I can increase my income even more.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi negocio esta ubicado cerca del hospital publico de mi pais, y es bastante las personas que lo visitan, lo que me ayuda a tener buenas ventas para apoyar a mi familia. Ahora necesito surtir mi negocio con producto de calidad, variado y bueno para poder mejorar mis ingresos aun mas.

loans.use: To buy candy, churros, water, soft drinks, and other food

loans.name: Vali

texts.en:
Vali has 4 years  of experience in this business . He is 51 years old and an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan ,Fizuli region, settled in Makhmudlu village,. He is married and  has 3 children.
Now he needs a loan of $950 to buy a cow.
He plans to produce milk, cheese and to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Kim-Heak

texts.en: Kim-heak was married in 1977 and has 3 children. She is currently in the business of planting and selling flowers in the village. She started this business in 1993. Her husband also farms in the village. He has a tractor and contracts himself out to prepare land for villagers from one village to the next, so that he can generate extra income for the family. She has borrowed loans from MAXIMA twice. The current loan amount is $1,000. She will use this loan to repair the house. She has the ability to repay the loan to MAXIMA.

loans.use: To repair the house.

loans.name: Betty Emerita

texts.en:
Mrs. Betty is 25 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in the district of la Peca, Province of Bagua, Department of Amazonas. She is a member of the Communal Bank of Las Bagüinas and sells fruits for a living. She started her own business in order to be in control of her own income and to improve her quality of life and that of her family. The business is growing more every day, which allows her to cover all the necessities for her and her family. In the future, she is aiming to acquire her own kiosk and she is working hard in order to accomplish that goal, so she can employ other people. With a recent loan for S/. 500.00 (Approximately US$160.00) obtained from Manuela Ramos, she will purchase a larger amount of fruits such as apples, grapes, peaches, pears, oranges in boxes and by the hundreds. She is also into the production of extract from NONI (fruit with healing attributes) among others. Her business requires her to be well supplied in order to satisfy the needs of her customers from the surrounding area, considering that she receives weekly purchasing orders from public organizations and from villagers from nearby districts.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Betty tiene 25 años, vive con su cónyuge y una hija en el distrito de La Peca, Provincia de Bagua, Departamento de Amazonas. Pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Bagüinas y se dedica a la venta de frutas, inició su negocio para manejar sus propios ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y su familia. El negocio esta creciendo cada vez más, lo cual le permite cubrir sus necesidades tanto de ella y de su familia. Para el futuro quiere tener un kiosco propio, para lo cual está trabajando bastante, y de esta manera llegar a cumplir su objetivo y así poder dar trabajo a otras personas. Con el reciente crédito recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 500.00 (US$ 160.00 aprox.) comprará más cantidad de frutas como manzanas, uvas, duraznos, peras, naranjas en cajas y cientos. También se dedica a la producción de extracto de NONI (fruta curativa) entre otros, ya que necesita tener su negocio bien surtido para atender a sus clientes de la misma localidad, pues tiene pedidos semanales de entidades publicas y de pobladores de los distritos aledaños.

loans.use: Buying fruits for wholesale.

loans.name: Thi Dung

texts.vi: Cô Dung trồng khá nhiều loại rau.Hàng ngày cô thường đi chợ bán rau, chồng cô đi làm thợ xây. Ngoài ra cô còn chăn nuôi thêm lợn, bò.Cô chưa từng vay  vốn ở đâu vì ngại thủ tục rườm rà.Tuy nhiên, khi có chương trình tài chính vi mô, cô đã vay để mua thêm 1 con bò. Hiện tại nhà cô có 5 con bò nái.Thu nhập hàng ngày từ rau , cô có thể hoàn trả dần, còn lại cô đầu tư vào nuôi bò và lợn.

loans.use: Having loans for poultry

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Mrs. Meas M., age 33, works selling grocery products at home, earning around $4 each day in revenue. Her husband is a teacher, earning around $4 each day. They have four students who are students. She would like to request a loan of $700 in order to purchase 15 piglets to raise and buy feed for her livestock supplies.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feed.

loans.name: Central A (I) Group

texts.en:
Christine is 48 years old and married with three children. She is a poultry farmer. She wants to use the extra profits to construct another poultry house, purchase more chicks and pay school fees for the children.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Amarilis Del Carmen

texts.en:
Amarilis has been a member of the “La Kantuta” community bank for two years. In the community bank, she has learned how to avoid sickness, the importance of punctuality and responsibility, and, above all, to save. Amarilis mentioned that she enjoys the bank meetings, particularly sharing ideas, experiences, and conversation.

Amarilis is 30 years old. She is married and has a two-year-old son. By profession, Amarilis is a teacher, but she currently sells clothing to friends and family. For the past two years, she has been traveling to the cities of Lima and Puno to buy the clothing, which she then sells in Ayacucho. In addition, Amarilis manages phone booths located in several areas around the city. She has had this business for eight months. She is also planning to open a chicken restaurant in a rented building near her home.

Amarilis needs a loan of 3000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy an oven, decorations, and tablecloths.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account that each associate has. Amarilis plans to use her savings to build her home. Her dream is to own a home, establish her businesses, have stability, and to raise her son with as much love as possible.

loans.use: Amarilis needs a loan of 3000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy an oven, decorations, and tablecloths.

loans.name: Parviz

texts.en: Parviz was born in 1975. He is married, and has 2 children, and has settled in Baku city in Azerbijan. Parviz is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory in the Agdam region of Azebaijan. Nine years ago he started a taxi businesss. Now he is requesting a loan of $600 to buy the spare parts to maintain the taxi.

loans.use: To buy the spare parts to maintain taxi

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is a forty-year-old married father of a three-year-old son. His wife is a seamstress. Eric has been selling auto parts of different kinds for over twelve years. He will use the loan proceeds to purchase more clutch disks and pressure plates from Canada and Korea. In Ghana there are no auto parts stores, but there is a high demand for parts as the taxi networks are the main transportation option. His stand operates in an area of Accra called Abossey-Okai that is a conglomeration of hundreds of entrepreneurs who each sell specific auto parts.

Eric hopes the loan proceeds help him increase his sales volume and profits so that he can continue saving for his son’s school fees.

Eric is a member of the lending group Respect. The lending group works as a type of social collateral where each member of the group applies pressure on other members to ensure repayment.

loans.use: Eric would like to buy more clutch disks and pressure plates for his store.

loans.name: Mirzonazir

texts.ru:
Mirzonazir Abdulazizovich N. lives in Abdurahmon Jomi district with his family. He is married and has two children. After finishing school, Mirzonazir started a business selling cattle. He buys calves, fattens them up and then sells them to butchers. He has been in this business for six years, and it brings him a modest income that allows him to feed his family. However, in order to increase his income, Mirzonazir needs a loan to buy a few more calves. He will fatten them up and sell them for meat, allowing him to provide the local markets with high quality meat. Mirzonazir plans to repay his loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Назаров Мирзоназир Абдулазизович живет в районе Абдурахмони Джоми.Проживает со своей семьей. Он женат и имеет 2 детей. Закончил школу и занялся бизнесом. Торгует бычками. Предварительно скупив , он их откармливает и продает мясникам на мясо. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже шесть лет. Эта деятельность приносит ему небольшой доход , который позволяет ему прокормить свою семью. Но для того . чтобы увеличить доход он хочет получить кредит и купить еще несколько молодых телят. Он их откормит и так же продаст на мясо, что позволит ему обеспечить рынки полноценным мясом. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy cattle to increase his number of head

loans.name: Marcelino Pascual

texts.es:
Mr. Marcelino has run a livestock business for many years which he has used to support his wife and three small children. Since he began his business, he has worked hard to use his earnings to sustain his home and his livestock business has helped him to achieve his goals.

Currently, he needs to purchase more livestock in order to grow his business. Intelligently, he is seeking a loan from Ceprodel in order to acquire additional animals to offer in his neighborhood of San Rafael del Sur in Managua.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

El caballero Marcelino se dedica desde hace varios años al negocio de ganadería con el cual alimenta a su familia compuesta por su cónyuge y tres pequeños hijos. Desde sus inicios en el negocio se ha esforzado para llevar siempre el sustento a su hogar y lo ha logrado gracias a sus múltiples esfuerzos en el trabajo ganadero.

Actualmente la necesidad que atraviesa el señor Marcelino es que le urge la compra del ganado para su respectiva comercialización. Es por esta razón que muy inteligentemente busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito con el cual adquirir los animales para luego ofrecerlos en su sector de habitación en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur en Managua.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Affiwavi Kafui

texts.fr:
Mrs. A. Affiwavi Kafui was born on March 27, 1981 in Agoè. She is married and has one child. She did not pursue a higher education, choosing instead to complete a course in secretarial computer services. In 2007 she opened a small business office, equipped with a computer, and started offering her secretarial services. This service is limited to word processing as her photocopier has broken down. This is Mrs. A.'s first loan and she is requesting it to purchase a new “Sharp” photocopier.

Translated from French by Dave Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 27mars 1981 à Agoè, madame A. Affiwavi Kafui est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle n’a pas fait de grandes études. Dès qu’elle abandonne les études elle a fait une formation en informatique bureautique. Ainsi elle a ouvert en 2007 un petit bureau équipé d’ordinateur qui lui permet de faire des prestations de services bureautiques. Cette prestation se limite essentiellement au traitement de texte car sa photocopieuse est tombée en panne. Ce premier crédit qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acquérir une nouvelle photocopieuse de marque sharp.

loans.use: Purchase of a Photocopier.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Fatou D., age 51, is a widow and the mother of 5 children, out of which she has to support four. She's been a member of the Manguiline Kadiamor village bank for 7 years. She wants to strengthen her business of transforming seafood. Fatou purchases shrimps in Pointe Saint-Georges, transform them, and resell them in Dakar. In doing so, she improves the living conditions of her family and support her four student children. She's seeking a loan that will be repaid after six months, in one single installment.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Fatou D., 51 ans est veuve et mère de 05 enfants dont 04 à sa charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Manguiline Kadiamor depuis7 ans. Elle veut renforcer son activité de transformation de produits halieutiques. Fatou achète des crevettes à la Pointe Saint George, les transforme elle même et les revend à Dakar pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et soutenir ses quatre enfants qui sont étudiants. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Transformation and reselling of seafood

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad, 49 years old, is married and has five children. He owns a home decoration shop in the city of Tripoli, Northern Lebanon. Ahmad sculpts beautiful wooden decorations for the home.

This is the first time Ahmad has requested a loan from Al Majmoua. He needs a loan of $US1,200 to purchase a new machine to sculpt wood and thereby improve his business.

loans.use: Purchase a new machine to sculpt the wood

loans.name: Leutu

texts.en: Leutu F., 41, is married with 2 children. She has many years of experience in a taro plantation business. She sells to the villagers 4 days per week. She has had 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 320 Tala (approximately 133 USD). SPBD loans are Leutu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her husband and children will do the farming.

loans.use: To purchase taro tubers, weed killer, pesticides, chemicals and a shovel

loans.name: Idowu

texts.en: Idowu is 36 years old and married to O., who is a roadside mechanic. They have five children. The family lives in Abulegba area of Lagos state, Nigeria. Idowu sells drinks and she has been in this business for the past three years. She buys drinks in crates and then sells through retail to her customers. Idowu needs the loan amount of 140,000 Naira to buy more crates of drinks to sell. Idowu says thank you to all Kiva lenders for putting smiles on the faces of people.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth has a gift shop near her home where she sells costumes, paper goods, and gift items. She began over ten years ago making costumes for school events. She has expanded her goods to included stationery and other products.

While Ruth initially began the business to help her husband provide for the family, she is now a widow and the store is her primary source of income. Her three children are now aged 20, 22, and 24. With the loan she hopes to buy additional items to sell for the Christmas season.

loans.use: additional items to sell for the Christmas season

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia es soltera, de 48 años de edad, tiene 2 hijas, una es profesional y la otra esta estudiando en la universidad; trabaja como conserje, alquila un pequeño cuarto para vivir con sus hijas, esta incerta en los proyectos del INVUR y la Alcaldia, y ha logrado la construccion de una vivienda, sin embargo no esta finalizada , está solicitando su credito numero 5 para poder comprar ventanas de metal y vidrio y anexar las berjas, en el futuro cuando su hija halla terminado sus estudios y encuentre un trabajo ayudara a su mamá a ampliar un poco mas la vivienda.  Antonia sueña con ver su casita con comodidades para sus hijas, pues es el patrimonio que les dejara.
texts.en:
Antonia is single, is 48, and has 2 daughters. One is a professional and one is studying in college. She works as a receptionist. She rents a small room to live in with her daughters, which is located in the INVUR and city projects. She has succeeded in having a home constructed, but it still isn't completed. She is requesting her fifth credit to purchase windows of metal and glass and to attach bars to them. In the future when her daughter has finished school and has found a job, she will help her mother expand the home a little more. Antonia dreams about seeing her home with comforts for her daughters since it is the inheritance that she will leave them.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of windows and bars

loans.name: Alba Esperanza

texts.es:
Doña Alba Esperanza G. P. tiene la edad de 61 años, su estado civil es soltera, Doña Alba no tiene hijos solo tiene 1 nieto a su cargo de la edad de 17 años y cursa el 4 año de secundaria, Doña Alba no tiene compañero de vida, los propósitos de Doña Alba son de mantener su negocio activo para que este le siga generando ingresos a pesar del incremento de la gasolina ya que tiene que recorrer las calles en busca de pasajeros los sueños de Doña Alba son de adquirir otra unidad de transporte para que su nieto lo administre y pueda obtener experiencia en este tipo de negocio y este sea otro medio de trabajo y así pueda mantenerse para el día de mañana sus deseos son  que  el nivel de vida del país mejore ya que la ayuda de muchos países donantes son importante ya que son los refuerzos de las personas que realmente lo necesitan.

La actividad económica son los servicios de taxi, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 4 años, Doña Alba inicia este negocio como una alternativa de generar ingresos y este servicio de taxi lo obtuvo al vender un negocio de granos básicos que poseía en el mercado del mayoreo en Managua conocido como el Bisne y por medio de los financiamientos que también fueron  necesarios para este negocio al principio Doña Alba no poseía muchos conocimientos de este tipo de negocio y así la persona quien se encargaba de prestarle los servicios como chofer le entregaba poco dinero y de esta forma no le proporcionaba ganancias y con el apoyo de su familia logran designar a una persona confiable para este cargo y es así que por medio del tiempo transcurrido alcanza la experiencia en este negocio pero todavía necesita un financiamiento propuesto para capital de trabajo para proporcionarle mejoras a la unidad de trabajo como seria el cambio de radiador, llantas entre otras cosas y reconoce la ayuda de la Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones amigas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alba Esperanza G. P. is a single, 61 years old woman. She has no children, just one nephew in her care that is 17 years old and in his 4th year of secondary school. Alba doesn't have a partner in life. Her purpose is to keep her business active so that it continues to earn her income in spite of the increase in the cost of gas, now that she has to go through the streets looking for passengers. Alba hopes to acquire another vehicle so that her nephew can manage it and get experience in this type of business. That way, he'll have another means of work so he can help himself in the days to come. She hopes that the quality of life in her country will improve, given that the help of other donor countries is so important, since it supports the people that really need it. Her main economic activity is providing taxi services, and it is located throughout the city. She has four years of experience at her work. Alba started this business as an alternative way of earning money. She got the taxi service by selling a business selling whole grains that she had in the wholesale market of Bisne in Managua and through other necessary financing arrangements. Alba didn't have a lot of knowledge about this type of business at first, so the person she hired as the driver turned in very little money and didn't distribute the earnings. With the help of her family, she managed to find a reliable person for this job. Over time, she has gained experience in the business, but she still needs the requested financing to fund the business so that she can make improvements to her vehicle, including changing the radiator, tires, and other things. She acknowledges the support of Fundación León 2000 and its sister organizations.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairs to her vehicle

loans.name: Lim's Group

texts.en:
This small loan group is made up of four members, all residents of Chong Kneas Commune, Siem Reap Province. Mrs. V. has been selected to be the group leader by the members. She is 24 years old and is married to Sat, who is also 24. The young couple makes a living by working as carriers at the fish market, and they can earn around US$ 3 per day. They currently have two children; they are both young. The family's living conditions are not so good because their house is broken frequently; thus, they both have decided to request a loan to repair their old house.

The other three borrowers are:

K. is a reserve worker and she needs a loan to purchase a motorcycle for family transport.

R. is a reserve worker, a widow, and she is requesting a loan to repair her old house.

P. is a reserve worker, a widow, and she is asking for a loan as capital to R. a new business as a grocery seller.

All four of the borrowers are working at the same place in their community.

loans.use: To repair their old house

loans.name: Chheoum

texts.en:
Chheoum S., 46, has business grinding rice crops and recharging batteries from her home in Siem Reap province. She is able to make $7 per day, while her husband, pictured here, earns $4 working as a construction foreman and renting music equipment. This couple has nine children, seven of whom are in school, while two are too young to attend.

Chhoeum S. would like to take out a loan to purchase a motorbike for her husband for commuting to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Nub

texts.en:
Nub S., 27, is a villager living in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, where he makes a living driving a motor taxi. He also earns additional income by working at the fish market. He is a very responsible man to his family and he especially makes sure his one young child gets the highest education and enough food. His wife currently works as a garment worker.

Nub S. has requested a loan of $1000 in order to buy a trailer to connect to his existing motorcycle to provide a taxi service (Tuk Tuk). He plans to use the remainder of the loan to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy a trailer and a plot of land

loans.name: Suitupe

texts.en: Suitupe L. T. 45, is married with five children.  She has five years of experience in the pork cake and popcorn business. She sells to school children and villagers five days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 125 Tala. SPBD loans are Suitupe’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase bag of flour, soya sauce , garlic onions , butter , pop corn , onions, plastic bags  and frying pan.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Сангинова Мавлуда кредитор в Микроинвест с 2002 года. Она  занимается продажей детской одежды. За товаром ездит сама, в город Истарашан. Свои кредиты погашает хорошо без проблем. Хотя замечает что торговля стала чуть медленнее. Поэтому Мавлуда получив очередной кредит хочет пополнить свой ассортимент новыми товарами. У Мавлуды остаток весенне- летнего товара осталось маловато. Она надеется , что при увеличении выбора товара у неё реализация пойдёт на рост , т.е. поток клиентов увеличится.
texts.en:
S. Mavluda is a client of MicroInvest since 2002. She is selling children's clothing. She travels for the merchandise herself to Istarashan. She pays off her loans without any problems. Although she has noticed that sales are lower now. This is why Mavluda wants to use this loan to add some new assortment to her inventory. She has a little bit of the spring-summer clothing left. She hopes that by increasing the variety and choice of her inventory she will sell it faster and the flow of customers will increase.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 33 years old and she has operated a typical village store for many years. She is married to German Laggui and they were blessed with 3 children; John Mark is 12 years old and in the first year high school, Jay Jay is 11 years old and in grade school, finally John Lloyd is 5 years old also attends grade school. They currently reside at Barangay Minanga Proper, Angadanan Isabela, a rural area, approximately 4 kilometers away from the national highway.
                                  
Jonalyn is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 20,000. Her daily gross income from the business is around PHP 2,100. Beverages are the most popular item in her village and will use the loan to satisfy her customers and able to improve her business. Jonalyn added that, “when you work hard, unexpectedly you will receive more blessings”.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional film and seeds

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen has been in the media and production business for over 10 years. In 2002 she moved to New York from Florida, where she grew up, to work as an editor and producer. She eventually became a freelancer and about two years ago, with a growing client base, she decided to establish a full-service media consulting and production company. Maureen enjoys her work and is dedicated to helping non-profit organizations use media to effectively disseminate their message. 

She heard the same response from many banks, which was that they couldn’t lend to a business of her size at this time. Given that she needed capital to sustain and to help grow her business, Maureen decided to look into microfinance options and so she came to ACCION USA. With her loan, Maureen is hiring a new employee to help grow the business’ client base. She will also use a portion of the loan to cover the costs associated with developing new partnerships with other media companies to initiate new projects. 

Maureen has established her business and created a loyal clientele that depends on her for their media needs. Her long-term vision for her business is to help expand her outreach to serve more non-profits.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Maureen from  United States

loans.use: Hiring a new employee and outreach

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Komi A. est un homme de 45 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants.il est conducteur de taxi à Avetonou, un village situé au sud-ouest du Togo. Komi souhaite avec ce crédit changer le moteur de sa voiture pour limiter les dépenses incessantes que lui cause sa voiture. Cette opportunité lui permettra de mieux répondre aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Komi A. is a 45 year old man, he is married and the father of 3 children. He is a taxi driver in Avetonou, a town located in southwest Togo. Komi hopes that with this loan he will replace the motor of his car, in order to limit the never ending expenses that are caused by his car. This opportunity will enable him to respond better to the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replace the motor of his car

loans.name: Vasiliy

texts.en:
Vasiliy is married with two grown-up children. He sells clothing and women's purses at the central market in Pavlograd city. He has been in this business for about three years. During this time, he has set up a first business location and started a second one. Vasiliy says that being self-employed gives him strong motivation to work hard. He enjoys his business and even has plans to start a third location.

Vasiliy would like to borrow 15,000 UAH to purchase a new collection of women's purses. He hopes to increase sales and invest money back into his business.

loans.use: To purchase women's purses

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en: Rachael sells tailoring materials and has been in this business for the past four years, on her own, after training for two years. In her locality she is the only one selling tailoring materials, hence the increasing demand. She is requesting for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. Rachael is 32 years old and married with two children. She says thank you,

loans.use: To purchase tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Nizami

texts.en:
Nizami is a scrap metal dealer. He is applying for his fourth loan from Komak, and this loan will be the second of his funded by Kiva lenders. (See the Kiva page for Nizami's first loan)

Nizami is enjoying his business. He needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy metals to further improve his business.

loans.use: To buy metal for a scrap metal shop.

loans.name: Zaryl's Group

texts.en:
The leader of the group, Zaryl, is fifty-three years old. Her parents used to breed livestock and Zaryl, from her early childhood, was familiar with this occupation. When she grew up, she got married and decided to continue in this activity of breeding livestock. She inherited her family’s occupation. For twenty years, she has been making a living in animal husbandry, raising livestock and selling milk products. Her spouse has been working as a gardener. They have two children: a daughter, 27, works in a pharmacy and a son, 7. Recently, Zaryl and her husband have made repairs to their house, built a shed and increased the total population of their livestock. Considering their monthly income of just $50, these are big achievements made. All this has been possible due to their cattle, which is their main active, as it is for anybody living in a village. Zaryl, wants to obtain a loan to buy cement and sand for building a jerry building and garage. In a very short time they are going to harvest the crops. They hope that they will be able to finish building before harvesting starts. 

Zaryl’s partners are: Venera, Gulzina and Orosulbu. Venera, 24, is married and has two little children. Together with her husband, she raises livestock. In addition, Venera sells milk to local villagers. Venera needs a loan to purchase goods for sale. She wants to open a small shop by her house where she would sell food items.

Gulzina, 63, and her husband have brought up four daughters. All of their daughters are married and live separately. She and her husband are engaged in cattle breeding. This has been their main occupation for thirty years. Gulzina needs a loan to purchase coal for winter.

Orosulbu, 62, is mother to nine children. Except the youngest son, all of the other children have gotten married and live separately. Orosulbu prefers not to depend on her children and earns her livelihood by raising livestock and selling milk. Orosulbu needs a loan to buy a heifer for subsequent breeding. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy cement and sand for building a jerry building and garage.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock rice and to buy and sell oil, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Savali

texts.en:
Savali T., a 35-year-old woman living in the town of Leusoalii, runs a general store selling a variety of different products in her community. She is married and has one small child. Savali has been in her business for over three years and earns approximately 400 tala a month.

Savali joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having successfully repaid a previous loan of 1250 tala, which was used to expand the business, Savali is now requesting a loan of 2000 tala which will be used to renovate the business. This will be her fourth loan from SPBD. Savali plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in renovating a general store

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Maria del Carmen tiene 59 años de edad, es casada con dos hijos mayores de edad, que ya están casados y con familias aparte. La señora Maria se dedica a la compra-venta de huevos y gallinas los cuales comercializa de forma ambulante en el mercado oriental de Managua. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace ya 14 años, ayudándole a vender a su mama que era la que originalmente tenía el negocio. Después decidió independizarse, compro 300 cajillas de huevos y empezó a venderlas en Managua. Actualmente están presentando un problema de que el precio del huevo se ha mostrado muy inestable, haciendo que cada día las ganancias de ella sean menores que las que obtenían antes. Sin embargo, la señora se ayuda con la venta de gallinas, ya que obtiene un buen precio. El crédito será invertido en la compra de  más mercancía, que le permitirá hacer frente a la época navideña en que las ventas se incrementan. Su meta es llegar a comprar un vehículo para poder vender su producto de una manera más fácil, sin tener que andar pagando a los buses para que le lleven la mercadería.
texts.en:
Maria del Carmen, 59, is married and has two grown children. The children are married and have their own separate families. Maria buys and sells eggs and chickens. She is a street vendor in the Mercado Oriental of Managua. She started this business 14 years ago. She helped her mother, who originally had the business, sell. Later, she decided to become independent. She bought 300 cases of eggs and started to sell them in Managua. There is now a problem in that the price of eggs is very unstable. That means that each day her earnings are less than the day before. Nevertheless, she helps herself by selling chickens, and she gets a good price. The loan is to buy more merchandise, which will put her in front of the Christmas season as sales are increasing. Her goal is to buy a vehicle to be able to sell her product in an easier way without having to keep on paying the buses to carry her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo G., who is known in his community as “Danny,” is 38 years old and is married to Myrna. They are blessed with one son named Danny Boy G., seven years old. They live in Barangay Paniki, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. They aim to be successful in life to give their son a better future. Despite the hardships and difficulties in life, they strive harder to earn a living.

Farming is their way of making a living. They till their land twice a year to plant rice and vegetables. They are also engaged in hog raising to earn additional income. They want to expand their plantation to have a plentiful harvest and to improve their piggery by increasing their livestock. Since they don’t have enough capital, they want to borrow from Kiva lenders the amount of 10,000 Philippine pesos to be used in acquiring the needed materials for the maintenance of their crop production and piggery. They hope that through patience and sacrifice, they will achieve their goal. They believe that “God is merciful to those who are honest and faithful.”

loans.use: Additional capital for his hog raising business

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en: Ma. Fe O. lives in Masville Cubay, La Carlota City, Negros Occidental. She is 34 years old and married. Her husband has operated their watch-repair business for the past 29 years in the city proper of La Carlota. The couple is blessed with five children, ages 5 to 16 years old. Ma. Fe started from nothing. They live in a very dilapidated house because her husband's income cannot support the total needs of the family. She worried about the future and what would happen if her children started going to school. Thus, she invested in a pig-fattening business that can also help in defraying family expenses. She continued her business until such time that she could expand it. In 2004, she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon for the said purpose of expanding the businesses, especially the pig-fattening business. She was able to improve her business by buying additional pigs for fattening. With one sow to raise, she has used some of her loan as additional capital for her watch-repair business. She was able to earn a minimum of 3,600 Philippine pesos per month. She saves most of her income for the education of her children. Ma. Fe joined NWTF-Project Dungganon so she could have her own business and to help her husband for her children's future because she wants all of them to finish their studies and get good jobs. Ma. Fe's previous loan of Php 15,000 was utilized for the pig-fattening business and was fully paid on time and in full without delay. With her 10th loan, she will use Php 18,000 as additional working capital for her business. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital for her pig-fattening business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria M. is from the village of Cabaruan. She is 49 years old. Victoria is married and has children. To make a living, Victoria raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs to sell. Victoria has been engaged in her business for years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine pesos a month from these activities. In 2009, Victoria joined ASKI, Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Victoria is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the first loan taken out by Victoria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Reynalyn's Group

texts.en:
Reynalyn M. is from the village of Villa Concepcion, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 23 years old. Reynalyn is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Reynalyn is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Reynalyn owns & operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Reynalyn is just starting this business.

In 2009, Reynalyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Reynalyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Reynalyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn Q. is from the village of Batangan, Valencia City. She is 41 years old. Evelyn is single and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $125 a month from this activity.

In 2009, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Carlos Javier

texts.es:
Carlos G. V. de 22 años de edad vive en casa de su padre junto con un hermano el cual tambien trabaja y aporta en los gastos de la casa ellos viven en Caserio Barrio Nuevo – Ocucaje.
El sr. Es soltero desde pequeño a trabajado como ayudante de panadería ya que su meta es surgir y ser mejor cada día èl es un joven con buenas rferencias de responsabilidad.
El sr. se dedica al transporte diario de 7.00am hasta las 9.00 pm realizando colectivo de Ica – Ocucaje ida y vuelta este trabajo lo realiza desde hace 3 años actualmente el carro donde trabaja es alquiler venta por eso que solicita le financiemos para poder terminar de cancelarlo y de esa manera tener algo propio.
Es una persona con bastante ganas de salir adelante es bien luchador y es considerado un buen hijo ya que apoya a su padre a pesar de que el sr tambien trabaja como abrero de campo.
texts.en:
Carlos G. V. is 22 years old and lives in his father’s house with his brother, who also works and contributes to the household expenses. They live in the village of Barrio Nuevo in Ocucaje. Carlos is single and worked as an assistant at a bakery when he was much younger. His goal at the time was to emerge as a better person each day. For a young man, he has good references and has demonstrated responsibility.

Every day, Carlos provides transportation services from 7am until 9pm for the local cooperative. He has been working the route between Ica and Ocucaje for the past three years. Carlos currently leases a car, so he is requesting a loan so that he can terminate his lease and acquire a vehicle of his own.

Carlos is a person who desires to get ahead. He is known for his fighting spirit and considered to be a dutiful son for supporting his father even though they both work in the same occupation.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Terminate the rental agreement of the car he is using so that he can purchase his own vehicle

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Mrs. Marisa A. is 38 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. Her husband is a tricycle driver and he supports their basic daily needs. Marisa sells her vegetables at the public market in Tambulig. From her vegetable-vending business she approximately earns 4,000 PHP a month.
Marisa successfully repaid her previous loan of 4,000 PHP from Kiva partner, PMPC. The purpose of that loan was to buy other kinds of vegetables to sell. As of now, she has a new loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC and that loan is intended for her business only. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital for her vegetable-vending business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth es una señora casada que tiene 3 hijos, vive en una casa que es prestada, la casa donde viven Elizabeth y sus hijos es de sus suegros, actualmente vive sola ya que su esposo se encuentra en España y hace todo esfuerzo para sacar adelante a su familia. 
Elizabeth se dedica a su actividad de elaboración de pan desde hace bastante tiempo, debido a que el negocio es pequeño quiere explorar nuevos nichos de mercado y se quiere diversificar comprando una máquina de coser para realizar otro tipo de mercaderías. Elizabeth no tiene mucha competencia al contrario quiere ampliar su mercado. El destino del crédito es para la compra de una maquina de costura. Las anteriores operaciones en Agrocapital las cancelo con puntualidad y responsabilidad teniendo buenos promedios en sus 2 anteriores créditos respectivamente.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman who has 3 children. She lives in a rented house. The house where Elizabeth and her children live belongs to her in-laws, but she is currently living alone since her husband is in Spain making every effort to support his family. Elizabeth has been making bread for quite some time. Since the business is small, she wants to explore new markets, and she wants to diversify by buying a sewing machine to make other types of merchandise. Elizabeth does not have much competition; on the contrary, she wants to expand her market. The purpose of this loan is for the purchase of a sewing machine. Her previous loans from Agrocapital were paid off punctually and responsibly.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment capital for new business

loans.name: Señoras De Taguan (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
Señoras de Taguan es un banco comunal formado por mujeres emprendedoras que luchan para salir adelante junto a sus familias, este banco está ubicado en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca  donde podemos disfrutar de la  belleza natural de la zona urbana y su cadena montañosa  que encierra laderas y mucha vegetación forjando un paisaje singular,  su gente se dedica a la agricultura,  ganadería y también a la elaboración de sombreros tejidos a mano.

Rosa tiene 40 años, se encuentra separada hace 7 años de su esposo ya que se fue ha trabajar en la costa Ecuatoriana y se hizo de otro compromiso, en su matrimonio concibió ocho hijos uno de ellos  es casado y vive de manera independiente, dos hijos trabajan en la ciudad  en el oficio de  albañil y es solo para sus gastos, otro de sus hijos no estudia pero le ayuda en casa, y los  otros cuatro aun son pequeños y estudian en la escuela de la comunidad.  Su vivienda es propia aunque pequeña y de adobe  pero eso les brinda seguridad. 

Ella  se dedica a la agricultura, cultiva  la tierra de quienes le dan trabajo ocasional, también cría animales  tiene una vaquita, un borrego y gallinas las que vende solo cuando tiene algún apuro económico. Se encuentra en su segundo ciclo trabajando con su banco comunal  con el dinero de su crédito va a comprar un chancho para criarlo, engordarlo y venderlo.

Su sueño es superarse cada día más, incrementar sus animales y arreglar poco a poco su casa.

La señora María C. vive en la comunidad de Taguan en el  cantón  Sigsig, tiene como atractivos el Castillo De Chobshi que se encuentra a solo 7 Km. de la cabecera cantonal de Sígsig al sureste del Azuay, éste es  un conjunto arquitectónico de tipo “kallanca” es decir de forma rectangular con gruesos muros de aproximadamente un metro y medio.

Nuestra socia tiene 56 años, se encuentra casada y es madre de ocho hijos de los cuales uno una hija se suicido dejando en la orfandad a dos  niños que ahora se  encuentran a su cargo y están estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad,  cinco de sus hijos  viven en la ciudad de Cuenca y los otros  salieron  de su comunidad en busca de mejores oportunidades y casi nunca le van a visitar, por ahora  vive sólo con su  hijo de 14 años que es  quien le ayuda en su hogar, sus dos nietos y  su esposo que  trabaja como albañil en centro de la ciudad y solo la visita el fin de semana, tienen  una casita pequeña que es de su propiedad.

María cría de animales como chanchos, gallinas, cuyes, ganado y solo los vende en sus apuros económicos, también se dedica a la agricultura siembra  hortalizas para luego viajar a  Cuenca y venderlas,  se encuentra en su segundo ciclo en su banco comunal, con el primer credito compró pollos que ya están listos para la venta y con el nuevo préstamo comprará unos chanchos para engordarlos y venderlos.  Su  sueño es de poder comprar más vacas para vender la producción de leche y elaborar quesos.
texts.en:
Señoras de Taguan is a community bank formed by enterprising women who work hard to make headway for their families. The group is located in the city of Cuenca, where they can enjoy the natural beauty of the city where the surrounding mountain range and plentiful vegetation forge a unique landscape. The locals make a living in agriculture, livestock and also making hand-woven sombreros. Rosa is 40 years old and has been separated from her husband for seven years, after he left to work on the Ecuadorian coast and found someone else. She had eight children from her marriage, one of whom is married and independent, two who work in the city at a construction office and help with expenses, one who is out of school but helps with the house, and the other four are still young and in school. She owns her home, which is small and made of adobe but still provides security. She makes a living in agricultural, cultivating the land and occasionally hiring workers. She also raises animal and has a cow, a sheep and chickens, which she sells only when she's in some economic trouble. This is her second loan cycle working with her community bank, and with the money she plans to purchase a pig to raise, fatten and sell. Her dream is to better herself more everyday, increase her number of livestock and fix her house up little by little. María C. lives in Taguan in the Sigsig area, which is located only 7 kilometers from Castillo De Chobshi, which is a popular architectural structure. She is 56 years old, married and has eight children. One of her daughters committed suicide, orphaning her two children, who are now under María's care and going to the community school. Five of María's children live in the city of Cuenca and the others left in search of better opportunities and almost never come to visit. For now, she only lives with her 14-year-old son, who helps around the house, her two grandchildren and her husband, who is a construction worker in the city center and only comes home on weekends. They have a small home that they own. María raises animals such as pigs, chickens, guinea pigs and cattle, and only sells them during times of economic trouble. She also makes a living harvesting vegetables and selling them in the city of Cuenca. This is her second loan cycle with the community bank, and with the first one she purchased chicken that are now ready to sell, and with the new loan she plans to purchase pigs to fatten and then sell. Her dream is to be able to have more cows so she can sell their milk and make cheeses.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animals to raise and sell

loans.name: Hung

texts.en:
Hung D. L. is a 30-year-old man with a wife and two young children. Hung is a farmer. For the past five years, he has also been a carpenter. His monthly income is approximately 4,000,000 Vietnamese Dong (VND). He has participated in SEDA's micro-financing program since 2008 and has always met his repayment obligations on time. In his last loan, Hung borrowed 4,704,000 VND. 

Hung is now seeking 8,288,000 VND in order to purchase wood to make wooden household furnishings.

loans.use: To purchase wood to make wooden household furnishings

loans.name: Evelin

texts.es: Evelin de 37 años de edad es soltera, Helmut de 13 años es su unico hijo y esta estudiando el 6to grado de primaria. Evelin trabaja para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa desde hace 3 años como operador siscat de catastro.  Esta solicitando su 1er credito con el objetivo de obtener su propia vivienda, ya que actualmente no cuenta con una, sin embargo tiene su propio terreno y se inscribio en el proyecto colmena, quien le levantara su casita, pero necesita dar un aporte economico, aunque cuenta con una parte, pero le hace falta el financiamiento que solicita, y  espera contar con el apoyo de AFODENIC y Kiva para terminar este proyecto.  El mayor sueño que tiene es poder tener su casita y mejorarla en la medida que pueda ya que es el patrimonio que le dejara a su hijo.
texts.en:
Evelin is a 37 year old single mother to her only child Helmut, who is 13 years old and a sixth grade student. She has worked the past three years for the City of Juigalpa as a property tax surveyor. Evelin is requesting her first loan with hopes of acquiring her own home since she currently does not have one. However, she does have a plot of land on which to build. Evelin is enrolled in a housing program that will help her with the construction, but she needs to make a down payment in order for the work to begin. The problem is that she lacks the necessary funds. For this reason, she is depending on the support of AFODENIC and Kiva so that she can continue in the program.

Her greatest wish is to have her own house and make improvements to it so that one day she can leave it as an inheritance for her son.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make the down payment required to begin the construction of her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pay AgroCapital and operating capital

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Mrs. Van T. is a 42-year-old married woman and mother. She has a rental shop inside the local market where she sells food and earns an adequate amount to help with her family’s financial problems. She has another financial earner in her husband who has the skill of making furniture by hand. This couple helps each other in order to generate money to support their four school-aged children. Van T. is taking out a loan to purchase more raw materials for her husband to produce sets of furniture to sell.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Dina Group

texts.es:
