El grupo Dina lo integran tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Cándida Rosa S. vende verduras y animales domésticos como gallinas, chancho, patos…etc. desde hace siete años aproximadamente. Ella con el crédito comprara yuca, papa, ayote, pipian y animales.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Jenifer H. quien vende cosméticos desde hace cinco años y Leonora H. venta de sandalias desde hace cuatro años. Ellas tienen la meta de aumentar sus negocios y crecer.
texts.en:
The Dina group consists of three hardworking women. One of them is Cándida Rosa S.; for about seven years, she has been selling vegetables as well as domestic animals such as chickens, pigs, ducks and so on. She plans to use the loan to purchase cassava, potatoes, squash, cushaw as well as animals. Her partners in the group are Jenifer H., who has been selling cosmetics for five years, and Leonora H., who has been selling sandals for four years. Their goal is to increase their sales volume and grow their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Andrei Vazhnov, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits, vegetables, and domestic animals

loans.name: Jecelyn

texts.en:
Jecelyn R. is from the village of San Roque, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 42 years old. Jecelyn is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Jecelyn owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products,  and she also wants to invest some of the money in installing a mini-eatery in the local community. Jecelyn is just starting this business.

In 2008, Jecelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jecelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Jecelyn is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Jecelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: With God All Things Are Possible Group

texts.en:
M. S., is the leader of a group of five borrowers called With God All Things Are Possible. He is 34 years old, married and has three children who range from 5 to 12 years old. He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of financial support.  

For 13 years, he has been selling men's footwear such as sneakers, sandals, slippers, shoes, etc., in Redlight Market outside Monrovia, Liberia.

He plans to use his 6,000-Liberian-Dollar portion of this 30,000-Liberian-Dollar group loan to buy more sneakers, sandals, slippers, shoes, etc. He describes himself as a very quiet person.

His dream is to improve his business and build a house. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Sonnie M. is holding the sign in the middle of the group.

loans.use: To buy more sneakers, sandals, slippers, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Rosa de 64 años, hace 30 años atrás desde que inicio la cooperativa donde vive ubico el negocio de la tienda en su casa, ella vive en una zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución llamada “Primavera” de Duran. 

Ella tiene una tienda de víveres la mayor venta que tiene son los confites que vende y las bebidas, desde hace años ella ubico su tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, para mas seguridad le puso unas rejas (aparecen en la foto). Trabaja desde las 07h30 hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar confites y bebidas para su negocio, en el futuro quiere comprar un carro para transportar mejor la mercadería y así con los ingresos asegurar su vejez.
texts.en:
Rosa is 64 years old. Thirty years when the cooperative where she lives was established she set up a business in her home. She lives in a suburban area named Duran which is known for its ecology. She runs a greenhouse, selling plants on a wholesale basis. Rosa de 64 años, hace 30 años atrás desde que inicio la cooperativa donde vive ubico el negocio de la tienda en su casa, ella vive en una zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución llamada “Primavera” de Duran. She runs a convenience store. The greatest demand is for confections and soft drinks. For years the store has taken up the front part of her house, but for greater security she installed bars (as seen on the photo). She works from 7:30 in the morning until 10 at night, every day. With the loan she wishes to purchase confections and drinks to stock her business. In the future she wishes to purchase a car to be able to transport her merchandise with greater ease. She hopes to save a pension for her old age.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase confections and soft drinks.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
la señora Adriana Z. es una persona muy dedicada a su negocio, su actividad es la venta de abarroteria, tiene varios años de realizar este trabajo.

Adriana es una persona muy responsable de sus actos, depende una persona de ella, de esa manera que tiene que trabajar muy fuerte para sacarlo adelante.
Varias personas comentaron que es bien responsable a sus compromisos.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia y asi surtir su negocio para tener mayores ganancias las cuales las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Adriana Z. is a very dedicated to her business. She has had a general store for many years. Adriana is a very responsible person. She supports someone else so she needs to work hard to give him a better chance in life. Many people attest how responsible she is. She will use the loan to buy more inventory and diversify her business. That way she will have more income to cover her household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of juices, sodas, corn flour, "churros", tortillas, soap, toilet paper

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario tiene la edad de 58 años, es casado y tiene 1 hijo de 21 años. En este momento Costa Rica esta sufriendo aguaceros que hace difícil la cosecha. Por eso él quiere comprar fertilizantes para la mejora de la cosecha de los cafetales para este año y ayudarle a las matas a producir más para el siguente. Rosario cuenta con su experiencia en café y su finca con lo cual tiene varios años. Desea de sea una finca productiva. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR y no ha realizados otros préstamos en bancos estatales. FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. Con los ganancias de su finca quiere invertir en el futuro de su finca y en el bienestar de su familia que es su mayor prioridad.
texts.en:
Rosario is 58 years old, married, and has a son who is 21 years old. At the moment, Costa Rica is experiencing heavy downpours which is making it difficult to harvest. He wants to buy fertilizers to improve his coffee fields this year and help his plants produce more in the following seasons. Rosario has experience growing coffee and has owned his farm for several years. He wants to have a productive farm.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR and he has not received other loans from the state banks. FUDECOSUR provides this loan with greater convenience and a lower interest rate. His earnings will be reinvested in the future of his farm. The welfare of his family is his greatest priority.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & supplies for his coffee crop

loans.name: Lidia Marina

texts.es: Lidia Marina se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de costura. Hace más de 11 años que tiene este negocio. Por lo que ha buscado la forma de mejorar sus ingresos, ella inicio con fondos propios pues ella siempre ha sido una mujer que le ha gustado sacar a sus hijos y proporcionarles todo lo necesario. Es por medio de su Mama que ella logro aprender este negocio y fuera un medio de vida para ella y su familia. Este crédito es para la compra de   materia prima como agujas, telas, hilos, tijera pues tiene pedidos que cumplir.
texts.en:
Lidia Marina is a seamstress. She has had her business for over 11 years. Seeking ways to improve her income, she used her own resources to start out because she’s always been a woman who wants to see her children get ahead and provide them with everything they need. She learned this craft from her mother and it became a way to support herself and her family. The loan is to buy raw materials like: needles, fabric, thread and scissors because she has pending orders to fill.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy needles, fabric, thread and scissors.

loans.name: Rovelyn

texts.en:
Rovelyn I. is from the village of San Antonio, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 38 years old. Rovelyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rovelyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising ducks for sale. Rovelyn is just starting this business, and she wants to gain more income for her family.

In 2009, Rovelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rovelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Rovelyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Rovelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Jovencia

texts.en:
Jovencia H. is from the village of San Luis, Gingoog City. She is 45 years old. Jovencia is widowed and has 13 adult-aged children. To make a living, Jovencia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap , toothpaste, canned goods & snacks in the local community. Jovencia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jovencia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovencia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell and working capital. Jovencia is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Jovencia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the  business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

location.town: San Luis, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Lang

texts.en:
Mrs. Lang S. (shown in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Nat Chum, live on an island located 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They married in 1970 and have eight children: three sons and five daughters. Four of them are married and live outside the family home, one is a garment factory worker, one weaves silk at home, one assist his parents in the business and another one is in school.

Lang and her husband sell fruit (mangoes). They buy mangoes from their fellow villagers under contract. This means that they pay money before the harvesting season and then they collect mangoes to sell at Phnom Penh market. 

Lang has asked for a Kiva loan several times already. She hopes to continue increasing the number of mangoes she buys and sells, so she is applying for another loan of $500 to purchase mangoes for resale.

loans.use: To purchase mangoes under contract for resale.

loans.name: Ek

texts.en:
Ek Y., 39, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Seim Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for the Angkor Wat temple. Y. raises pigs to sell, earning an income of about USD 3 per day. Her husband is employed repairing temples, earning an income of about USD 6.17 per day. Y. has to spend USD 50 on food, USD 5 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 20 on other necessary expenses every month.

Y. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a plot of farmland to grow more rice. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland to grow more rice.

loans.name: You's Group

texts.en:
This loan group has four members. They have selected Mrs.You K. to be the group leader. They will use their portions of the group loan in different ways to support their families. The members live in Anlong Ta Sek Leu Village in Kandal Province. 

Mrs. You K. and her husband, Mr. Khut Sieng, are farmers who own a two-hectare (~ 5-acre) plot of land. They grow rice and sugar cane which they sell to support their family. Mrs. K. has a problem, because is time to grow rice in her field, but she does not have enough rice seed to grow. So, to improve production, Mrs. You K. is requesting a loan to buy rice seed.

She is 47 years old and the mother of three children. Two of her children are employed in a  garment factory and the other is an iron welder.

loans.use: To buy rice seed

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Bun S., 53, is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for her family's use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to repair her house. S. is a housewife; she is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kandal Province, Cambodia, an area known for its garment factory industry. The four children are all employed at the factory, earning an income of USD 3 each per day to help cover the family expenses. The family has to spend USD 70 on food, USD 15 on electricity, and USD 40 on other necessary expenses every month. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family's use.

loans.name: Dugar

texts.es:
Dugar V. V. tiene 47 años y vive en unión libre. El vive con su conviviente y sus hijas en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Dugar es miembro de la ventanilla rural Unidos Somos Más. Esta nueva ventanilla hace parte de la comunidad Matilde Esther en la provincia de Guayas. Esta comunidad esta ubicada a 2 horas de la oficina de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. El grupo cuenta con 23 socios y se dedican a diferentes actividades como agricultura, cría de ganados y pequeños restaurantes y comedores.   

Dugar se dedica a la producción de cacao y naranjas. El tiene este comercio desde hace 8 años. Dugar compra y vende sus productos en Bucay.  El solicita este crédito para mejorar el sembrio de cacao y naranjas. Através de este crédito el desea mejorar el futuro de su familia.

Su sueño es tener terrenos propios y una casa propia. El desafío que el enfrenta en su negocio es la baja producción en época de invierno.

En su tiempo libre, aparte de descansar, le gusta jugar indoor y volley y salir a las fiestas patronales.
texts.en: Dugar V. V. is 47 and in a common-law marriage. He lives with his partner and children in the Chillanes canton in the province of Bolivar. Dugar is a member of the Unidos Somos Mas ["United We Are More"] rural lending bank. This new bank is part of the Matilde Esther community in the Guayas province. This community is located 2 hours from the Chillanes office in the Bolivar province. The group has 23 members who have various businesses such as agriculture, the raising of livestock, and small restaurants and cafeterias. Dugar is a member of the Unidos Somos Mas rural bank. This new bank is part of the Matilda Esther community in the Guayas province. This community is located 2 hours from the Chillanes office in the Bolivar province. The group has 23 members who have different businesses such as agriculture, the raising of livestock, and small restaurants and cafeterias. Dugar produces cocoa and oranges. He has had this business for 8 years. Dugar buys and sells his products in Bucay. He is requesting this loan to improve his cocoa and orange crops. Through this loan, he hopes to improve his family's future. His dream is to have his own land and his own house. The challenge that he encounters in his business is the low production in the wintertime. In his free time, aside from resting, he enjoys playing indoor soccer and volley ball, and celebrating the holidays.

loans.use: to improve the cocoa and orange crop

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani is a 21-year-old woman from Sanour village, next to Jenin, in Palestine. Amani is a student. She took out a loan from FATEN to pay for last semester's tuition fees. Amani's father and brother will help her pay back the loan. Amani wants to find a job after graduation and have an independent source of income. Amani's brother is a NationA. Palestinian Authority employee.

Amani's brother, Hakam, appears in the picture here as she is a religious woman.

loans.use: To pay school tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy essential materials for his work

loans.name: Digna Esperanza

texts.es:
La Señora. Digna L. es socia del banco comunal San Miguel, vive en la comunidad La Victoria Alta que pertenece a la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia es admirada por la belleza natural que hay en el sector, su gente es muy trabajadora y se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y agricultura.

Doña Digna se dedica hace 3 años a la atención de un bar en una escuelita del sector, trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 7 de la mañana hasta la 1 de la tarde, en su casa se dedica a la cría de animales como: pollos y cuyes.

La Señora. Digna tiene 39 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 20, 17 y 18 años de edad, su primera hija  estudia en la universidad, su segundo hijo en el colegio y su ultimo hijo en una escuelita del sector. Su esposo labora como albañil, viven en la casa que es de su hija.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 13 años, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más productos para el bar como: aguas, confites, gaseosas, bocadillos, etc. Su meta es crecer mucho más en su negocio y ayudar a que sus hijos se superen.
texts.en:
Digna L. is a member of the San Miguel community bank.  She lives in La Victoria Alta community which is located in El Valle parish.  This parish is admired for its natural beauty.  The locals are very hard working and work in commerce, raising animals and growing crops.

For three years, Digna has been serving in a snack bar in a local elementary school.  She works from Monday to Friday, from 7.00am to 1.00pm.  At home she raises animals such as chickens and guinea pigs.

Digna is 39 years old, married, and has 3 children aged 20, 17 and 18.  Her eldest child (a daughter) is studying at university, her middle child (a son) is in high school and her youngest (a son) attends a local elementary school.  Her husband is a construction worker.  They live in her daughter's home.

Digna has been a member of her community bank for 13 years.  She will invest her loan money in buying more products for the bar such as water, candy, soda, sandwiches, etc.  Her goal is to grow a lot more in her business and to help her children improve themselves.

loans.use: To buy water, candy, soda, sandwiches, etc.

loans.name: Kealy

texts.en:
Mrs. Kealy P. and her husband, Mr. Chamroeun Khen, have been married since 1977 and have eight children: five sons and three daughters. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh, about 15 kilometers away. 

Kealy is a rice farmer. When not at the farm, she also puts together fabric swatches for a clothing manufacturer (shown in the photo). Her husband is a primary school teacher.

She asked a Kiva loan once; she now is requesting another loan of $600 to make a handrail for her house.

loans.use: To make a handrail for her house

loans.name: Afiwa Mawulawoé Epse Degbe

texts.fr: Madame  Afiwa est mère d’un enfant.  Elle a 32 ans et est mariée. Elle habite quartier  Doumasséssé.  Pour contribuer au menage, elle fait la vente de produits de beauté, bijoux et mèches. Elle achète les produits au grand marché de Lomé et revend dans une boutique à  la devanture de sa maison.  Elle compte 5 ans déjà. Pour répondre a la demande sans cesse croissante, elle demande un crédit au près de Wages.
texts.en: Mrs. L. is a mother of one. She is 32 years old and married. She lives in the Doumasséssé quater. To help handle the household expenses, she sells beauty products, jewelry, and hair extensions. She buys these items at the Lomé Grand Market and sells them at a shop in front of her house. She has been doing this for five years. To respond to an ever increasing demand, she is requesting a loan through WAGES.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products, jewelry, and hair extensions

loans.name: Soro

texts.en:
A. Soro is married and her husband is Ahrorov Olimjon. She has two sons and a daughter. Soro is a very hardworking woman who trades in the «Korvon» market. She started her business with her own capital. She sells children's clothes. She has been in this business for 12 years. Soro wants to expand his business and get more profits for her families needs. Soro would like to get a loan of $2500 US for purchasing new seasonal children's clothes. She thanks all lenders who support her in realizing her desire. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy seasonal children's clothes

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina J., from the village of Sinama, is 58 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Marcelina has been planting and harvesting corn for sale for over 28 years, earning approximately 20,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Marcelina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 35,000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to grow, she is now requesting her eighth loan of 50000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Marcelina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Monique

texts.en: Monique is 22 years old.  She has two children, ages 4 and 2 years; they are not yet in school. She owns a store in which she sells cooking oil, Irish potatoes, and kerosene. She has been running this business for 2 years. This helps her provide all the requirements of her family easily.  She is requesting a loan to buy more cooking oil and Irish potatoes in order to increase her profits.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en:
Mavluda is married with 4 children. She sells kid's clothing at the central market and has been in this business for 8 years. Her extensive experience helps Mavluda to choose the right kind of inventory and make good sales. Mavluda enjoys selling clothing; moreover, this business brings her stable income. 

Mavluda would like to borrow 3,000 USD to purchase a summer collection of kid's clothing. She has used IMON International’s loans before and considers them to be very helpful for her business. 

 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy new clothing to sell

loans.name: Yelian 1 Group

texts.fr: YELIAN 1 est un groupement constitué de onze personnes et dont la présidente (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est nommée Cathérine. Les membres du groupe résident tous dans le même quartier au Bénin. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupement sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Née en 1965 au Bénin, Cathérine vit depuis dix neuf ans dans une ville du Bénin avec sa famille. Cathérine est en effet mariée à un entrepreneur du nom de Romain et a quatre enfants, qui sont tous  scolarisés. Seulement, un des enfants reste à la charge de Cathérine et de son mari. Le couple subvient ensemble aux besoins de la famille. Cathérine n'a jamais été à l'école. Depuis environs dix huit ans, Cathérine vend des bambous à son domicile. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à contribuer aux dépenses familiales. Cathérine s'approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Ce premier prêt permettra certainement à Cathérine et à son groupe de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
YELIAN 1 is a group composed of eleven people whose president (the one with her hand raised in the photo) goes by the name of Cathérine. The group members all reside in the same district, in Benin. With the goal of increasing their working capital, this group is requesting a loan from ALIDé for the first time.

Born in 1965 in Benin, Cathérine has been living for nine years in a city in Benin with her family. She is actually married to an entrepreneur by the name of Romain, and she has four children, who are all educated. Only one of the children remains in their care. The couple jointly supports the needs of the family.

Cathérine never attended school. For about eighteen years, she has been selling bamboo out of her house. This business generates revenues for her that helps her to do her part to cover family expenses. She gets her supplies in a city in Benin. 

This initial loan will certainly enable her and her group to boost their level of business and to increase their customer base and their revenues.

loans.use: to buy bamboo

loans.name: Reforma 1-4 Group

texts.en:
Maria S. is one of the members of her group named La Reforma 1 to 4. This is a large group made up of twenty businesswomen and businessmen, dedicated to doing business all over their rural community, which is a batey (company town) between sugar cane fields outside San Pedro de Macoris. She has a long term partner and is a mother with seven children, all living with her in a simply structured home in a rural villa where many Haitian families live every day, working and fighting to have a better future. Maria S. is one of these women and men, doing business to improve her family's standard of living.

For about eight years, Maria S. has been operating her fried food stand and her comedor (a kind of local restaurant for lunch). She has improved her business with every loan she has taken with Esperanza. This is her 9th loan. She plans to use this loan to buy rice, meat, seasoning, vegetables, flour, cooking oil, etc.  Maria S. operates two food businesses. One is for breakfast and dinner (a fried food stall, where she sells chicken, meat, sausages, plantain, fried dough, etc), and the comedor, which is like a home restaurant where many people from the community come to have lunch.

She plans to continue to enjoy cooking and serving in her businesses. Another favorite thing to do is to be at her home with her family. Her story is generally representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. 

Note: There is more than one group picture in order to present as many visible faces as possible.

loans.use: to buy, rice, meat, seasoning, vegetables, flour, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: In this picture, Maame is seen with different types of soaps that she sells in Ankaful-fie, a village near Abura in Cape Coast.  She has been in the soap business for 3 years. Maame plans to use this loan to increase the quantity of soaps she acquires for sale. As part of her business plans, she hopes to reinvest the profit into the business. Maame is married to a farmer and together they live with their 6 children.

loans.use: to buy more soaps to increase her sales

loans.name: Bokk Liggey Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Bokk Liggey est créé depuis le 14 mai 2010 jour de l'inauguration du Banc Villageois de Gabar; il est composé de dix huit femmes qui sont du même village et qui ont comme activités communes l'embouche et le maraîchage.

Madame Ndéye la responsable est mariée âgée de 45 ans, elle est mère de sept enfants; elle mène comme activité principale l'embouche ovine et fait en même temps du maraîchage, elle a une bonne expérience de plus de 15 ans dans ces secteurs. Sur la photo elle est debout tout à fait à droite couverte avec un châle orange.

Elle achéte ses moutons dans les marchés hebdomadaires et les engraisse pendant 3 à 4 mois avant d'écouler sa marchandise dans le marché hebdomadaire du village voisin.


Son prêt lui permettra d'acheter des béliers qu'elle souhaite revendre un mois avant le recouvrement pour ainsi rembourser son prêt.


Ses bénéfices obtenus lui servent à renforcer son épargne, pour les dépenses familiales c'est son mari qui s'en charge.
texts.en:
The Bokk Liggey community group was created on the 14th of May 2010, the day the Gabar village bank was opened. The group is made up of eighteen women who are all from the same village and all rear animals and crops for a living. Madame Ndéye is the team leader, and is 45 years old, married with seven children. Her main source of income is rearing sheep, which she does alongside market gardening. She has over fifteen years' experience in this field. In the photo, she is standing on the very right hand side, wearing an orange shawl. 
She purchases her sheep from the weekly markets and fattens them for 3 or 4 months, after which she sells them in the neighbouring village's weekly market. 
This loan will enable her to purchase rams which she hopes to re-sell a month before her loan deadline, so that she can repay it. The profits that she generates from her business activities will enable her to boost her savings- her family's needs are looked after by her husband.

loans.use: to purchase rams to rear then sell

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime is married with five children. Jaime is a farmer working in the Philippines and has been doing this work for 10 years. 

Jaime is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and pesticides to use in his farming. Jaime hopes this loan will grow his operation. Jaime earned PHP 25,000 in his previous harvest last April. 

In the future, Jaime hopes to generate more income to make his family more economically stable.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Idrissa M

texts.en:
Idrissa is 42 years old and married with four children, ages between 7 and 15. He runs a Pharmacy in Grassfield, which is a neighborhood in Freetown. He also has three relatives he takes care of as well as their immediate family. 

Idrissa has owned this business for 5 years and sells blood tonic, capsules, and various types of medicines at his drugs store. He also earns income from renting out a house. He says that the main challenge to his business is fluctuation in prices.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase various types of drugs. Idrissa says that the extra income from this loan will help him expand his house. In the future, he would like to be a supplier of drugs and expand his business more.

loans.use: to purchase various types of medicines such as malaria drugs and blood tonic.

loans.name: Dometilla

texts.en:
Dometilla, age 69, operates a piggery. She earns a living by selling live hogs to meat dealers. Sometimes they have the pigs slaughtered and sold at the market. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 4,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP)  in sales every week.

Dometilla and her husband Pascual live in Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. Pascual assists her with the business. Together they work hard to provide a safe and secure future for their family.

To help her continue operations of her business, Dometilla is requesting a Php 12, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy feed and additional hogs. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Dometilla hopes that her business will continue to be successful. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional hogs

loans.name: Prado Group

texts.en:
Monika, who is in her early 40s, is married with three children who go to school. She has had a grocery business for six years. She works from 6 am to 10 pm and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzanian, which she wants to use to buy more sodas, water, juice, chapatti and mandanzi.  Her dream is to one day be able to expand her business from two crates to four crates of sodas.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Prado", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more sodas, water, juice, chapati and mandanzi.

loans.name: Lorenita

texts.en:
Lorenita is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Lorenita has a food shop where she makes & sells viands like afritada & chicken pork adobo. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy raw ingredients needed to make viands.

Lorenita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lorenita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make viands

loans.name: Twubahe Group

texts.fr:
Marie est une commerçante âgée de 26ans qui habite  la localité de Bukirasazi de la Province de Gitega au centre du pays. Elle  fait le commerce de détail dans sa boutique pour divers articles comme le savon, l’huile de palme, les biscuits, le sucre, le haricot, le riz, etc depuis 15ans. Elle  est aussi cultivatrice. Elle n’a  pas fréquenté l’école. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont 1qui étudie a l’école primaire.  
Le crédit Kiva  de 570,000 francs burundais qu’elle obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter une grande quantité d’articles divers de boutique comme  le savon, l’huile de palme, les biscuits, le sucre, le haricot, le riz, etc à revendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  solidaire« TWUBAHE».
texts.en:
Marie is a 26-year-old trader who lives in the town of Bukirasazi, in Gitega province, in the center of Burundi. She is married with 3 children, one of whom goes to primary school. She herself has no formal education. She has been running her own store for 15 years and sells various products including soap, palm oil, biscuits, sugar, beans and rice. She also farms.

Marie will use the loan of 570 000 Burundese francs to restock her store with products to sell for a good profit. She is a member of the Twubahe solidarity group.

loans.use: to restock on products such as soap, palm oil, biscuits, sugar, beans, rice, etc.

loans.name: Martha Jeaneth

texts.es: Martha de 42 años de edad es casada, tiene 4 hijos de 16, 14, 12 y 10 años de edad.  Trabaja como comerciante en Santo Domingo.  Esta solicitando su 1er credito con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda construyendo una pared que se encuentra en mal estado, pues teme que en cualquier momento ocurra un accidente.  Ya tiene parte de los materiales, pero necesita comprar el cemento y el pago del albañil que le hara el trabajo.  Espera poder contar con el apoyo de la institucion para poder llevar su proyecto a cabo.
texts.en: Martha, 42, is married and has four children who are 16, 14, 12 and 10 years of age.  She works as a merchant in Santo Domingo.  She’s asking for her first home improvement loan to erect a wall that’s in poor shape because she fears that an accident could happen at any moment.  She already has part of the materials but needs to buy cement and pay the bricklayer who will do the work.  She hopes to get support from the institution to be able to carry out her project.

loans.use: to erect a wall.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: La señora Patricia es una persona muy trabajadora, ella solicito el crédito para cambiar las paredes de su casa ya  que  están construidas de lamina  y  desea hacerlas  de  ladrillos ya  que  la  temporada  de invierno se  acerca y ella se  preocupa   por el  bienestar  de  sus  hijos, quiere  protegerlos  de los  cambios  climáticos y de  las enfermedades que  esto puede  ocacionar, agradece el apoyo brindado  para la realización de su proyecto.
texts.en: Patricia is a very hardworking person. She requested a loan to renovate the walls of her house. They are currently made of aluminum sheeting and she wants to rebuild them from bricks. The winter season is approaching and she is concerned over the well-being of her children. She wants to protect them from the changes in climate and from illnesses that can result. She is thankful for the support provided in helping her realize her project.

loans.use: to rebuild her house walls with bricks.

loans.name: Muterian

texts.en:
Muterian is 46 years old and is married with five children. He has been farming on his piece of land for the past 15 years.

He has applied for his third loan with KADET LTD to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizer, and to buy more animals. He has been a good client. He hopes to make a profit and use it to educate his children and expand his farm.

Muterian hopes to make a profit and use it to re-invest in other businesses. He is a persevering man who can do more if funded.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizer, and to buy more animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sodas, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Abdumannon

texts.ru: Абдуманнон проживает в городе Истаравшан. Ему 43 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его жена занимается торговлей. Сам Абдуманнон занимается изготовлением и продажей трубы для печи. В этом ему помогает его сын. Целью получения кредита является закуп сырья для изготовления.
texts.en: Abdumannon lives in the city of Istaravshan.  He is 43 years old, married and has four children.  His wife is involved in sales.  Abdumannon is involved in manufacturing and selling oven pipes.  His son helps him in this business.  The goal of obtaining this loan is the purchase of raw materials for manufacturing.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials

loans.name: Ray

texts.en:
Ray is a 46-year-old woman living in the town of Foailuga. She is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Ray owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means of generating revenue, her main source of income is selling fried foods in the local community.  Ray has been engaged in this business for over one year and earns approximately 600 WST per month from these activities.

In 2011, Ray joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Ray is requesting her first loan from SPBD, in the amount of 1000 WST. She will use the loan to purchase freezers such as mutton flaps, sausages, chicken leg quarters, foam cups and cooking utensils. Ray plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase mutton flaps, sausages, chicken leg quarters, foam cups and cooking utensils

loans.name: Davaa

texts.en: Mrs. Davaa, 45 is a seamstress in a company which makes clothes. She has been working as a seamstress for over 20 years. She started her job at this company in 2003. During the past 20 years she had made very many kinds of outfits for sale. Davaa lives with her husband and her 2 children in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She decided to run her own leather clothes shop beyond her job or on her days-off. It is important and beneficial to increase her family income for serving her family necessities in enough. Initially she needs to build her working capital and buy equipments such as a sewing machine for leather material. She is planning to purchase the new sewing machine which is made in Japan. It costs about MNT 1.500.000 in the market. Therefore she is taking a loan to purchase the sewing machine to start the new business beyond her job.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine to start a new business beyond her job.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a 29-year-old woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business selling food items in Kator, South Sudan, for two years. Joyce is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase bread and tomatoes to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a structure to house her business.

loans.use: to purchase bread and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is a 40-year-old, married woman with three children, two of whom are in school.  She has had a business selling food in Yei, South Sudan for four years.

Loice is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase cabbages and rice.  She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase cabbages and rice to sell.

loans.name: Bon Coeur Plus Group

texts.en:
Marie is the leader of the Community Bank named “Bon Coeur Plus". It is composed of 26 members united in solidarity to receive Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Marie is 58 years old and divorced. She is a mother of five children aged between 31 and 44 years old. She sells miscellaneous goods. She has been active in her business since 2001. She began her business selling miscellaneous goods. She joined a group of Hope (a DRCongo Microfinance Program) in order to achieve her dream of one day developing an orchard of fruit trees and a field of manioc.

loans.use: to buy her goods in larger quantities.

loans.name: Amira's Group

texts.en:
Amira is a member of this group from Iraq. Amira is 36 years old widow mother of three children. Amira started her sewing business five years ago with an old sewing machine. She lives in rent house with her children.
She is requesting this (Qard Hassan ) loan that Izdiharona provide for divorced and widow women to buy embroidery machine  and iron  to help her increase her income.
She aims to open big place for her business and create jobs for other women.
The story of Amira and her business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for economic development clients .
They preferred to blur their face to cultural reason.

loans.use: A portion of Amira's Group $ 3,000 loan is to buy embroidery machine and iron.

loans.name: Alpa

texts.en:
Alpa is 29 years old and has four children, three of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Alpa requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Alpa has been farming rice for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Alpa would like to save enough to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Juan Virgilio

texts.es:
Juan Virgilio es un hombre de 40 años de edad es soltero con una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 6 y 17 años, esta familia vive en una comunidad del barrio choacruz.

Juan Virgilio es un padre de familia muy responsable, lleva 8 años de dedicarse a la agricultura con esta actividad mantiene a su familia, gracias al empeño que le dedica a su cultivo todos los años obtiene una muy buena cosecha, y con el afán de incrementar esta época su cultivo, ha decidido solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra cebollines por cuerda. Él espera poder fortalecer su negocio  y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Compra de cebollines por cuerda.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to pay secondary school fees for her daughter.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en: Vladimir B. is 60 years old and has lived in the village of Pruteni as the town's mestre de limb (literally master of wood) for 40 years.  He uses his skills to make anything someone would need out of wood, whether this consists of using his trade to make different kinds of furniture, doors or window frames he can make it all. Like any Moldovan living in a village he also has many different animals around his house which he uses for his own personal use. He would like a loan to purchase wood and have it milled down so he can use it in his shop to have a steady supply.

loans.use: To purchase wood and have it milled into usable wood to use for his trade as a carpenter.

loans.name: Afi Ayoko

texts.en:
Born in 1980, Afi Ayoko K. is married and the mother of two. In addition, she also takes care of another child from her sister, who was killed in an accident. Her husband works primarily as a specialty fisherman. Because of very difficult conditions at home, she has been compelled to work to help cover household expenses. That is why she started selling basic food items. Given the flood of customer demands, she tried turning to loan sharks for help. But they made her situation worse with their exorbitant interest rates. And so she is requesting a loan of $800 as capital to stock and to transport food items, in order to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer:

Née en 1980 Madame K. Afi Ayoko est mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elle a à sa charge, en plus de ses propres enfants, un (01) autre enfant de sa sœur décédée suite à un accident. L’activité principale de son mari est la pêche artisanale. Les conditions de vie étant très difficile dans le ménage, madame KAOWO a été contrainte de se lancer dans une activité génératrice de revenu afin de pouvoir contribuer aux charges du ménage. C’est ainsi qu’elle entreprit la vente des produits alimentaires de première nécessité. Vu la demande de la clientèle qui ne cesse d’affluer, elle tenta de faire recours aux usuriers, ce qui l’a ruinée d’avantage car le taux était exorbitant. Elle sollicite donc aujourd’hui un crédit de $800 afin de pouvoir constituer un fonds de commerce pour l’approvisionnement, le transport et le stockage de ses produits pour pouvoir améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Buying, transporting, stocking, and selling basic food items

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is a widow with two children. Her husband died of cancer. Nataliya’s daughter is divorced and her son is in prison. Despite these hardships in life, Nataliya has managed to run a successful small business selling sells toys and clothing in the local market and support her family. Currently, she has two vending facilities which bring in good profits.

Loans from Nadiya Ukraine have helped the growth of Nataliya’s business. She purchased a vending stall and has been able to offer a better assortment of inventory as a result of loan capital. She has requested a new loan that will give her more working capital to use in developing her business. We believe her ability to make profitable sales and ensure that her products are chosen in response to the needs of her customers will help Nataliya boost her sales and succeed in her trade.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Columba

texts.es:
Columba considers herself a very honest, hardworking, and nice person. She is married and her husband is a merchant. They have 3 children. She began her business because her husband used to be a security guard, and the salary he received wasn’t enough to support the family. Little by little, they got together some capital. Then her husband came down with a heart condition, and he could no longer work. They decided to invest their capital by buying small commercial properties and then renting them out. This was due to a stroke of good luck, because a friend of her husband’s offered them a piece of land at a good price and they were able to buy it. They began by building one small property and with the rent they received from that, they continued building. They now have 4 properties.

Columba is requesting a loan of $550.00 to remodel and make some repairs at one of their properties. They would also like to put a bathroom in another building, because it doesn’t have one. She offers to repay the loan in 5 months. She thanks you for your support in helping her to maintain this business and provide good service to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Columba se considera una mujer muy honesta, trabajadora y simpática, esta casada y su esposo es comerciante, ellos tienen 3 hijos, ella inició su negocio por que su esposo antes era vigilante y el sueldo que percibía no les alcanzaba para mantener a su familia y poco a poco juntaron un capital y su esposo enfermo del corazón, así que ya no podía trabajar, por ello invirtieron su capital en la compra de locales comerciales pequeños para luego rentarlos, y todo fue por oportunidad, ya que el amigo de su esposo les ofreció un terreno a un buen precio y pudieron adquirirlo, iniciaron construyendo un localcito y con la renta del mismo continuaron construyendo y a la fecha ya tienen 4 locales.

Columba ahora esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 550 para remodelar y darle mantenimiento a sus locales, así como construirle el baño a uno de los locales que le hace falta, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 5 meses. Ella agradece mucho tu apoyo para continuar manteniendo su negocio y brindando un buen servicio a sus clientes.

loans.use: To remodel and make repairs to her business properties

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah owns the Mirembe Drug and Clinic Shop. Her business is the only one of its kind in the area. This is important for her over-the-counter medicines and her advice is essential to the health care of the villagers. Although her stock is limited, she takes great care in making sure that she keeps needed health care items in her inventory.

Sarah has operated her business for 7 years and she has been a member of her lending group for the same period of time. She is married with 5 children and she is 40 years old. She is a very kind and gentle person who cares deeply about her community. Her dream is to complete the building of her house and to make sure that her children get a good education. With her loan she plans to add to her health care products.

loans.use: To add to her health care products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her clothes and shoes business.

loans.name: Kabowa 1(A) Group

texts.en:
The group has been together for one year. Each memeber has their own current businesses and reasons for acquiring loans. Florence has a poultry farm; Dorothy has a saloon business; Sumaya sells raw foods; Fiona sells crafts. Harriet, the group leader, is 40 years old. She sells raw foods in the market. She intends to use the extra profits to construct a house and pay school fees for the children.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase more raw foods, thus expand business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in his rice crop/harvest.

loans.name: Veasna

texts.en:
Mr. Veasna P. and his wife, Yin Sam, have been married since 1991. They have three children; two sons and one daughter, two of whom are employed full time. The other is in school. The family lives in a Phnom Penh suburb.

Mr. Veasna has been a motor taxi driver for two years. He carries people around Phnom Penh City. His wife has been a garment factory worker over ten years.

Mr. Veasna is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $1200 to repair his house.

loans.use: To repair his house

loans.name: Sadatu

texts.en:
Sadatu is forty two years old and the mother of two children, who are currently in school. She prepares and sells “Tuo Zaafi” (a local dish prepared from maize and cassava flour). It is a popular food in the Northern Regions of Ghana and also a delicacy for most Ghanaians. Sadatu wants to use her loan to buy more bags of maize, assorted meat, dry fish, vegetables, spices, etc. to prepare her food.

She is a member of the group called “Baa Meyi” (meaning no one is bigger than God). Members use group guarantee principle on members to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: Sadatu would like to buy more bags of maize, assorted meat, vegetables, spices, etc.

loans.name: Bunneang

texts.en:
Mrs. Bunneang K. and her husband, Mr. Ngoun Men were married in 1985 and have four children, two sons and two daughters. Two of their children have full time employment and other two children are in school. Mr. Ngoun Men has been a taxi driver since 1979. He drives in Phnom Penh and other provinces. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Bunneang has been in the business of selling groceries for three years. She bought grocery items from the Ta Khmao Market to resell at her shop in front of her house. The shop is very old and broken so she needs some money to rebuild it. Now she is requesting a loan of US$600 to rebuild her shop to sell grocery items.

loans.use: To rebuild her shop for selling grocery items.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy body cream

loans.name: Progreso Group

texts.es:
The group Progreso consists of 15 members, all women, who meet in the house of Ms Doris M. located on pagador street.

They meet every Thursday afternoon in accordance with their weekly plan.

Name of member, Activity, Sex, Years in the field

B. H. KARL., Beauty product sales, Female, 4

C. C. CARMEN JEANETH, Sale of masitas and sandwiches, Female, 3

F. G. MARTHA, Food sales, Female, 10

F. M. CONCEPCIÓN, Sale of rellenos and food, Femalwe, 25

F. V. GLORIA DEYSI, Sale of enlozados, Female, 30

G. V. PAULINA, Sale of varieties, Female, 4

I. G. MARIA JOSE, Sale of masitas, Female, 5

L. M. FABIANA ELVIRA, Sale of products, Female, 3

M. B. DORIS, Craftwork, Female, 5

M. Y. MARIA ELENA, Sale of products, Female, 5

O. P. CLAUDIA ELIZABETH, Sale of fabrics and masitas, Female, 10

B. A. IVONE MABEL, Baking and masitas, Female, 12

T. G. JHENNY CLAUDIA, Sale of cosmetics, Female, 2

T. P. LUISA ANGELICA, Sale of varieties, Female, 10

Z. D. L. B. ANA LOURDES, Sale of varieties, Female, 30

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne, Kiva volunteer.

El grupo Progreso consta D. 15 integrantes siendo el 100% mujeres, se reunen en L. casa D. L. señora Doris M. ubicado en L. calle pagador.

Se reunen todos los días jueves por L. tarD. D. acuerdo a su plan semanal.

Nombre del socio Actividad Sexo Años en el Rubro

B. H. KARL. VENTA D. PRODUCTOS D. BELLEZA Femenino 4

C. C. CARMEN JEANETH VENTA D. MASITAS Y TORTAS Femenino 3

F. G. MARTHA VENTA D. COMIDAS Femenino 10

F. M. CONCEPCIÓN VENTA D. RELLENOS Y COMIDA Femenino 25

F. V. GLORIA DEYSI VENTA D. ENLOZADOS Femenino 30

G. V. PAULINA VENTA D. VARIEDADES Femenino 4

I. G. MARIA JOSE VENTA D. MASITAS Femenino 5

L. M. FABIANA ELVIRA VENTA D. PRODUCTOS Femenino 3

M. B. DORIS ELABORACIÓN D. ARTESANIAS Femenino 5

M. Y. MARIA ELENA VENTA D. PRODUCTOS Femenino 15

O. P. CLAUDIA ELIZABETH VENTA D. TEJIDOS Y MASITAS Femenino 10

B. A. IVONE MABEL ELABORACIÓN E MASITAS Femenino 12

T. G. JHENNY CLAUDIA VENTA D. COSMETICOS Femenino 2

T. P. LUISA ANGELICA VENTA D. VARIEDADES Femenino 10

Z. D. L. B. ANA LOURDES VENTA D. VARIEDADES Femenino 30

loans.use: Capital for operations

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr:
Massan V., age 39, is married and the mother of 3 children. She's a fish reseller in Avetonou, a village located approximately 100 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this loan, she'd like to meet customer demand by buying more fish and ingredients. In doing so, she will increase her profits to better support her family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer.

Massan V. est âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de poissons à Avetonou, un village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il souhaite par ce crédit satisfaire la demande de la clientèle en achetant beaucoup plus de poissons et des ingrédients. Ce faisant elle dégagera plus de bénéfices pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy more fish and ingredients

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 8 años, su esposo es comerciante. Ella inició el negocio por la necesidad de apoyar en el gasto familiar, siempre le han gustado las ventas, por lo cual se dedico a esto, empezó vendiendo joyería entre su amigos y conocidos y poco a poco fue haciendo una cartera de clientes.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y así poder cumplir unos pedidos que tiene pendientes.
texts.en:
Francisca is married and has two children who are ten and eight years old. Her husband is a salesman. She started the business to help with household expenses. She has always liked sales and for that reason started selling jewelry to her friends and acquaintances and little by little built a client base. She needs a loan for US$575, which she will repay in six months, to buy merchandise and thereby be able to fill orders that she has pending.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Farheen

texts.en: Farheen baji, the wife of B. A., has lived in an area of Lahore, Pakistan named Yadgar for the last 22 years. She is the mother of two preschool-aged daughters. Farheen baji's husband, who has made lath machines for the last nine years, sells them in various Pakistani cities.  Farheen is applying for a loan to buy spare parts to make another lath machine in order to earn a good profit.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to make a lath machine.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica A. sells drinks at wholesale and retail. In the evenings, she prepares and sells fried meat and pepper soup. She needs the loan to purchase more drinks and bottled water to sell. Veronica is 38 years old and is married with three children. She says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and bottled water to sell

loans.name: Luz Maritza

texts.es:
La señora Luz Maritza Pérez  señora tiene la edad de 53 años, su estado civil es soltera, esta Señora tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solo 3 de sus hijos dependen de ella su hijo mayor tiene la edad de 27 años y trabaja por cuenta propia, su hija de 35 años trabaja de forma independiente vendiendo productos de la avon y su otra hija de 33 trabaja con ella en le mercado de la Estación, sus deseos son de tener su propio establecimiento ya que todavía no tiene un lugar estable para ofrecer sus productos, en sus propósitos esta el proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda quiere acondicionarla de una forma sencilla pero que este sea a la ves un lugar sencillo  donde sus hijos y ella puedan permanecer tranquilos.


Su actividad económica es la de  mercadería en general en la que vende los productos como: pantalones, camisas, bolsos, gorras y lentes para el sol, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 35 años, su negocio da comienzo por que su mama ya tenia la experiencia de vender ropa y desde la edad de 15 años ella ayudaba a su mama en este negocio y al fallecer su mama es Doña Luz Marina quien se hace cargo de este negocio y así es como lo obtiene, el financiamiento es para  capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de sus productos ya que tiene que abastecerse para ofrecer los diferentes tipos de productos ya que se acercan los días festivos y así aprovechar la ocasión.
texts.en:
Luz Maritza P. is 53 years old, is single and has four children, three of whom live with her. Her older son is 27 years old and is self-employed, her 35 year old daughter works independently selling Avon products, and her 33 year old daughter works with Luz in the Estación market. Her goals include having her own store, as she still doesn't have a fixed location to offer her products. She also hopes to make simple improvements to her home so that it will be a place where she and her children can live peacefully. She works selling clothing including pants, blouses, bags, gloves and sunglasses. She has run this business for 35 years. The business was started by her mother who already had experience selling clothes, and Luz started helping her mother with the business when she was 15 years old. When her mother passed away Luz took charge of the business. The loan is for working capital that will be used to increase her stock of products as the festive season approaches.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Un

texts.en: Un S., 47, lives with her husband and two of her five children in the Siem Reap Province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make $5.5 each day. During the past year, the weather conditions have been difficult in Cambodia and inflation has also been spiraling out of control. These factors have led to a difficult economic year for many Cambodians including Un S.. She is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase fertilizer and gas for the farm. She hopes this will help increase her current profits and prospects for the future.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and gas

loans.name: Benkadi (Bonne Entente) Group

texts.fr:
Les sept femmes du groupe Benkadi de l’association Sérieux  de Bougoula Ville(toutes  mariées), ont en moyenne  28 ans et 2 enfants et vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies  dans le quartier  Bougoula ville de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mlai).
Elles  exercent la même activité commerciale à savoir la vente de pomme de terre et  quelques fois des patates, des choux pommés et  de la banane plantain. Pour mener à bien leur activité et  satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle, ils sont à leur huitième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).Les prêts précédents se sont bien dénoués.
Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 5 sacs de 100kg de pomme de terre. Elles s’approvisionnent sur place à Sikasso ville (3eme Région administrative du Mali) et dans les villages environnants auprès des paysans producteurs.
Les produits sont vendus en détail et au comptant dans les différents marchés de la ville de Sikasso (Médine, grand marché de la ville), dans le quartier à domicile à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes et de quelques hommes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 27 000 FCFA par mois qu’elles utiliseront pour soutenir les conjoints dans la prise en charge de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités. 
Chacune d’elle souhaite devenir une grossiste en allant au prêt individuel..
texts.en:
The seven women (all married) of the group Benkadi of the association Sérieux de Bougoula Ville average 28 years of age and two children. They live in traditional extended families in the Bougoula Ville district of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They each do the same kind of commerce, namely the sale of potatoes and sometimes sweet potatoes, cabbages, and plantains. To carry out their work and satisfy their customers, they are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which they are on their eighth solidarity loan (group loan). The preceding loans were settled.

The group members plan to use this loan to buy five 100-kg sacks of potatoes. They stock up locally in Sikasso and in surrounding villages from peasant growers. The goods are sold retail for cash in the different marketplaces of Sikasso (Médine, the grand marketplace of the city) and in the district out of their homes. Customers are composed essentially of women and some men.

The group members each hope to realize a monthly profit of 27,000 francs CFA that they will use to support their spouses in caring for their families and to invest the rest in their businesses. Each of the women in the group would like to become a wholesaler while taking out individual loans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potatoes

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce has owned a small shop in the Tengeru neighborhood of Arusha for 5 years. She belongs to Neema group. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $175. Every day she works at her business from 8am to 21.30pm. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Joyce is 22 years old, married, and has one child.

loans.use: To buy more items to increase her stock.

loans.name: Luaupu

texts.en:
Luaupu F., 30, is married with four children. She has four years of experience in the bingo business. She sells to the general public/villagers three days per week. She has had three previous loans with SPBD, Kiva's partner. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 750 Tala (about $312).

SPBD loans are Luaupu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will help pay her children's school fees because the business is running well and it is generating enough income for her family to survive on.

loans.use: To pay her children's school fees

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea H., born in 1942, is the widowed mother of six children; three of them are single and the other three are married and live away from the family home. She currently runs a business by mobile transportation selling a little clothes and medicines at her client's house. Chea H.'s investment is going very well and she has gained more income, because she is skilled in communication. To earn additional income and to make her business more successful, she is asking for a loan to accrue business capital. (She and her daughter are pictured.)

loans.use: To accrue her business capital

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.fr:
A. Madeleine est âgée de 38 ans; elle est mariée à SAGBO Claude. Madeleine a deux enfants tous scolarisés. Madeleine réside à Gbégamey un quartier populaire de Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Madeleine vend dans le marché de Gbégamey de beignets faits à base du haricot ou du blé; elle frit aussi des tubercules d'igname et de pomme de terre. Grâce à cette activité Madeleine arrive à supporter une partie des charges du ménage notamment la scolarité des enfants. Madeleine a déjà bénéficié de prêt de ALIDé pour renforcer son fonds de roulement. Actuellement Madeleine sollicite un nouveau prêt toujours dans le cadre du renforcement de son fonds de roulement afin de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
Madeleine A., age 38, is married to Claude SAGBO. She has two children, who both attend school. She lives in Gbégamey, a working-class neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Madeleine sells beignets (a kind of doughnut) made out of bean at the Gbégamey market. She also fries yams and potatoes. Thanks to this business, she manages to pay for part of the household expenses, notably her children's schooling. Madeleine already benefited from loan from Kiva's partner, Alidé, to bolster her working capital. Now, she's seeking a new loan, still to bolster her working capital, in order to better meet customer demand.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of beans, sacks of wheat, yams, and potatoes,

loans.name: Gnoem

texts.en:
Mrs. S., 27, lives in Kompong Tom Province, Cambodia. She earns a living by selling a few grocery items from her house for her neighbors. She has a long experience in this business. S. is married and currently takes care of two children; both of them are single and also attend school. Her husband has owned a machine to charge the villagers' batteries to earn income for the family.

The family's living conditions are not so comfortable because the roof of their house is leaky during rains. Because of this problem, S. has requested a loan to replace their old roof.

loans.use: To replace their old roof

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma L. is about 43 years old. She is married with five children. They live in the peaceful village of Barangay Cambong in Lallo, Cagayan. Thelma raises hogs and also sells fruits and vegetables in their village. She earns PHP 250 a day in income from vending. Some of the income is invested in hog raising and some is used to pay for her family's basic needs and the allowances of her children who are still studying. She is thankful that her husband accompanies her in their business undertakings.

Three of Thelma's children are currently attending school and so, together with her husband, she is working hard. She is seeking the support of lenders to loan her even the small amount of PHP 4000 to maintain her hog raising and vending business. She hopes to diversify her business someday to create a brighter future for her children. Thelma says that she believes that through this loan, she will be able to pursue all her business plans with patience, hard work, and trust.

loans.use: To mainain her hog raising business and diversify her vending inventory.

loans.name: Bùi Thị

texts.en:
X. Bùi Thị (803991516) is a 29-year-old woman living in the town of Ý Yên. She is married and has 2 infant children. To earn a living, X. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising cattle for sale. X. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,900,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 1999, X. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. X. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. X. is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be the 10th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund. X. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve/expand her business.

loans.use: used to purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes R. C. tiene 32 años, vive en el distrito de El Porvenir, en la provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Secundaria Completa, tiene 5 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
Mercedes se dedica a la fabricación de calzado, su taller esta ubicado en su domicilio, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo para la fabricación de dicho calzado, los cuales son vendidos a tiendas comerciales ubicados en Trujillo y Chiclayo.
Sus materiales son adquiridos en tiendas comerciales ubicados en el distrito donde vive (El Porvenir). 
Recién ha ingresado como socia del Banco Comunal Viva con Esperanza II.
Con este crédito de 300 soles lo invertirá en la compra de tacos, cuero, badana y cajas esenciales para la fabricación y venta de su producto (calzado).  
Mercedes tiene como sueño ampliar su taller, adquirir nuevas maquinas para fabricar calzado, generarse mejores ingresos y brindar comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Mercedes R. C. is 32 years old and lives in the El Porvenir district in the Trujillo province of La Libertad, Perú. She completed her secondary school education and has 5 children who depend on her financially. Mercedes dedicates herself to making shoes, and her workshop is located right in her own home. She has the support of her husband for making said shoes, which she sells in the stores located in Trujillo and Chiclayo. She acquires her materials in the stores located in the district where she lives (El Porvenir). She has recently joined as a member of the Live with Hope II cooperative bank. With this loan of 300 soles, she will invest in the purchase of heels, leather and boxes for making and selling her product (footwear). Mercedes dreams of expanding her workshop, buying new machinery for making shoes, generating more income, and providing comforts for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase heels, leather, and boxes, essential for making and selling her product.

loans.name: Jose Roberto

texts.es: El Señor José M. N. tiene 44 años. Es un hombre casado. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo.
